I can't believe that they gave the fans more of the video game characters they love, as well as scenes that feel like an in game boss battle, and somehow it's an overall worse film than any of the ones before it...I literally forgot what the plot was more than once and the whole thing is as basic as possible.

better then Resident Evil: Degeneration, Resident Evil: Damnation, Resident Evil, Resident Evil: Apocalypse, Resident Evil: Extinction, and Resident Evil: Afterlife. but i just hope hope hope that hot Milla Jovovich is back as Alice a sixth and a final time in such a movie as resident evil 6 better then Resident Evil: Degeneration, Resident Evil: Damnation, Resident Evil, Resident Evil: Apocalypse, Resident Evil: Extinction, and Resident Evil: Afterlife. but i just hope hope hope that hot Milla Jovovich is back as Alice a sixth and a final time in such a movie as resident evil 6 better then Resident Evil: Degeneration, Resident Evil: Damnation, Resident Evil, Resident Evil: Apocalypse, Resident Evil: Extinction, and Resident Evil: Afterlife. but i just hope hope hope that hot Milla Jovovich is back as Alice a sixth and a final time in such a movie as resident evil 6 better then Resident Evil: Degeneration, Resident Evil: Damnation, Resident Evil, Resident Evil: Apocalypse, Resident Evil: Extinction, and Resident Evil: Afterlife. but i just hope hope hope that hot Milla Jovovich is back as Alice a sixth and a final time in such a movie as resident evil 6

I gave this movie a rating of 9 out of 10 as it is awesome!! Coming to the fifth movie of this series, I gotta say the writer did a very good job. I appreciate how the writer can keep the movie interesting without adding anything new to it. After all it's all about the Umbrella Cooperation and how it tries to kill Alice. The story is intense, audiences can really feel the emotions and excitement in it. Each and every scene of this movie is excellent. The 3D effect is cool and the slow motions are making this movie even more attractive.There are LOTS of gun shots and fighting scenes in this movie, more like people-to-people than people-to-zombie, which quite disappoints me. I expect more zombie thing in it.(I know it's hard to keep it fresh with the some old zombies but I just can't help myself from expecting that!) I love seeing gross things, luckily there are monsters coming around which fulfills my desire.By the way, Milla Jovovich is super hot and sexy in this movie, I don't think this movie will be as good as now without her.This movie is definitely highly recommendable!! overall rating: 9/10

Resident Evil Retribution 3D.**** Please note that my review does contain spoilers so read on, knowing that I talk about the film.Firstly the franchise have really gone to town on ripping off the public, show the film only in 3d, does that mean that when the film comes out to buy, (probably before Christmas 2012) that we can only buy the film in 3D?, that would mean that the majority that are fans of the franchise will not be able to buy the film unless they have a 3d TV and 3d blu ray player.So why make fans of the series have to spend extra money on the film just because we the public don't get a choice between 2d or 3d.The film is supposed to continue from the last film , and within the opening sequence within 10 minutes we have a flashback to give the link to why, and then the film continue's trying to make a consistent story.To me the story is weak and a few new character's appear which don't really have a story to how or why they should be really in the film, apart from the obvious, lets have a spin off in the future if this film is successful. OR release a game within a 5 days of releasing the latest film.Mila plays Alice and looks fantastic but is the character and the real story which has now been put over 5 films and 10 years in the making. Question surely is how much longer can this series continue?1.Resident Evil (2002)2.Resident Evil: Apocalypse (2004)3.Resident Evil: Extinction (2007)4.Resident Evil: Afterlife (2010)5.Resident Evil: Retribution (2012)

The Resident Evil series is a guilty pleasure of mine and this movie was just a blast from the beginning to the end. Milla Jovovich is so fun to watch as Alice. This the 5th installment of the franchise is visual masterpiece. With the additions of Ada,Leon and Boris add so much to this movie. If you are a fan of the games and have been a complainer about the movies may not follow the game well this one fixes all of that. If you go see this movie I fell you must see it in 3D as I did. Every cheesy gimmick of things flying at the screen is in this and well it works that is what a 3D movie is supposed to do. You pay extra to see stuff come at you so why not do some overkill. A surprise in the plot comes at you within 10 minutes from the start. This movie is so entertaining with fights,action,sound and yes even got startled a couple times. Go enjoy this movie and even if you have never seen the series. This movie explains a lot at the beginning. Get out of your house and go enjoy!!!!

Review title: This movie Kills!! RE: Retribution FTW!!
Review_body: First, I'm no reviewer, but this movie delivered. So I just wanted to say a few things about it. I don't play the games, so I don't suffer from the hate people seem to have of Resident Evil movies. This movie is the best of the series in my opinion. Though none of these movies have a really in depth protagonist arc per say, I still enjoy them. The other RE movies were hit or miss with lack luster plots and kind of lame scenes. RE: Retribution on the other hand surpasses them, mainly because of its simple yet effective plot. RE: Retribution seriously brought the madness this time around, from the beginning to the very ending... a mad house! This movie is what it is, and that is good! Saw this at AMC Imax in Austin just a few minutes ago, it was effing nuts! Can't wait for the next.

I absolutely loved Resident Evil: Retribution. It's far better than 2 and 4 ...and better than 3-rd one. Now, let me explain why:1. The storyline cleverly ties things from all previous movies. 2.Milla looks superb - sexy, beautiful and having a blast. She looks much more prettier here than in RE4. 3. The return of my all time fav Milla's outfit - two sheets of papaper covering naked body ;-) 4.Action never looked better in Resident Evil (the car chase in Moscow is amazing). 5. Milla's fights - as good as in RE3. G-R-E-A-T. 6. The scene in the factory of clones. "I'm your mother now". Great moment 7.Cool homage to Aliens. 8. Inventive score. 9. Visual effects - more photorealistic than in Avangersand other plastic-fantastic 4-times-biiger-budget summer attractions. 10. Epic scope. Grand scale. 11. Paul Anderson's direction - wide shoots, some Mulcahy's style shoots. 12. Doube ending with a nice cliffhanger. 13. Suburban sequence. 14. "The return to suburban| sequence. 15. Some unexpected twists.All to all - The great return to the for RE franchise.

The Resident Evil franchise has been good to me. In this review I can only voice my own interest in the franchise, I should also note that the Resident Evil series should not be seen as films, but as mere products to help sell the next video game. That is of no consequence to me, I understand what to expect before I pay for my ticket, and I've known what to expect ever since I paid to see Resident Evil: Apocalypse. I have been a loyal fan of the series since its inception, and I managed to see the first movie on DVD when I was about 14 years old. At first I didn't think the movie was good, I thought it was disgraceful. But, gradually the first Resident Evil movie became my guilty pleasure. I've somehow learned not to pay attention to the storyline, because there is none, you won't find a storyline in the Resident Evil movies, they purely stand on their own, and the only thing that holds them is its leading lady, Milla Jovovich. The reason for such an ambiguous approach is that more sequels could be milked until people get sick of them. Here's what I love about Retribution, and all those other movies that came before it. Two words. Milla Jovovich. Milla Jovovich is an iconic and legendary figure in the action genre. Just like Greta Garbo was queen of the silent era, and Bette Davis the queen of the talking picture, Milla Jovovich owns the action genre. There is never a dull moment when Milla Jovovuch is kicking ass, shooting her weapons in glorious slow motion, and not to mention her high-flying kicks. This babe is what has transcended the entire Resident Evil series into art. Yes, I said ART. The art of ass-kicking has never looked so good with Milla in her tight spandex, blazing sub-machine-guns in 3D. If you want a reason to watch this movie, then there it is. Paul W.S. Anderson is no hack either, he's interesting as an action director, more so than abysmal hacks like Luc Besson, even more so than Robert Rodriguez. I also love his futuristic set piece, you must admit that they are very creative. As long as Milla Jovovich stars in these movies, they can count on my 15 bucks to watch her. For those complaining about the movies not being like the games, you try and a adapt a video game into a movie! To make a film out of a video game, you need to recreate the entire thing, because all you do in the games is solve puzzles and shoot at zombies for countless hours. How can you make any kind of cinema out of that? It's impossible. It;s like trying to drive a car without an engine, you have a good looking body, but no engine to make it go. And that's what Resident Evil games are in a nutshell, they look good and scary - but that's about it.

After the first 4 successful films, we have the fifth installment. Okay, so the idea is that the whole film is a simulation, and that carlos and rain are fake. The story is quite interesting, The character development was good, Leon, barry, Luther, and 2 various characters were all a team. Each character was done very well. My favorite was Ada, her and alice fight side by side throughout the entire film. I was a little disappointed that there wasn't enough wesker, but hey, I won't give out too many spoilers. The effects were great, great acting, great plot, and great characters. Resident evil fans will love this film. -Don't worry Ashley! I'm coming for you!- Leon

I almost walked out from this one. It was almost a B movie. The effects were like the only good parts of the movie. The previous Resident Evil movies were a lot better than this one. I frankly found this one to be quite disappointing. Too many scenes with blazing guns. The actors lines were often dry and amateur sounding. I almost feel sorry for the actors who probably may have thought that this one was not like the previous movies. There were hardly any zombie scenes either in this one. I could never watch this one again. I supposed this movie is more for like younger teens and video game addicts. Its really just a shooter. This one is not worth watching at the cinema. Wait for the DVD version if you wanna see it instead.

Firstly I would just like to say that I am not a hater of these films, I am a huge fan of the resident evil franchise. The first film in the franchise is one of my favourite horror films that I have seen. I was really looking forward to the film, I have watched the trailer quite a few times in anticipation and I was so pleased when it was finally released here in the UK. I have just returned from the cinema, and for the first time ever with a Resident Evil film, I was left disappointed and bored. The action scenes, we have all see before in the previous films, they were too loud, stupid and seemed rushed in places. The acting was just about bearable, although Milla Jovovich, Michelle Rodriguez and Aryana Engineer did do the best with what they were given. And there was no story whatsoever. The set pieces were all too familiar, Anderson seems to be recycling parts from previous films.Another aspect of the franchise I am not liking is the constant change to Alice. In the first film she had no powers, then in Apocalypse, Alice was injected with the t-virus giving her superhuman abilities, which constantly evolve throughout the third film, Extinction. Then at the start of Afterlife, her powers are removed by a serum injected by Albert Wesker, making her human again, and now at the end of Retribution, Wesker injects her again with another virus making her superhuman again. It just seems to me that Paul W. S. Anderson is just making the storyline up as he makes these films. The slo-mo scenes were just about watchable in the previous film, but there are far too many of them in this film. There weren't many aspects of this film that I like, but one of the more positive reasons is the return of the original cast from the first Resident Evil film. It was nice to see Michelle Rodriguez and Colin Salmon return to the franchise, but the idea of them being clones just doesn't make any sense. Another positive were the zombies and the mutants looked really good. I never normally agree with the critics, the first four Resident Evil films all received negative reviews, but I thoroughly enjoyed all of them. This film, however, is the first that I do agree with the critics. It's wasn't as good as I hoped it was, and maybe this franchise has finally run its course. After this film I don't know if I will watch another Resident Evil film.Overall this is the weakest film in the franchise. And that is from an avid fan of the previous films.

I love the Resident Evil films. This one I was particularly excited for because of the return of Michelle Rodriguez, who I always love.The good? There is very little downtime here. If you're looking to watch an hour and a half of shoot outs and explosions, this movie is for you. As always the actors are great, (and lets face it, great to look at). It had a cool intro as well.The bad? The plot. Why? Because there basically isn't one. There is no character development (although there was some fun in seeing different characters). For all the action that does occur in the film, the plot could be done within five minutes. This movie is very obviously a filler, just a short piece of blood and explosions to explain how Alice and the others fared from the end of the last movie to the start of the next. Moreover, after this many Resident Evils, most of the fighting techniques have already been seen. In the end, if you're a Resident Evil fan I suggest watching it simply so you'll know where you stand when the next movie comes out. If you're not, you might want to pass.

Review title: Shameful waste of a great franchise
Review_body: I'm a big fan of the RE movie franchise, even though I've never played the games. Milla Jovovich is an action heroine of the highest calibre, always bringing charm, humour and a hardass attitude to the films. However, this outing is an embarrassment. I'm sure it was intended to be a high-octane non-stop thrill ride of an action roller-coaster (or some such journalistic expression), but it turns out to be a single, never-ending action scene with no redeeming qualities.There's no story. There's no characterisation. There's no suspense. The dialogue is appalling and is almost universally delivered as if it was made up on the spot and voiced by robots without personality. The dramatic scenes are painfully bad. There's no tongue-in-cheek humour to carry the drama. For that matter, there's no drama.The action scenes are patently ridiculous. The bad guys can't hit anything with 40,000 rounds of ammo; they can't even stop a normal car with a 50-cal. The good guys can kill anyone - as long as they're not a bad guy with a name - with a single shot, and only need a single clip to get them through several hundred enemies. Even the "biohazards" are pathetically weak, not to mention rare.In the end, it's a story about Alice - who we do care about because, y'know, she's Alice - escaping from somewhere we don't care about. She gets help from other people we don't care about, has to save a child we don't care about, and does so in such a long, painfully arduous way that, by half-way through, I rather wished she'd die and get it over with.Even the finale - which is without any twists - consists of an interminably long, stupid, tension-free fight scene where all the good guys suddenly become incompetent and can't kill anyone.An insult to everyone involved. If they make a sixth, I hope Anderson realises his writing skills are non-existent and gets a proper story.

Review title: Not the thing I was actually expecting
Review_body: At the trailer I was so psyched about watching it I thought it would be the old fashioned yet unique style of Zombie films but the arrangement of the scenes are very screwed up the scenes that audiences thought would be the last is the first scenes, people would be very disappointed and even though it is already 2013 I have not yet recovered from the movie's story and arrangement. The movie is liked a video game cut short in an hour and a half, this movie is supposed to make other zombie films trash but instead it made itself trash, because all of the brilliant ideas has already been given to the first,second and third installments. The movie was pointless, it made me looked embarrassed for making my family to watch this trash, but Jovovich' acting was amazing but she did not deserve to be in this garbage.

I love all the Resident Evil films, but this was probably one of my favorites in the franchise. For starters, it was great to see many familiar faces return to the screen for this installment. The return of Michelle Rodriguez, Sienna Guillory, Oded Fehr, and Colin Salmon was terrific. Although the acting was a bit contrived, it didn't really dampen my enjoyment of this movie because the action scenes, fight sequences, special effects, and the music was simply top notch. One of my favorite things about this film (as in all of these films) is the leading ladies. Jovovich, Rodriguez, Guillory, and Bingbing Li stole the spotlight as the primary fighters and they didn't disappoint. No damsels in distress here! Not only can the women keep up with the guys, but they excel at it. A lot of times, the kids in these kinds of movies can be irritating, but that was not the case with Becky, at least for me. I thought she was adorable and sweet. See? Kids don't always have to be pouting brats. :) The final fight scene was the best part of the whole movie and Jovovich and Guillory killed it. I also loved watching Rodriguez square off with Luther and Leon, despite the fact that they were easily twice her size, though the loss of Luther was heartbreaking. I was also relieved that Jill was freed from the influence of the Red Queen. Loved her in Apocalypse. It was an interesting twist that Wesker turned against Umbrella to help save mankind and I'm curious to see how he turns out in the next film and whether or not Alice makes good on her promise to kill him. I also hope to see the return of Chris and Clair Redfield. Very enjoyable film if you can look past the somewhat hokey acting and I look forward to the next installment.

So you wake up in the morning bored , tired of whatever it is you usually do. I KNOW!! I'm going to write movies !Three days later and the Script is ready - Resident Evil Retribution.........Utter garbage once again in this failed attempt at a resident evil movie. The first one was good and showed serious promise to the story but as it's gone on it's become hilariousStories that make no sense , same actors appearing even though clearly died in other movies beforehand ( no not as zombies) oh then zombies with weird worm mouth things , computer cyborg people thingys. Just stop please I beg thee.If you want to watch a movie with a hot chic in tight clothing showing loads of cameltoe pointlessly kicking the poop out of stuff while some very questionable acting is provided by the raining cast ( with the exception of Rodriguez) then by all means you will love this stain on history. But if you like movies give this one a miss lol

This is what happened when the crew decided to make this movie. Paul S. Anderson met his crew and asked them:"OK people let's get some ideas about what this movie will have."Staff#1 "-hey, how about we make it like the new games and make it a shoot fest?" Paul S. Anderson- "Sounds good, Done!" Staff#2 "Wouldn't it be cool if the zombies could drive cars and motorcycles and carry weapons and chainsaws?" Paul S. Anderson- "Sounds good to me, Done!"Staff#3- "you remember when Claire and Alice fought that giant axe guy in the fourth film? How about this time we let Alice fight two of them?" Paul S. Anderson- "Good idea, Done!" Staff #1-"You know the fans want to see other characters so why not introduce a few more like Leon, Ada and Barry?" Paul S. Anderson- "Sounds good, Done!" Staff#2-"Aren't we going to have too many characters running around? How about we kill off one or two?" Staff#3-"We'll kill off Barry. Anyway he's an expendable character in the game." Staff #1-" Yeah but make it a heroic death. Let's have him go out in a blaze of glory brandishing his famous magnum. Fans like that sort of thing" Paul S. Anderson- "Sounds good, Done!" Staff#2-" Hey I was watching Aliens the other day,wouldn't it be cool if Alice became a mother figure to some unknown little girl who gets kidnapped by a lichor and Alice has to save her like Ripley did?"Paul S. Anderson- "Sounds good but we'll have to rework the lichors somehow. Done!" Staff#3- "People liked the characters from the first film. It would be cool if we could bring them back somehow. It's a shame they got blown off with raccoon city." Staff#2-"Hey if they can clone Alice why not her friends?" Staff#3-" You're so right man. But where did hey get the DNA?" Staff#2-" Does it matter?" Staff#3-" It's just another Umbrella mystery. What do you think Paul?" Paul S.Anderson- "Sounds good, OK people let's make this movie."In the bathroom next to the meeting hall you hear a toilet flush. The fourth staff person comes out.Staff#4- "Hey guys, sorry I'm late but I have a great idea for the story. If ties up all the loose ends. Umbrella finally falls. The cure for the plague is found and the world is saved. I also worked on a great script and intelligent dialogue. I even have a great idea for coaching some of the mediocre actors into believable ones."Paul S. Anderson- "What are you talking about? We just worked out some great ideas. Lots of action, explosions, new characters. We have everything the fans want. As for acting? Did you see the first game? The lame voice acting did not deter its fans. These actors will do plenty fine for the fans. C'mon let's make this movie!"And this is why this movie turned out the way it did.

After watching the first four instalments, I don't really see any need for this film to exist. It just rehashes bits and bobs from previous RE movies, and adds absolutely nothing to the series. I think I'm being generous with two stars...I clicked on the option that there's no spoilers here, but to be honest, this movie spoils the franchise itself. The only reason you'll like this movie is if the "lickers" were your favourite thing about the game, and it's debatable as to whether they actually make his worth watching.

Review title: wow all the movies are bad not just this one
Review_body: Look im gonna cut to the chase, when i first played resident evil on my ps1 the first scenes were SCARY, resident evil games are SCARY, this movie is NOT SCARY whatsoever, how can a video game out fright a motion picture? Its not just that though, its like the makers thought hey lets make resident evil matrix style to give it flair, well it doesn't. I don't rate any of the resident evil franchise, i mean the first movie when she's fly kicking a dog, so fake, they should have slowed the pace more and made it more i don't know.........REAL, the video game eats this movie for breakfast, the walking dead eats the whole franchise for breakfast, give me 28 days later anyday. the best part of this whole franchise was the fight with wesker and that was taken from the game itself, what does that tell you?..........EPIC FAIL

Review title: It is not even close to what you will be expecting!!
Review_body: I was eagerly looking forward to the 5th installment of this series and I am sorry to say that I have been really let down! Apart from the once in a while visuals, the movie has not been able to get even close to expectations. The first 10 minutes of the movie and you will start feeling disconnected from the movie already not caring at all what is gonna happen in the next scene. After resident evil 3 & 4, I was expecting a lot out of this installment and from Paul W.S. Anderson but he has not been able to live up the mark at all. The action scenes rather than being nail-biting, turned out to be hilarious and funny. There isn't a single moment in the movie where you are actually glued to screen. Milla Jovovich looks pretty as always, but that won't save the movie. All others have done a horrible job with their acting, especially Sienna Guillory. I would say that the only reason you would want to watch this movie is if you are a fan of the resident evil series and you don't mind wasting your money and time for the sake of this series.

I always like zombie movies. There are so many zombie movies that I like. But for Resident evil movies I always feel different. Zombies in this movie are different than other classical zombies. Though I liked 1st and 2nd movie of this series. But then later movies were not so impressive.And now I watched Retribution and I can say that if it would have been a video game rather than a movie then I would have definitely enjoyed this. This movie was so predictable. While watching this movie you can tell what is going to happen next. Same old actions, same old monsters, same old faces .Paul W.S. Anderson was good in directing 1st movie, but I couldn't understand what he was thinking while creating this movie. If you like actions without bothering about story, then I hope you will like it... Yeah I just hope, I am not sure, even in that case also. Honestly saying, I didn't like any moment of this movie. It was completely wastage of time and a successful try to ruin this franchise at least for me.

When I was watching this in theater, I just can't found a reason why I keeping watching this crap. That's just boring, headless and abusive. I can't even laugh of so much s**t. I gotta say, I like the franchise, at least, I like the three first movies, especially the first one, that featured great action and some horror intense scenes. So I have motives to believe that Resident Evil: Retribution would be a good movie. God, I was wrong, so wrong. Retribution is just one more aleatory action movie, that features a laughable acting and some horrible combat scenes. Shame on Paul W.S. Anderson. If you're not a fan of the franchise, avoid it. If you're a fan of the franchise, avoid it too. Just awful and ridiculous.

Review title: Resident Evil shall end it earlier before becoming worst like this.
Review_body: This is the worst episode of "Resident Evil" franchise. Total wasted my time to watch it.Ya~ ya~ that' a lot games character appear in this movie, look so happening.. So what..? Those characters just like a dumb. What a wasted.I don't understand why they choose Bingbing Li for the character - Ada Wong, is because for the China market? How She's acting just exactly like the CG character in the video games, but with bad English speaking... i mean, you just can't see any emotion in her face, and when she is talking, just like spit out the words 1 by 1... Come on! That's a lot Asian actress in Hollywood better then her!This movie make me think of this few question:Did Paul W.S. Anderson got any idea what he's doing?Did Paul W.S. Anderson finish the script before shooting the movie?Did Paul W.S. Anderson just finish the script in 1 page of A4 paper? Did Paul W.S. Anderson just get the idea from Alien 2 + Terminator Salvation + Matrix?Did Paul W.S. Anderson just try to this movie franchise as many as possible, so can earn more $$ from the Resident Evil fans?Did i have to give at least 1 star when i'm posting the comment?

Review title: I enjoyed it! Even if it was terrible!
Review_body: All in all, the story was pathetic. Everything else was pretty good though! Well except the acting... The action was fine even if they thought slowing everything down for nearly every scene would somehow improve it. The effects were cracking and because its a fan based series (and I am a mechanical, corner, air propelling, osculating boy) it delivered enough for me to enjoy the movie without wanting to rip it to shreds. There are parts to the film which do unfortunately destroy it. In order *SPOILER ALERT*1) Wesker being in it again. I don't understand but this bugger wont die. I can accept that he must be somehow woven into the story to fuel it. Its just the last time I remember he had his face opening up along with his dogs opening faces and trying to eat people. Why he wants to help now, who knows, it didn't help me with the plot.2) Special effects are always great in movies. One of the ones that is great when used well in context is "Slow Motion". Which in this case was used a lot. There is a phrase "Less is More" which seems to have passed by the director. Maybe someone could utter it into his ear please.3) There were some bits that really were not needed. Like parts that would drag the film out longer than was needed. For example, the scene where Alice enters the control room. Before we can even continue to the main event we have to watch every single light on the floor individually illuminate before getting to the point that tables decide to ascend! Once again it was a matter of "Less is More". Entering the room and having lights suddenly come on and tables with dead bodies would have been just as dramatic (if not more I think).4) When the hell did zombies learn to shoot?5) At the very end, I am sure with the amount of bones we heard crack Alice should have been an invalid. Sure she "WAS" superhuman though prior to this movie she was rendered normal thanks to Wesker. Which is why it was unbelievable she was able to hold a gun to shoot the ice, let alone breathe! Same with Leon, his arm was broke. How did he keep throwing his left arm for a punch?In conclusion, with these few annoyances throughout the film it is still a good watch. Fans like me will still get what they want out of it which is why it still deserves a 7 in my eyes. Then again I find I can be quite lenient. Its not as good as the first two but they could have been worse.
I do not like computer games. So far the first four have been okay zombie movies.This felt like a computer game and was so so boring. Not an enjoyable experience.Hope the 6th is better than this

I watched Resident Evil Retribution today and I wish I could go back in time and erase this garbage from my memory. I love the resident evil games and I enjoyed the first few movies, this one was one of the worst movies I have seen in my life. The plot was not really there, full of cheesy one liners, bad acting by most of the cast, bullets that don't kill, weapons that never run out of bullets, and horrible character development.The story in this movie made no sense, and there were hardly any zombies. Even the action scenes were slowed down and the CGI was not that great. This was a pathetic excuse for a resident evil movie.Anyone who is expecting something action packed with a great story should look away from this film. It was GARBAGE and if I could give it minus stars, I would.

Frankly speaking I was a little concerned that I didn't watch the last (two?) episodes might have given me some trouble following the lines. Nah, it turned out fine anyway... Huge thanks to the opening "Previously on R.E." minutes, didn't expect to recall my shocked memory one decade back (that scientist headed off by elevator, ouch!)Back to our new story, Milla stays the same strong, charming and loving Alice as we knew she would be. Pretty new face (here in this movie) Li presents another style of oriental sight which suits her just fine.That's all I have to talk about this movie, thanks for reading... No? Oh, almost forgot about the "story". Well you know, they gave you the map, weapons show up just before you finish your last bullet, monsters never die easy, and so are the leading characters, talk to NPCs for necessary help and keys to the next level then through them out of your mind unless you need to use them later (yeah lady Ada in red I'm talking about you). Baseline: watch it the way you play R.E. the game without hitting your game pad and you won't be disappointed by the childish storyline or pale dialogues and the way they read them.But don't get your pillow ready yet, I'm not saying this isn't worth watching. Visual effects and 3D usage are cut and finely designed. Throughout the movie you'll find it enjoyable and comfortable to watch, well except when Barry (or is it him?) busted one head of strawberry jam right on your face. And moreover, the backwards scene at beginning is truly brilliant and sparkle of the movie.One last thing, for real now, what the hell do you mean by GLOBAL in big font on your poster when the most global thing I see are the empty theme parks 100 meters under the sea? Or next time you'll build a planetarium and claim it universal?

Review title: I had a blast watching it
Review_body: It is sad that most IMDb users don't appreciate an action packed movie, one thing I have learned is not judge a movie by help of reviewers on this site. Don't bother was the trailer as well due to the spoilers, watch it with no expectations !!This movie was action packed with awesome fighting scenes, unfortunately as many said the story was not the best but I like how the producers think outside the box. This sequel was kinda extraordinary. If you want to have action with gore watch this definitely ! Hopefully they will release a new one that continues from where this movie ended, bad ass ending as well :)

Hi guys please don't waste your time watching this stupid movie. I was a fan of resident evil series, but not any more. This is a movie shot in a studio alone, not a single frame has seen the real light. Retribution reminded me of kill bill movie, but with worst direction and screenplay. Most of the scenes looked like a video game with background music. I don't know what happened to the director all of a sudden after directing wonderful previous sequences. May be this movie was taken to stop the series without hurting it's fans. After watching this part there will be no more fans. According to me this movie should not have got 5.7 rating. I don't know what is happening to IMDb reviews these days.

Review title: too much show-off on action, lack of the essence of Zombie movie
Review_body: First, the story should align up with the original game Resident Evil. The movie has its own plot different from the games, but that is OK - still acceptable. Ever since the first Resident Evil movie, the story has gone too far. The 2nd Resident Evil movie was better than the 3rd, 4th, this 5th. The last 3 Resident Evil movies are lack of good story, only full of actions but meaningless fighting. Without zombie, the movie could be recognized "pure action movie without purpose".Disappointed but not surprised by this 5th Resident Evil movie. It is still pointless, lack of story, only with show-off actions. I rate it 6 for its "not bad" graphics

Paul W.S. Anderson's fifth installment in the Resident Evil series has everything you would want in a sequel. If I could some it up in one sentence it would be, "Hot chicks with guns shoot zombies and occasionally shoot other people with guns who work for an evil corporation." It's not just fun, it's damn fun! Fans of the games with be happy to see their favorite characters on the big screen and also like the elements it incorporates from the games. If you've played Resident Evil 5, there's a part you'll recognize from the game in the movie.Also Jill Valentine's back(No complaints about that at all)-said in a smooth voice. Along with her there's Michelle Rodriguez who is always welcome.One thing that is also great about this film is the fight choreography which an upgrade over previous installments. More action, more explosions, more awesome.If you want to just tell logic to screw itself and watch an entertaining film, you're in for a treat.9/10

Upon my viewing of Resident Evil: Retribution last night, I was left with an action-packed but ultimately hollow experience.Lets start with the pros. Resident Evil has action, some of it is really well executed - especially with regards to choreography of fight scenes and encounters with large monsters where 3D was used quite effectively. The film also has plenty of opportunity to have some interesting battles with hordes of zombies however a lot of the film has "opportunity" so that's unfortunately not saying too much.Okay, now the cons. I have more to say here and don't necessarily have to spoil any of the plot. The film feels very isolated, often like a B-movie. It occasionally remembers that Resident Evil began as somewhat of a horror franchise when it projects a jump scare onto the screen but a majority of it just falls flat. The plot begins as a convoluted mess then straightens up and just turns plain average. The acting is fairly awful with the occasional exception of Jovovich demonstrating distance from people yet implying a longing for closeness. The script is cheesy and zombies feel limited in number which is something unusual for a film franchise notorious for having zombies at its core.Overall the film is edited and hollow. That's how I can best describe it. Despite being a zombie/monster film, it's surprisingly clean and fuelled by green screen. Though I'll likely see the sequel in the hope it rounds off well - this film feels like a stand in and just more of the same in the series.4/10

Review title: I have no idea who this is, but is no longer Resident Evil.
Review_body: It can serve to hang out, but by this fifth installment, this saga has been completely distorted. No one turned away is the basic idea that guided the history of the early Resident Evil games, has moved away completely from the basic idea up to the newest in the series deliveries. The history of the previous 4 films leads this have an exaggerated story, with elements that border on the absurd, and the end is still more illogical and absurd. All it does is grab Andersen loose ideas and scenes of Resident Evil video games, and use it completely out of context and place. I can accept without complaint the first two movies, but since the third part, this film saga has gotten worse. This is no longer worthy to be called "Resident Evil" because not what the hell is, but beyond loose items, this is no longer even close to being true to the series of games that claims to represent.

Slick and stylish graphics couldn't elevate Resident Evil: Retribution above what is in essence a 2 hour platform game that fails to engage the audience beyond its visuals. Even more so than other Resident Evil offerings, this movie's plot carried no great suspense or foreboding. In fact, predicting what was coming next, who would survive and who would be killed off in order to dramatize the potential dangers faced by the main characters, couldn't have been more obvious had they been wearing a Star Trek redshirt.Resident Evil: Retribution did, at least, have a few enjoyable scenes, such as the ones set in American Suburbia. Overall, however, this film felt like a very mild bit of foreplay ahead of the next installment hinted at at the end of this movie. I just hope that one goes off with a bang. (bigbadmoviereviews)

Resident Evil, the first one was the best and till 4 it was still OK to watch, just watch. BUT Retribution was the worst thing I have ever seen in my life! Really, I normally don't critic any movie but this was pure bull manure! No story, no plot, nothing totally NOTHING, just gun shooting in pure nothingness! This was the worst movie I have ever seen in my life and I love Resident Evil from game to movie!! Really sorry! But WOW! Never thought this would be like that! They could have made anything after RE 4 but this... there are really no words to explain how bad all of this movie is! Capcom, you should sue the director because he and the whole crew have destroyed the whole name of Resident Evil, destroyed everything in the name of Resident Evil and Umbrella corp. THIS WAS PURE AWFULNESS!!! Can't believe people gave it even a 5 or 6 in stars! This was totally -10 not 1. INCREDIBLE!

Where to even begin? The acting is just terrible. I mean from everyone. Its so forced. There is better acting in porn for christ sake. Basic plot is Alice kills things. That is it. Plus no one reloads their guns. They have infinite ammo guns and superhuman skill to which they never get injured. Watch for comedic value. That's the only thing to take from this film. Its hilarious how bad it is! Would not recommend!

I am left feeling disappointed that such a good opportunity went to waste. Scary? Intense? Anderson blows smoke up everyones ass. There is one jump moment near the beginning in the residential scene, but that's it. No tension. No wondering what's going to happen next. No caring. Just little ideas stolen from other movies that aren't even expanded. The girl, Becky, is snatched by the Huge Licker and Alice has to rescue her from an egg sack, which is similar to Aliens? That is such a cop-out of originality. I have great memories of playing the games. Loved RE4 (the game), where there is a feeling of horror survival. That is gone from these movies. Anderson really dropped the ball on this one. But at least he and his wife Milla will make millions. What an embarrassment. It didn't even feel like an R rated movie.The Good: Action from the beginning until the Russian scene. Music. Special Effects were good for me. The sets were great.The Bad: Story. Dialogue. The only attempt at dialog was the residential scene where Milla plays housewife. Dawn of the Dead was far way better, but the movie kept my interest until I gave up on it during the Russian scene. I see Barry and Leon just standing in the open of the department store firing at the Russian zombie soldiers, who have way more fire power, and there's no realism. I completely just felt let down when I saw Barry (who should of had a back-story, poor use of Kevin Durand) holds a zombie from behind while Leon shoots at it with an automatic weapon from the front, then Barry just tosses it. Really? Come on! No realism or thought behind the action. I was so looking forward to seeing Russian zombies with chainsaws on bikes. That image was in my head, but so was the idea that it would actually be in Russia. There was no world feel or substance. Over use of flying gun clips and guns and slow-mo bullets. OK, I can live with that stuff. But when a movie like this, which Milla and Paul promised was for the fans best interest, goes absolutely nowhere, all I feel is nothing for this waste.To salvage what's there, this should've been the third installment, since it takes place in one locale and has no drive on a "global" scale that is repeatedly plastered on the movie posters. I understand they will make more money internationally, so that's why it says global to appeal to foreign markets, but it doesn't have that global feel whatsoever. Why not simply change the story by having Alice escape the Umbrella underwater facility (which looked good) chase Jill or Wesker around the globe going to Tokyo, New York, Moscow, and Washington, D.C. I really believed that was the premise of the movie prior to actually seeing it. Don't duplicate the hive feeling again. Don't retread.I understand Anderson wanted to bring some of the older characters back, and the cloning idea is fine. But it didn't go anywhere. There is a detail on the first movie DVD that comes to mind. Anderson narrates on the alternate ending clip, and says Milla was going to walk into Umbrella, whip out a big gun and fire. Then multiple little missiles were going to fly at you. That's it. (That majestic idea must've really excited Anderson so bad he just had to put it in RE5 with Rodriguez firing that same weapon. Boring!) What changed everything about the feel of the first RE was re-shooting the ending with Milla standing in the street of a ravaged Raccoon City holding a shotgun as the camera pulled back. Very good! Whoever suggested that ending shaped the future for this franchise. Unfortunately, Anderson must not have those inspirational people around him anymore to "borrow" from, so we fans get this sloppy piece of non scary shi*! If you are reading most of the reviews out of curiosity like i did, you'll realize that this movie was a terrible mistake. of course, seeing is believing. I can bet when you leave the theater, you'll feel like this was just a big piece of regurgitated trite that you've seen before and are tired of seeing. I didn't read any reviews on IMDb until after watching it because I know the history of fans and their polarizing feel for Anderson's direction. I always gave him the benefit of the doubt since all the RE movies had some high points and were entertaining at the very least. But not anymore. I wanted to know if others felt the same way. I wished there was some way to get the movie a reboot, because this so called story line has finally lost me. I will no longer talk about how much I like Resident Evil. I'm embarrassed to. The last game I played was RE4 back in 2007, and I don't play video games like I used to anymore. But to remember the feeling of playing the very first game around 1997, the feeling of being scared. The feeling of intensity. The feeling of wanting to relive it again is fond. It's only been a couple of days since seeing Retribution, and I have no feelings at all for it.Capcom, please take control of your creation and say good-bye to Anderson. Let's get a reboot now!

Review title: I would make better movie with few dollars on my hand
Review_body: From the first seconds of movie starts unknown chaos with no story. Mila is running around some unreal cities and fighting god knows who. Fighting scenes is boring, seen it before and many times. I do not know how actors can join in movie like this, probably an only because of money. I could not even watch this movie to the end. Cheap and dull movie (I just called it movie but had to used other word inside my mind). For a well know producer it is shame to release movie like this. It is really a shame. I think only RE1 and RE4 were good others were trash. Even if you watch this movie to the end you not gonna be able to remember what happened here. I would better look in to the wall for hour and half but not watch this.

I had much higher expectations from this title thinking maybe after the previous disappointment in resident evil once again I am going to see the glorious days of first movies especially 1 and 2. But, to my astonishing surprise, this one was just another mediocre movie especially in terms of story line. It seemed as if the producers are out of idea and that they have this obligation to exactly following the game without adding any novel ideas to it.Taking into consideration that I am a fan of the whole series including the games, I am giving it 3 stars. Otherwise 1 would be more appropriate.I wish to see way better movies on the continue.

Review title: One of the WORST Movies I've EVER seen
Review_body: This movie was absolutely awful. Only 2 things even kept me in my seat: Barry and Ada. Casting: Awful.Story: Even more confusing and AWFULRelation to the ACTUAL RE series: Not there at all. You can't just add in Character names and hope that fans will be happy. Leon's name could've been Steve and it would have made NO difference to me...no development. AT. ALL. I'm sure that last movie is going to be, literally, 90 minutes of constant DUBSTEP and Fighting...which will make me feel exactly how Alice did in that STUPID holding cell. The only thing I'm very happy about is that the next movie will be the LAST by Paul Anderson. Thank God.

Now even without spoilers I can describe this whole movie perfectly with only one word: FILLER. Simple as that: Nothing happens. Nothing progresses. Especially nothing advances! And even for a filler, a filler could at least have a good story of its own, even if it doesn't connect with the main storyline. Here I can't even say the story is bad, because there is no story at all. They didn't even try.But we have good effects and plenty of action at least. And that's the whole point I guess: They just needed some empty space to dump them into, and sell it in cinemas. Though those effects are just wasted on this movie, still can be watched once if they are there anyway, but just expect nothing else.

Review title: Loved the previous one this was just OK
Review_body: *** SPOILER ALERT****. Mixed feelings about this movie. I'm a HUGE fan of the entire series and absolutely loved the previous one. I had been waiting for this movie for a whole year and literally counting down the days but I'm sadly a bit disappointed. In this last chapter some scenes were really cool, especially the opening sequence when she was the trapped in the house, that's what Resident Evil is about.. But overall it felt more like a war movie than Resident Evil : too many gun fights and not enough zombies. I felt like the plot was weak and it was just a movie to set up the next chapter of the series. ('cause from the ending there has to be another one, right?) I didn't like the way they brought back some of the old characters just for the sake of it and the fact that Alice teams up with Albert Wesker and you just have to accept it. And also the Red Queen controlling Umbrella sounds just silly..how and when did it happen? Another thing you just have to accept. Also Alice looks more and more like Selene from Underworld. They should have escaped the Russian facility after 30 mins and the movie should have focused on what happens next but..hopefully the next one? As a massive fan I really hope the next movie will be out soon and it will go back to the origins of the franchise.

Review title: Great opening sequence and arguably the best sequel in the series
Review_body: The opening sequence where the credits are shown was just amazing. I felt that I was in a for a cinematic treat and I was not disappointed. I haven't written a review for some time but I think this sequel really deserved it and I don't understand all the very critical reviews this movie has received. The idea of using cloned characters (don't want to give anything away) was taken to the next level here and all in all a great script and great directing. Acting by Milla Jovovich was excellent. I could not expect more from a Resident Evil sequence. I'm happy to wait another 2 years if the next sequel will be of the same quality.

As the title states, I feel this installment of Resident evil far surpassed the others. Great story line, awesome on the edge of your seat fight scenes. The action in this is pretty well from start to finish, there aren't very many gaps in between action scenes, so that was a plus for me. So glad I chose to watch Retribution in the theater my first time, and yes, I said first time because I plan on watching it many times over. Great performances by the entire cast. Milla Jovovich never fails to impress me, I was very pleased with her performance in this one. Michelle Rodriguez is another. She did an outstanding job. Definitely a must see, and if you can, try to catch it in the theater because the action scenes in this film are well worth seeing on the big screen.

Review title: Its not supposed to be Shawshank Redemption !!
Review_body: I think one thing that has plagued the RE movies and any video game movies that get made for that matter is the fact that people will go to see them who have no prior knowledge of the games and what RE universe entails. Yes the film has cheesy moments and the acting isn't on a level with say Marlon Brando but honestly who cares !?!? This like all the other RE movies are kick-ass rides involving loads of guns ! beautiful women ! zombies and monsters ! I knew exactly what to expect with RE:R and I loved it, and its my film of the year ! and yes I saw the Dark Knight..10/10 isn't exactly what I would score the movie (more like 8-9) but I think there's so many morbid people out there that score films like this so low its unfair. I look forward to the next RE movie ! now back to playing RE6.. :)

Review title: I doubt if there's gonna be an RE6.
Review_body: I've seen worse, so I wouldn't give it full thumb-down. But just think about the fact that I actually had to pay to see this film which almost drove me crazy. How is slow motion becoming so fascinating for the director? How long would this film be if we modestly return just some of the scenes back to normal tempo? Since the last episode was this problem already obvious enough, and we should probably see a "in slow motion" sign next to the film title if we use a microscope. Besides, the repetition and sudden change of music can seriously cause mental damage, I wonder what happened during the editing of the last part of the movie, what happened to the music?! I'd rather have that part mute.

The Movie was AWESOME. But they left a lot of holes in the plot as how on earth did Wesker become the self made President of the USA? Why is the Red Queen against Wesker and why is Wesker helping the humans? I thought he wanted a mutated world...And last, but not the least, Maggie Q would have done a better job as Ada Wong. Not that Li Bing Bing didn't do a good job. But there's something about Maggie Q taking on ass kicking roles. It just brings, life into that character.IMHO, out of all 5 RE movies i will rate this as the 4th best. 1st being RE:Afterlife, 2nd Resident Evil, 3 RE:Apocalypse and the last RE:Extinction.

I was very disappointed with this movie, great idea, but bad execution. First off, I am a big fan of the video games back when they arrived on playstation. I understand that they are different from them which in my opinion makes them alittle weak but still good to watch. Barry was awesome as in the video game up until he died. Which was very cheesy might i add. Leon was OK as in the video games, and wesker is always awesome, BUT in this movie he needs Alice's help WHY???!!!! i do not know because wesker can pretty much destroy any zombie that crosses his path, and what made me upset was they make a big deal outta needing Alice when clearly wesker is the s@#t. Ada wong and Jill Valentine was good. The place setting was weak, meaning that whole tesing facility was wack. Another problem is that wesker gave Alice her powers back so she can help restore the human race from the outbreak. BUT reports were that if another RE movie was made it would be based on Chris and Claire.... whom were captured by umbrella. Now if that the case we need two more movies, one explaining there sudden absence in this one and the final one where wesker, alice, leon, jill and others restore humanity by killing every zombie on earth. Sounds great doesn't it??? but thats why It makes me upset cause its something they wont do...

Review title: Alice kicks Butt Again & doesn't disappoint ! ! !
Review_body: Just saw it in theaters ( 3-D version of course !) From the beginning visually I was hooked ! I'm a huge fan of the franchise due to my Love of the Undead! Knew of the video game but never played any of them so I had no route I was expecting them to follow, just went in to be entertained & have been there opening weekends ever since ! The 3-D was used very well, not a zillion things constantly flying at you, but when they did it was Awesome. The action scenes did not disappoint ! Even without her powers Alice was still a force to be reckoned with . Be it with Bada** guns or just her body , Umbrella was going to have to bring All it had to take her & her crew down! Loved the bringing back of familiar characters, but hated you know who was on the other side this time. : ( Love the fact that the females are the lead bada**es & don't hide in a corner waiting for someone to rescue them ! Yeah at times the situations are unreal , but hey people it's a Movie , it's meant as an escape from the "real world " ! So if you want a mind numbing , action packed ride see it & hold on tight ! It won't win an Oscar , but this installment ensured I'll be there opening night for the next installment ! Enjoy !

If you like zombie movies you will like this movie. If you just like action you will most likely like this movie. If you like neither action or zombies do not see this movie.The bad: The acting is on par for most major charters, but for minor charters the acting is sub par; it's not horrible or bad just not good. I would give the overall acing a: "meh". The plot is okay for a zombie movie though it does have a few things and leaves something to be desired. The script can be cheesy at times but its nothing that would make me not like the movie. The action was never bad but it was standard for non-realistic movies; the bullets never ran out unless the script called for it and even though there was some cool flips/kicks I did feel like I wanted more.The good: The CGI is great giving a bonus to the movie. I am zombie fan so I enjoyed all of the undead, there where not many just regular undead people mostly mutated monsters though. The action had a few good parts, some cool face kicks and heart stopping "palm thrusts". There wasn't anything amazing bout the film I can think of except for the CGI, most of it was just okay. Bottom line: as I said before if you like zombies you will like this movie. Zombie movies are rare, there are tons of horrible movies about zombies but those are just no fun to watch. If you're like me and a fan of these movies you will understand that an "okay" zombie film is a "great" zombie film because of the rarity. A "great" zombie film is a "classic" zombie film. Because of the scarcity of these movies anything that is watchable becomes enjoyable. This movie is absolutely an okay film id say even a good film which in the zombie lover world makes it a great film to watch so all zombie lovers GO SEE THIS FILM. If you are looking for an action flick this movie could go both ways, the action is decent and almost constant but if you are not interested in zombies, well that's what the movie is all about so I am not sure what to say to you. And again if you neither like zombies nor action and are just looking for a film to watch don't see this film. There are a few bad parts but I expected those knowing the Resident Evil franchise, and a few good parts since it was a big budget picture but mostly everything was just plain old okay. I enjoyed it and wished it was longer but again I'm a zombie fan. I'm giving it a 7 because I think a 6 is too low, but a 7 is too high. 6.5 would be perfect.TL;DR: Zombie fans: Yes. Action fans: Maybe. Neither: No.

Firstly I would like to say I am a Fan of the Resident evil franchise, and have enjoyed them as a collection. As you would imagine some have out done the others. After watching Afterlife, it had my Res E juices flowing again as it had impressive action sequences with new ideas.Retribution - started out really cool Loving the slow mo reverse action as the opening credits rolled, although as cool as this was I felt it lingered a little too long and lost a little credibility.Overall I was disappointed with the movie as a whole, some of the action seemed a little tired but on a positive note they did gain the computer game feel with the zone by zone stage by stage escape route.Although i feel this one missed the mark slightly, they have most definitely left it open for a final movie so lets hope they rekindle the coolness that has dampened.all in all an entertaining watch but nothing to shout about.

After a major insult by Paul Anderson's latest, "RESIDENT EVIL: Retribution", there's a few words I must say about it. This could be Anderson's worst, perhaps even worse than the mega-flop "AVP". It's a no-brainer, but not a good-to-enjoy no-brainer. It's simply so terribly bad and poorly written, it could easily be compared to some of Uwe Boll's worst. Not to mention the constant and ongoing Paul's masturbation over Jovovich in tight outfits shot in irritating slow-mo, the OVER-THE-TOP-BAD plot. To make things worse, the CG/green-screen scenes are ridiculous, even more than usual. The fourth film installment is actually watchable compared to this one. And I'm not even overreacting. Oh....and Jill Valentine's character seemed to have bigger breasts in the second film. I literally yelled "NO,F****** GOD NO", when I saw the ending. Paul Anderson was sometimes a dirty pleasure for me. But not anymore.

Every time Paul W.S. Anderson releases a movie, its just more worse than the last one. Retribution however was not only worse than the last, but has sank to the Uwe Boll Level. Only difference between them two is that Anderson can still afford slightly better CGI than Uwe Boll and still have somewhat famous actors and actress who is willing to work under him.Other than that, his movies, especially the RE series, is just going down the crapper. Each iterations is just worse than the last with no improvement or no attempts to even try to make the movie half decent. It's quit embarrassing and he should really reconsider the direction he is going in.The way I see it is, since he has the ability to make big screen motion pictures, why not make actually good movie instead of half-ass'd product? Time, money, and talent is wasted if you asked me. it could of been so much better if he just tried...

I'm so glad I did not listen to all these 'bad reviews'. I've seen all the previous Resident Evil movies and I say, it's as 'good' as the one's before, if not better.Visual effects,that I did not see from the previous ones, were very impressive.All in all, 8 out of 10, just because the action was so damn awesome. Very fun,and great movie with very good' special effects'. This is a pure action SCI-FI movie, not a drama! To those who reviewed it negatively, If you are confused, then probably the RE movie franchise isn't for you. To those thinking of renting it, don't listen to these 'stupid' reviews. See it for yourself and decide for yourself, as I did. Don't let this 'experts'(not) decide for you...Again, This is a pure action SCI-fi movie, not a drama!

Real disappointing.These movies have come under a lot of fire, as video game adaptations always do. However, I've really enjoyed 'em - the franchise has been great movie fun with each offering a different angle on the spread of Umbrella's T-Virus. That said, this one was quite horrible! A very 1980s plot, super-clunky script, some ropey effects... And I'm pretty sure I caught a couple of recycled shots. Not to mention really average use of 3D. To me this one was saved only by Milla Jovovich's hotness and some pretty cool action sequences. But the essence of RE, for me, is lost completely in a mess of retro technology and a basic lack of story development since Afterlife. Bring back the claustrophobia, the zombies and the scares! Chuck out the underwater training simulation stations and the red queen regurgitating silly lines! I'm done.

I don't know what everyone is whining about, but get over it. This movie is no worse than the past two or three RE movies that have come out, which admittedly were pretty awful. I actually found this one slightly more entertaining. I thought the acting was on par with previous RE films (take that as you will), except for the actress that played Jill Valentine, whose ham-handed line delivery stunk up the movie. Of course the plot wasn't anything groundbreaking (or all that interesting), but how is this different than any of the other RE movies we've seen since the first one? The premise has always pretty much been the same: Mila Jovovich gets in a hot outfit and lays the beatdown on zombies. You want depth, go rent Doctor Zhivago. You want auteurism, watch some Fellini. This is a very simple formula for a very simple franchise: hot chick, shoots guns, kills stuff. Are you really complaining about the realism of a movie inspired by a video game about mutant zombies? Take this movie franchise for what it is intended to be, and maybe you won't wet your pants with shock and disappointment when the next installment inevitably comes out.

Review title: actually I want to give 5 stars, but because of compassion to give him 6 stars and 1 star it is compassion
Review_body: Doesn't make sense!how barry died?! The technique and position same with leon f.kenedy and really?!luther died but ada wong survive?! With same weapon/skill(the two of them were stabbed directly in the chest with their hands and luther died?!)

Review title: Can't wait for the next one!!
Review_body: I usually don't pay much attention to the reviews on IMDb because they seem to be written by wannabe film school students and not basic public movie watchers. After seeing all the horrid reviews I had to speak up.Finally a video game movie that feels like your watching a video game. The first four "Resident Evil" movies were more of a traditional type (A story inspired by characters and events from a video game). This one goes a different route and is more like watching an automated video game with the characters of the previous movies. I don't need complicated plot lines, character arcs or a believable story to be entertained. Personally, I could watch Alice (Milla Jovovich), Jill Valentine (Sienna Guillory), Rain (Michelle Rodriguez) & Ada Wong (Bingbing Li) kick butt video game style for 12 hours straight. But maybe that's just me. I'm the kind of guy that watches an entire season of "24" on my one day off. I own the first four "Resident Evil" DVDs and after renting "Retribution" I'll be buying it too.I'll sum it it with the fact that I really enjoyed this movie. No, the movie isn't thought provoking, a social commentary or an exploration into the human psyche. It just get's Alice through another day.

Review title: This was so weird and I'm so disappointed
Review_body: I was wondering if Anderson was drunk when he wrote the screenplay, because all the movie is a complete contradiction itself; I don't get the idea... Why I'm saying this?, because this movie violate all the saga. First the computer in the first movie and then in the third one tried to help people; yes, it was killing people in the first one but just because it (the red queen) needed to be sure that the T-virus didn't escape of the facility lab. Indifferently of this, wasn't the red queen shut down?Second I think it was a BIG mistake putting Wesker as good man now, after he tried to kill Alice and everybody all the time like in the ship with the bomb... And obviously WHY he put Alice's powers out and now he's returning them back. For me, all this is illogical, you can NOT just convert or turn the bad guy that was the last 2 movies being a shi** with everyone into a good one just for pleasure... And why is he alive if we saw him exploding in the 4th part?The crew was so good, but the director didn't make good use of it. They don't really say us what is happening, who is this people we have seen in the first movie as good ones, now trying to kill Alice...I'm expecting always for a good reason why this things happened but they didn't give us any. They were just clones and some are goods and others not.I'm fan of RE but I don't know what is happening with this people; the movie hasn't heart, has a lot of incredible effects and the fights were awesome but for me it needed something more, more plot, participation of main characters like Leon etc.My opinion about this movie is the director hadn't a screenplay, first of all, second he wanted to put in the movie main characters of the video game but these hadn't any story, they were there just for rescue Alice, without any other explanation. Other thing with this was, what happened with Claire, Chris and K-mark? they were just put out of the movie... I don't know but for me the movie was needed of organization, explanations, and a good screenplay because they didn't give me anything new, was just bullets, kicks, and more bullets, here's no story just odds and ends (characters of the VG, ideas of others movies like the clones etc) joined.For me, it was a bit disappointing I was expecting something better this time but with Anderson as director at the same time I knew this couldn't be a good movie...

This is hands down one of the worst films that has ever been made. And that's exactly what makes it so good to watch. It's so bad its good. Here is what happens in Resident Evil Retribution: You will have no idea whats going on throughout the entire movie. There are bizarre plot lines all over the place that have no relevance. Characters appear, die, come back, die again, good guy, bad guy, good guy again, die again(you get the idea). The casting director could have used a cardboard cut out of Ava Wong and it would have had more personality. They're in a soviet submarine base under the ice in Russia. There's a deaf kid. The acting is so crap it's hilarious. Zombies (Nazi zombies no less) can now ride bikes and drive cars. Leon S Kennedy is in it with no reference to why he's there or who he is. Look Barry Burton is here too with his magnum and cigar! Everything blows up. The guns never run out of ammunition. Confused yet? Good. That's the idea. There are really hot chicks in skin tight leather kicking each other. Hooray! Where did Claire et al. on the ship at the end of the last film go? Who cares! Oh look now Alice and Jill are friends again and they're in the White House....with Wesker in it! And there is one mother of a zombie horde outside....cue RE6.

The screenplay for this movie was purchased from "special needs" kids in exchange for 2 Wrestlemania DVD's and a gallon of raw cookie dough. That's about all there is to say, but it says here I have to write 10 lines of text- so instead of talking about this movie (nothing that happens in it is worth mentioning)- I'll tell you what happens at the end of Star Wars: (Don't read on if you don't want to know how Star Wars ends...............................................) The Rebels and the Ewoks defeat the Imperial forces on Endor. Lando and the Rebel fleet launch a successful attack on the Death Star. Leia reveals that Luke is not a romantic interest, but (in fact) her brother. Luke holds a symbolic funeral for his dad, James Earl Jones. The ghosts of Anakin, Obi-Wan, and Yoda show up- answering once and for all the question "are there ghosts in space?".

As a number one fan of the Resident Evil Video Games and Books, when the first movie came out, I was most certainly not upset they had invented Alice - or changed the storyline. But this film, is a complete and utter insult to every single fan of the RE games. And Movies for that matter. Not only does is not have a single trace of a plot, but it each character must have around five lines throughout the incredibly short film. Also, the lack of zombies after the first twenty minutes is ridiculous - heck, isn't that what the whole thing is about? A Virus that turns people into hungry, flesh eating monsters, whilst the remaining survivors, police and military crew battle it out against them? Not this film. One very annoying thing about it was that the characters would carry out hard core fighting scenes (which are actually brilliant by the way) with numerous broken bones (ribs, arm bones, leg bones, the lot) - now surely this is a minor catch? On the bright side, the action shots were indeed brilliant and so were the first twenty minutes of the film - taking us back to a suburbia horror-zombie feel, it was very enjoyable but very scary indeed. So if you like action, some zombies and a lot of gun shots, then this is the film for you.

I should start off this article by first confessing that I am a Resident Evil fan.Although largely loathed by critics, I have to admit I have always had a soft spot for the franchise, partly because of my love of the games when I was younger and partly because of my love of zombie films.Being the fifth movie in the series, it was always likely that Resident Evil: Retribution would struggle to deliver a fresh perspective on the zombie-laden franchise.Ten minutes in and I was beginning to change my mind.The opening scene of Retribution is a masterclass in aesthetic wizardry, picking up right where the last movie left off it wastes no time in diving headfirst into the action.Much like the previous Resident Evil movie, Retribution utilises slow- motion visuals intertwined with fast cuts and high-paced action scenes to create a visual feast from start to finish.For those who have no problem putting their logical thought process on standby for 90 minutes and enjoy a series of action-fuelled, suspense- filled scenes, this movie has a lot to offer.Resident Evil: Retribution sees Milla Jovovich reprise her role as Alice, once again donning the skintight outfits she has become accustomed to from previous instalments in the series.The introduction of a daughter plays as an attempt to give Alice a more three dimensional emotive scope, though this attempt is never fully realised and isn't particularly necessary, as it is Alice's hard-headed nature which is one of the most appealing aspects of her character.A series of other new characters are also introduced along with former characters returning to the franchise for cameo roles.Fans of the video game will be pleased to see the addition of Leon Kennedy, though he is played by a mediocre Johann Urb and thankfully doesn't end up with too much screen time.After seeing the previous Resident Evil movie in 3D (and considering it well worth it) I made a point of seeing this one in 3D also, however, as far as Retribution goes, I would recommend passing on 3D and saving yourself the extra money.Overall I found Resident Evil: Retribution to be very enjoyable, though what disappointed me most about it was the writing.The plot struggled to hold momentum throughout and the dialogue left a lot to be desired at times, both in writing and delivery.I would have liked to have seen more zombie hybrid characters introduced also, as most of the zombies present in the film have already appeared in previous instalments in the franchise.However, with a title like Resident Evil it should already be apparent this film is by no means a masterpiece.But then again, it isn't trying to be.What the Resident Evil franchise aims to do is deliver mindless entertainment from start to finish, and on this front it delivers.

Review title: This sucks way much than previous
Review_body: As always this is worst than all the previous ones. I wanted to mention something that came to my mind and really bothers me. The only way why umbrella would do all that sh*t is just for profit, they wanted money, so... they invented clones, artificial organs, IA, incredible machines, huge infrastructure and all that sh*t just for testing? wouldn't that generate much more money than selling a virus to some countries?? It just has no sense, they could have had all the money in the world without doing all that sh*t and without harming anyone, now they are all dead and the IA rules everything, their CEO must be fired. Thanks for reading

There are so many things wrong with this film that it's difficult to know where to begin, but let's try:1. It's confusing2. It's confusing3. Did I say it's confusing? Well, it's confusing4. The acting. The acting in this film is so bad I'm sure it will be shown in acting school as a warning. One exception is the big monster thing, who I felt brought a sorely needed subtlety and pathos to the character5. Someone says: "Synchronize watches"6. Someone says: "OK, let's do this"7. Almost every idea is an unoriginal one: the clones (Matrix), the simulated environments (Truman Show), the angry zombies (Twenty Eight Days Later), etc8. The gunfights. In a world of endless violence, do we really need another Hollywood film with a fetishistic display of guns?9. It has a car chase in it...yawn10. It has females dressed in latex suits and fighting each other...yawnThis film pretty much sums up the state of Hollywood in 2012: it is a tired, unoriginal and ultimately cynical attempt to get your cash.

resident evil retribution. Now I haven't played much of the games and haven't seen the movies a lot but even so this movie bugged me. First off I'd like to say that all those RE fans out there who say that anyone who hasn't played resident evil four thousand times and doesn't have a chart detailing its plot has no business rating the movies are morons. Now with that aside I can actually go into the movie a bit. The special effects were awesome, and the sound track matched it beautifully as well as the action scenes being very well done but that's not why I've put it down as the worst Resident Evil movie out there. As stories go this ones about as weak as a sparrow with brittle bone disease. Apparently the writers have figured out that no human in their right mind would look at what's happening and go "Yep, this can't possible go badly for me at all!" So they've had to bring back the red queen from the first movie to be the big baddie but hold on! Wasn't the red queen supposed to be trying to contain the virus in the first movie? Wasn't she portrayed as just misguided? Wered this sudden blood lust come from? And it goes completely unexplained as to why, the film seemingly preferring to try and distract viewers with more bright explosions. The other "big twist" is that umbrella mass clones people but hold on again! How did that get overlooked! I mean that would make for one awkward scene in the umbrella soldiers locker room surely! Giving an excuse for those soldiers from the first movie to make an appearance as umbrella soldiers and rather then them getting shot its the guards wearing masks that do. But then the whole place floods in the next scene killing them all, so how much would it have changed anything for even one of them to have died before hand?Another thing that annoyed me was when the zombie soldiers showed up in Moscow. I mean come on! I can accept zombies with guns but zombies with guns on motorcycles? That's just too far...There's also a part in the movie where a giant monster grabs a little girl but rather then instantly killing her like it has every other person its even come near to it decides to take her back to its den so alice can go save her, I think that pathetic attempt at story line speaks for itself...In short resident evil retribution is good for mindless shooty,zombie killing,exploisiony fun. just don't expect anything else or you'll be disappointed.

Review title: Review by a fan of the games
Review_body: I was excited for this because of the last movie. I thought the last one was really good, and was excited for it because I figured the conclusion was coming, and there would be another fight with Wesker. Slight spoilerThere is no big fight with Wesker. Basically the story line that they built in the last movie was scraped, and this movie turns the series into more of a terminator like franchise.What I did like about it, is that there are a few more references to the game in this one, but still not many.
