You see a zombie in a closet, like the first game, and Barry's hand cannon. Those are the ones that really stand out.Its worth watching, but be prepared to be disappointed by the ending.

I'm usually the first to point out the good points in a bad movie, but I was actually angry while sitting in the theater last night - angry that I had wasted my time and hard-earned money. Sequels (SOME remakes & reboots, too) just for the sake of making sequels have to stop. They're (almost) always terrible. And before anyone mentions 'The Godfather II' or 'Aliens', those were released over 25 years ago - let it go, FFS. This movie just seemed like an excuse to reunite cast members from the first film (for the weakest of reasons), and also to have many, many unnecessary fight scenes that never end. The film's first, second & third acts don't really seem to even come from the same storyline and the film's plot is all over the place. Also, I'm not quite sure how much longer the audience will continue to believe that these specially-trained, martial arts & combat experts (as they all seems to be) can barely hit a single target while shooting at another main character. If you're going to waste your money, spend it on the video games instead.

Review title: The one who played Jill Valentine
Review_body: I'm sorry but, am I the only one who thinks that the one who played Jill Valentine got her part from sucking the d*ck of someone from high up? I've never, ever seen such an awful performance in my whole life. Even Bollywood actors performs better than her. Every single word that left that womans mouth came out sounding like pure diarrhea. Honestly, I got goosebumps all over my body and actually felt some puke in my mouth while watching this piece of garbage "act".This movie, this plot, this dialogue and these god awful actors - Its like Asylum and Michael Bay came together to make a lovechild. Wow! I didn't expect much out of this movie to begin with, since this movie franchise has gone bananas with these past movies, but 1/10 has never been deserved so much in IMDb's history. It's a far stretch, but I managed to give it a 3/10 just because Milla Jovovich and Michelle Rodriguez deserves better than this.

Review title: Every time i watch Resident Evil, i expect it to get better or at least be as good as the first but every time i get disappointed.
Review_body: The first resident evil was great and it began my love for the franchise and then as soon as Resident evil 2 came out i was the first to go out and watch it and again it carried on my love for the franchise. The third was cool to watch but began, in my opinion, to get out of hand.I was super excited for the fourth installment of Resident Evil especially since Paul was directing again but when i left the movie house i felt like the franchise was dead.When Retribution came out i was excited but not as i used to be and so when i watched it i didn't have high hopes but jeez i didn't expect it to be this bad.The movie felt like a crappy game being played on the big screen and after awhile, the story became predictable and repetitive and what especially ruined it for me was the ending.For me resident evil should just finish but unfortunately i hear there's another one coming which will properly be even more stupid than this one.

Mostly underrated by reviewers who don't have a clue what 'Resident Evil' is. I'm a big fan of the game and that's the origin to all movies, if you are not a fan of the game for sure you won't like the movie. We were playing the game, waiting for an animation, cinematic scene to show to enjoy watching it. Now that we have a complete real life movie, you would complain? In contract to other movies, the more they release the better it gets. I liked the last 2 movies (after life & retribution) more than the 3 previous ones. More familiar faces, characters were introduced and the intensity of the action has increased. I did not realized those 2 movies were done while watching until i saw the ending already! So please stop rating or reviewing, if you don't have an idea what's Resident Evil is all about because you would never judge the movie right.

This movie just felt like a filler footage the entire film. I have watched and enjoyed RE 1-4. This is right up there with Episode 1 of Star Wars. This movie doesn't really add anything to the series. Nothing new is revealed. I'm honestly sure that you could not watch this film in the series and go right on to the next and not miss anything. we've all seen Alice escape an Umbrella facility, we've seen clones, and i'm confused about how the red queen came back... the 30 recap was unnecessary any stupid. i can't believe I wasted time watching this. Right along with Prometheus, Hollywood continues to make films to stare at but not watch. There are so many ridiculous plot holes and cheesy lines that it's more like a Schwarzenegger flick from the 90's than anything worth putting on film today. Sci-fi fans watch Sci-fi for multiple variable that do not exist within normal drama. This didn't really quench the sci-fi thirst. Please do better next time.

Paul W.S Anderson is again back an is once again the director of the new Resident Evil. But this time, the film is a joke, the script is lousy and is to dramatic! The theme song is played every second minutes and you will eventually get enough of this song. But if you've seen the last 5 movies and you wanna see what happens to our hero Alice, you might as well watch it. But do not set your expectations up, make them as low as possible and you can properly get through this ridiculous excuse of an movie. But still the action scenes are great, and is enjoyable an there for i have given the movie 4 stars. But it is not worth 5 stars, because of the silly plot. Enjoy... O:

I have just finished watching the fifth installment in the Resident Evil series with my house-mates after getting psyched for the next bought of cameos, action sequences and a view into the ever popular theme of 'Zombie Apocalypse'. I've come away not only feeling robbed of the overpriced 3D glasses, but confused and angry, much like fat kid with no jelly. The movie opens with a fantastic sequence including a slow motion rewind of the fallout from when the Umbrella Corporation located our hero (Alice) aboard the supposed safe zone, a ship called Arcadia. After watching the battle unfold, including the first (of what soon becomes tiresomely many) Tom and Jerry-like showdowns between Jovovich and Guillory (Valentine), the audience is treated to several relayed shots of action scenes from the previous movies, all of which is conveniently explained by Alices latest unkillable female friend, Ada Wong (Bingbing Li). Helping the ladies escape are a team of male characters, some referencing previous movies (Boris Kodjoe as Luther West) and some as a nod to the original video games (John Uurb as Leon Kennedy) What follows is two hours worth of unfinished plots, confusing references, sudden appearances of cast members playing multiple parts (Good Rodriguez, Bad Rodriguez) and more stock henchmen, some of which are undead Nazis (yes, really). Large scale battle scenes take place in famous cities like Moscow and New York while the invincible ladies and their male friends (who get shot, but thats okay. 'Cause they're MEN) stumble closer together to finally make their way out of the newest Umbrella base, which is of course located in Russia. Underwater. And ice. And there's submarines. Confused? Good. So after a lovely Dawn of the Dead Esq scene that takes place just after the credits, Alice and Wong find themselves discovering a clone child, who thinks Alice is her mum. Alice decides to keep her brand new clone child, because, your face, thats why. The addition of a sudden maternal bond from the erstwhile stone cold undead killing machine feels out of place, so much so that the wooden interactions between the cast from that point on tells us that even the characters simply aren't buying it. The whole movie plays out uncomfortably, somewhere between seeing a train crash and hearing an old lady try to muffle a queef with her handbag. I strongly advise you to wait for DVD.

There really isn't much to say about this movie in all honesty.Its the worst of them all, and the story line is nonexistent.But is it really that bad? Both yes and no.Most RE fans will watch this movie regardless if had 0.1 out 10. Most of you will actually enjoy the 1.5 hour of entertainment if offers you.However, it is hard to actually explain why this is so bad.The characters are disappointing ( except Ada Wong ) The story line is disappointing.However, the VFX is by todays standard quite amazing, and thats the main reason you go see this movie, well, and to follow the "story"The action however, gets stupid many times, thats why the effects sometime feels like a waste of space and time.6/10 is probably to high tbh, but I'm speaking mainly for the fans of the RE genre, and if you really think back after watching this movie you find out that the story really isn't that bad.So why is it so bad yet it isn't?The problem occurs here when the very very bad of music, effects, action, acting, story etc-etc gets mixed up with some of the very well made moments of the movie, you don't know what the hell to say about it at all and just finds everything confusing.What bothers me most personally is all the unrealistic moments that occurs with movies like this tho.For example: When the bad guys always miss with their weapons, people scream just to reveal themselves, or when the bioweapons activated by the red queen have spikes trough their entire body and a big bag around their face can see everything around them and have to carry a big axe as weapon instead of just using a super-big mini-gun with thousands of bullets. I guess there's a random reason for that as well ( after all they are inside umbrella and they control the entire environment )Or... when they never go out of bullets, yet they are almost completely naked.This is what you have to take tho, so many movies made loads of these big mistake's that they are commonly accepted probably.Eaither way, the movie is worth watching for the end only tho, I promise.Golden Arts scores this movie a 6/10. Its not worth paying for IMO, still worth watching when you have time to kill.

Review title: Hmmm.... Way to kill the movie series, Mr Anderson....
Review_body: Well, it seems this movie was made just to cash in as much as possible from all of us, lovers of the Resident Evil franchise (games and/or movies). After the cliffhanger of the last movie, most of me and my friends and colleagues who love a good action/horror movie were interested to see how Alice could escape the predicament that was falling upon her. If you've seen the other movies of the series, you expect a certain form of quality of this latest installment. DO NOT WATCH IT... Clones, clones, clones... yada yada yada... Even the action in the movie turns dull after 15 minutes in. No story, dumb action, lame clones (oh, did i already mention the clones ??). If this ever one gets released to DVD (God forbid), don't bother until it gets into those nice sell-out baskets for one dollar or euro... and that's event stretching it ! One last thing, if you ever intend to watch the movies, do a movie marathon: if you want to feel like you've had a serious kick in the groin, make sure you watch Retribution. If you like to end the 'marathon' with a good note, SKIP Retribution !

Review title: Yes, it may not be 28 days later, but it is still fun!
Review_body: I am a huge fan of the Resident Evil films. Not for plot, not for horror, but for sheer entertainment. Not necessarily for the right reasons though...So, the plot (which is pretty thin, but at least not clichéd) Long, ridiculously long backwards sequence which is repeated later in the film and hence serves no plot or speed device. Woot! After Resident Evil Afterlife, Alice has been caught by Umbrella, and somehow Wesker is a good guy? No idea why, but hey. There is a sequence where clones of popular characters appear as a zombie invasion occurs. Milla Jovovich has a daughter now. who she keeps throughout the film. And Ada Wong is going to help Alice escape with Wesker, with Luther, Barry Burton, Leon S Kennedy and two other characters who we don't need to care about as they weren't in the title sequence and die pretty soon after (that was a kind-of spoiler by the way. As was good Wesker. Sorry). So, they go around blowing up stuff. And fighting zombies. And fighting evil clones who work for Umbrella, under the guard of Jill Valentine (who has the weird spider thing on her). People die, zombies die, Michele Rodriguez is yet again amazing (she is underrated for her versatility in my opinion) as she plays good and evil, and Colin Salmon is underused. (Spoiler here) and why did they kill Luther?! Sad times. Despite a few silly things, you can sit through it and enjoy it. It may not be scary, but it has Michele Rodriguez in it so it is instantly 10 times better. And there is an interesting future for the series...P.S. there is an extra bit of good news. It wasn't directed by Uwe Boll.

As an avid fan of the Resident Evil video game series, I have enjoyed all of the Resident Evil films, including this latest installment. While this film may not, critically speaking, be a brilliant film, I personally enjoyed it. Despite the fact that the films do not follow the exact plot of the video games, they still contain plenty of the characters, monsters and elements of the video games, much to the delight of fans like myself, especially the first appearance of my favorite character from the video games, Leon Kennedy. I recommend this for movie goers who enjoy the occasional random action film and for the fans of the video game series. A fantastic reverse intro sequence and plenty of action.

After 4 movies, it is pretty obvious that plot and story will be secondary in the 5th entry. With this thought in mind I went to see RE5 today.The bad things about the movie are the expected ones (lack of plot, lots of plot holes and unexplained situations, not so good acting, etc.), but I think the worst was to continue the story directly from the end of the last movie and not even show 3 of the main characters of the last scene of the previous movie.Now the good things about this movie were the action scenes. the non-stop action of the movie also made me pay much attention and not notice the time pass. comparing the 3D and slow-mo with RE4, I think this movie had less, but it was used in a better way. For example there is a scene Alice shoots the head of a zombie directly in front of the camera, and the effect is that blood splatters in the camera, in 3D!!! It was much better than the "let's do a 3D movie just because it should look good" feel of the last movie. Also the beginning of the movie was, although a loss of time, as original as it could get. I think it was a great idea to play the credits in slow-mo reverse and later play the same scene straight.The best things about the movie though, I thought it was the music and the homage to all games and movies. as in RE4, the score matches the action of the scene, like a fast pace when action is going on regular time, and slowing together with the slow-mo of the scene. the use of RE4 music for the reenactment of that movie's scene was also a good idea, because increases the deja vu feeling.all in all, 8 out of 10. plot and story are N/A for this movie, so the score is high just because of the fun. missed the 9 because missed some characters.

Review title: Resident Evil Enters the Schumacher Era
Review_body: It's safe to say, however, that the Resident Evil franchise has stepped into the Schumacher era of its overlong lifespan. Alice may not be sporting rubber nipples on her suit, but the entire film had its own metaphysical rubber nipples popping out left and right. The first rubber nipple is during the intro in which Milla Jovovich speaks to the camera and explains all the events from the previous films (at least in Apocalypse that made sense, because toward the end of the film we saw that she talked to a camcorder); then the film essentially starts straight to the Dawn of the Dead rip-off, which Alice wakes up in a suburban house with a mute daughter (that speaks just fine) and husband Carlos Olivera (what?!) and then Carlos gets bit, oh no, and it's so blatantly obvious that the film is copying Dawn that I expected to see Ving Rhames dressed as a cop and say the same exact lines he said to Sarah Polley; then, what these not-quite-literal rubber nipples made me giggle the most was all the copy and pasted elements from the video game franchise that has no rhyme or reason to even be in the film. For instance, the zombies now have mouths like the majini from Resident Evil 5—you know, the mouths which CAPCOM clearly took from Guillermo del Toro's Blade 2 and made them not as scary; yeah, those mouths—and in Retribution, I finally thought that Anderson actually was about to make sense of something every fan of the video game franchise was confused about. The Red Queen told us—yes, literally, she talks to the camera too (Alice isn't the only one)—that she was initiating the Las Plagas Undead. In my mind, I thought, Yes, finally he's explaining why the zombies have become fast with majini-mouths. But, really . . . it was his excuse to have zombies with guns and chainsaws (but why wield a chainsaw if you can use a gun?), that could ride motorcycles and shoot guns at the same time—if that's a spoiler, it's a spoiler best known upfront. This isn't scary; this is outrageously funny. What also doesn't make sense is the fact that the Umbrella Corporation currently manufactures the Executioners from Resident Evil 5 and meticulously hammers in each nail in their heads and shoulders just for theatrics—if it didn't make sense in RE5, it's definitely going to be a laugh riot in Retribution. Which it was. But even funnier yet, while Alice was fighting Jill, and Luther (didn't he die in Afterlife? I swear he did) and Leon were fighting the evil Las Plagas-infected Rain (I was expecting her to become a giant sea monster like Irving in RE5), I thought to myself, Paul might make terrible Resident Evil films, but he might make a good Mortal Kombat film . . . then I realized he already did . . . and it was terrible.What Paul W.S. Anderson doesn't seem to understand is that copying moments and characters from the games and pasting them into the films isn't working. Fan boys are going to pick out the illogical inclusion of the characters, like I am right now; and people who aren't fans of the games aren't going to care if Leon is in the film or not. At this point, however, I think Paul W.S. Anderson knows how terrible the films are, and he's taking advantage of it—bringing characters back to life just for giggles, having hilariously cheesy dialogue every chance available, and not really giving a crap how terrible the actors are acting (the actor who plays Leon, for instance, just talks louder when he is supposed to be angry)—also, Sienna Guillory—who plays Jill—was by far the weakest in the film even though she did fairly well as Jill Valentine in Apocalypse.And now we're getting to a point in the Resident Evil film franchise in which the rubber nipples are exposed—the fan boys only watch the films to laugh; the unbiased viewers might come out thinking it was entertaining, but over the top, and none of the monsters made any sense (and they wouldn't be alone—the B.O.W.'s didn't make any sense to me either); the actors are lazy; the plot is confusing when it's vague and absurd when it's clear; and worse of all, the director doesn't care about the source material anymore.I think that Hollywood might pull out the Nolan card pretty soon, because Resident Evil does have very important contemporary themes. Biological warfare seems more realistic than nuclear in this day and age, but Paul and friends seem to be stuck on the zombies and the theatrics of the game franchise, rather than the scientific aspects, the concepts, the survival horror, and the atmospheric tension. What makes the Resident Evil video game franchise so endearing are the story and the characters (which is why Resident Evil 5 was the worst—the lack of survival horror put aside—because that's when the game franchise stopped caring about story and characters; but I blame the directors and producer of RE5 rather than CAPCOM as a whole), but Paul W.S. Anderson focuses on plot (which isn't the same as story) and dresses up actors like characters from the game franchise and names them that character from the game franchise and prays that the fans don't realize they're nothing like the character from the franchise. I give credit to the Harry Potter film series for at least attempting to stay true to the story of the books; while still they're nowhere near as good as the books because filmmakers tend to care more about plot than they do story—which is a wide spreading disease in the illiterate world of Hollywood—it's still an honorable attempt, unlike with the Resident Evil franchise. Seriously, the Resident Evil from games 1-4 has a good story, so why did Paul W.S. Anderson butcher it?

Review title: Poor Acting, Rips Off 'Aliens', and Time for a Series Reboot With A New Director
Review_body: The first 4 films were actually an enjoyable ride given their limited budget. They all featured great production design, good scores, and Milla alone is a perfect reason to watch them. However, this latest instalment felt cheaply made, put together in a hurry, and stole it's plot from one of the premier action films. Where to start?The Bad: Acting (other than Milla, the little girl, and 1 or 2 others), too much like a video game you couldn't play, The 3D didn't add much.The Good: Production design, a cool intro, energetic Tokyo fight sequence, good use of spatial mapping as in the first film, Russian zombies (with an homage to 'Shock Waves' perhaps) and a fun score by Tomandandy.Alice is a fun character, and echoes Milla's other strong female role models including Leeloo, Violet, and to some extent, Joan of Arc. It's one of the major reasons why she's appreciated by both men and women alike. Here she pulls off the mom role well, but it was just Ripley's role played by her. The writers could have given her more to work with than just stealing Aliens note-for-note. The parent/child storyline is nothing new in films, and Cameron definitely wasn't the first to use it effectively, but it's certainly stronger than the one used in 'Retribution'.Everything purposely felt cheesy this time around. It'll prob do well overseas but it's time for Paul to hand over the series to a new director and writers.

Well this review will be pretty short, it will somewhat make it easier to decide to watch or not to watch RER. Well i watched every Resident Evil movie so far, so if u watched them to, go for this one, u will find it amusing, did not say u will like it, well u will but in a funny way, it wont be boring. For all others there are a few perimeters which help u decide. Do u like beautiful woman in tight costumes kicking zombie asses? U don't really care much for story/acting/dialog in a action movie, u just want to see nice illogical action packed scenes?? If the answer is yes to these 2 questions then watch this movie, if not, plz don't do your brain harm by watching this movie. Do u have to watch other RE movies in order to understand this movie? Well lets say its even better not to watch any of the RE movies before this one, u will understand more. So why 6/10? Its simple, from 1h30min its 1h15min of action, good action scenes although illogical (watch it and u will know what im talking about) and i didn get bored, woalaa!! P.s. I almost forgot it, when they start talking plz shut ur ears...

Now this chapter really looks like a video game, too bad it's not the original one! You know, video games don't need a coherent plot, a logic proceedings and, above all, an explanation of what happens. I guess the author thinks this movie doesn't need that as well. Surprisingly enough he is the producer of the previous chapters (far better than this one). It's just a mix between old stuff from the first movie, tons of special effects and some ideas stolen from an old successful movie (Escape from New York). The end leaves the door open for yet another, likely worse, sequel! Save your money and time!

I went to the midnight showing, my dad and I have been with the movies every step of the way. I was so pumped to see this one, but maybe after the first thirty minutes I was completely bummed. I even turned over to my roommate and said, "This movie is terrible. It's so bad it's good. Honestly, my main complaint about this installment is the lack of dialogue. There weren't very many complete sentences, maybe six of them throughout the whole movie? Most from Wesker. That's me exaggerating -- the film is complete madness, the visuals are great and as others have review "complete eye candy." Any fan of the film is of course already on board, but I can only hope that they felt the same way. This movie was terrible-- as a fan I loved it. You'll make up your mind either way. Don't look for much plot development, character development-- no one is growing, neither is the story. The film leads with a great step into a sixth installment, I can only hope Anderson will grow some respect for the fans and have our characters actually SAY SOMETHING this time. I don't write many reviews, so I apologize if there is anything wrong with it-- if it's not the greatest. The 3D is completely worth it... so if you are a fan of three-d movies, check it out.

Review title: I saw it first day first show in India... big mistake...
Review_body: Well I am a die hard fan of the series and was eagerly awaiting this one.The film is a total waste of time money CGI and talent.. no new twists came up..very little/almost nil plot development.. I just could not connect with any of the characters and in the end frankly did not care if they live or die. The threats also dint seem real.. a single plot carried the whole movie.All in all BAD.I will still go to see first day first show of this if there is a next part.

Review title: Easily the WORST of the series!
Review_body: I'v been a really big fan of this franchise since day one, And this movie was just a complete and utter disappointment for me. There loads of faults that i had found with the last one, but at least i walked out of the theater happy after seeing "Afterlife"....But with Retribution i was like WTF did i just see??!!! It was so bad.....I had really high expectations because of seeing all these cool characters from the previous movies return, Like Jill Valentine, Rain, Carlos....And you would think that Alice will be extremely anguised and hurt seeing the people she cared about turned against her by Umbrella...But, NOPE! It looks like she didn't care at all....She didn't even resist trying to kill Jill when she knows that Jill is under the Red Queen's control! And speaking of the Red Queen, I was pretty excited that she was back, but replacing her with a snotty little girl actress that is as threatening as a mouse?! What a freakin joke! This movie was a HUGE waste of potential! It played out like a video game, with hardly any dialogue....If there was any, It was all mostly just one-liners, like Alice saying "waiting for a written invitation?" WTF! And no character development or interactions between these characters whatsoever. Jill, Carlos, & Rain were really revelant to Alice and NOTTING?? Not one shred of emotion, shock or resistance towards them??!! The acting was BAD. & I never had a problem with the acting from the previous films. Jill Valentine was the biggest waste of the movie for me, After YEARS of waiting for her return and fighting for her return, We get absolute CRAP! The fans should write the next movie, When are these stupid studios/directors realize that our imput holds extreme importance because these movies are being made for us! Yet it seems that they made this movie for Apes. Which i'm sure they wouldn't like it either! And Paul needs to make his wife step aside sometimes ans let another actor have a chance to shine and kick ass! The reason why i didn't give this movie one star, because i really liked the suburbia outbreak scene, And the character Becky, was the only good actress in the movie! I also liked "good" Rain but just ANOTHER huge waste......The white corridor scene was cool too....I thought the hugely anticipated Jill VS. Alice scene was alright....It was mostly dance fighting, which was a huge letdown...It should have been way more brutal and bloody. & it irked me off because you can tell when the Jill Valentine stunt double is fighting because of the CHEAP wig, That looks like it has been purchased from "Shaynayay's wigshop"...lol

I am sick to death of all these pseudo, self styled armchair critics. Get a life, it's only a movie for God sake. It's not the end of the world. Nobody cares whether you hated the movie or not. If you're concerned about blowing $10 bucks, stay home, save your money and save the rest of us from having to waste time reading your frustrated drivel. The world is going to hell in a hand basket and your worried whether a stupid movie fits your intellectual sensitivities or not. Professional critics are bad enough without having some critic wannabe mudding the waters. Park it @ home and read a friggin' book! Let the rest of us go out for a night of pure escapism and enjoy the movie. if it sucks, I'm sure we'll survive it.

When I saw Retribution in the theaters earlier this year, I wasn't too impressed. The plot was wacky and it wasn't scary. Actually, the Resident Evil movies have been getting less scary since the first one, which I thought was scary and had a very creepy feel to it. I guess the wacky plot didn't really bother me too much though, since it is a zombie movie, so my belief is suspended pretty high anyway. But the movie just wasn't scary, and for a zombie flick, there should be some decent scares.When I saw that it was released on Blu-ray the other day, I started thinking about the movie all over again. But this time, I took it all in from an action-flick perspective. I realized I had to own this movie. Retribution is balls to the wall action and eye candy. It doesn't get much better than this. It's funny that that's all it took to totally change my mind about this film, but it did. Retribution has everything you'd look for in an action film, plus zombies. I'm not saying it's film of the year, but it's a very satisfying action movie experience. Something you'll watch for the action and graphics, not for the scares. If you take the movie this way, you'll enjoy all it has to offer. 8 out of 10 stars.

is it a movie for film snobs? nope. is it for people who watch a film a week?. nope. what is this film? it's a cgi filled video game on wheels.what gets me is all the negative reviews of this movie. what did you expect? an award winner? a picture that leaves a deep feeling of "wow what a thought provoking piece of art"? this is a video game put to the really big screen.this is a movie to watch for big 'splosions and huge action.the best part of this movie is that people won't like it. are you a res fan? check. do you like movies that just entertain without pretense? check. like a movie that just kills a couple hours and makes you happy? check.lets let the nature of this movie stand. it is what it is it's not high art, but f*** it 'splosions are awesome!

Review title: Simply amazing, Awesome cast, and astounding special effects.
Review_body: I first seen the Resident Evil series in 2010, when Afterlife came out, so I watched the entire series...and I must say, I was counting the days when I heard Retribution was coming out. And I Sep. 14 I went with some friends and we had a blast. The movie was amazing, Milla was kick ass as usual. and you can see Paul Anderson's touch in the film. I loved it, nonstop action and gorgeous babes kicking ass....Retribution was made as a Action/Horror film, so all you people complaining that there's not enough character build up and blah blah, shut up!, its not a drama and its prob. not gonna win an Oscar, but if your a RE fan, you'll simply love Retribution! 15/10 :) enjoy

Review title: I regret I didin't check reviews before visiting the cinema
Review_body: I deeply regret that I spent so much money on the trip to the cinema (35 km from my home) + ticket. I also regret that I called my neighbor, too. It was such a big mistake! From now on, reading a few reviews will have priority against reservation etc. The first 15-20 minutes are quality scenes, very good sound and video effects, very good music. Everything begins in a perfect style. And then all drops into crap. Originality vanishes like mist and you wake up in the middle of clichés and copied ideas. The Matrix, Underworld, Alien/Prometheus and maybe some other movies have been used as "source of inspiration'. Actors act horribly. They seem uninterested, bored. Some scenes reminded me of cheap porn movie intros. After some time all seemed to be scenes made for shooter games. There are some sort of simulated levels which Alice has to go through. It stinks so much of gaming. To name just a few examples, so some won't say I'm talking crap. 1. If Kate from Underworld had a girl, then Alice must have one, too. 2. Wesker is like Mr Smith or what his name was in Matrix. In the last scene he even moves so fast. 3. Alice's girl is captured by the huge monster that will put her in a sort of slimy cocoon - Alien/Prometheus. With all that money spent on fuel and cinema, I could have had a nice weekend in the woods. I have been waiting for Retribution since the beginning of year. Have seen previous parts and all were excellent. This was a nightmare. I cannot stop repeating what a huge cliché this was.

Review title: Successfully continues the RE franchise. It's not bad!
Review_body: I've seen quite some awful reviews , i'm glad i ignored them. I for one like this film better than it's predecessor. There's the Wesker twist, Rain gone bad, Jill gone good (back to normal), multicultural zombies, umbrella showing us it's teeth again, better effects, nice car chase, Milla never looked better, and to be honest i'm satisfied with the acting and the cast enough to enjoy this film.I find that it successfully mixes in one big bowl bits of other films, including ambiance, effects, recurring cast and we're all back to experiments yet again. THE ENDING is bad-ass and somehow fits the current flow of the franchise.It's NOT racist, or boring, or disappointing, you can never have enough latex, women fighting, gun fights and cheesy dialogues. But YOU can however have a little bit of all those things into one nice film. I FOR ONE ENJOYED IT QUITE A BIT, and just an advice: ALWAYS IGNORE reviews good or bad. Go with your guts. I felt like watching such a film, i'm glad i did. Tomorrow i might watch some romance...who knows. Enjoy!!!

I did go see this movie with expectations of it being as good as Afterlife. While I would give Afterlife a 10+, I only gave this a nine. Sure there are some plot holes which could have been filled in. However, The RE series is about effects, action, sci-fi technology, the end of the world, massive explosions, Milla Jovovich as Alice kicking butt. One thing the movie was - unpredictable. I think Capcom have hit the nail on the head with Andersen, he is a great director with a great, intensely vibrant vision. The finale was epic, both story wise and visually, and yes - a fantastic cliffhanger. It is my 2nd favourite movie of the year, first being The Dark Knight Rises. I do think some parts of the end of Afterlife could have been touched on more, been better explained, but at the end of the day, there were more mutants, the zombies were the most creative I have seen yet. This movie is getting mixed reviews but I hope it makes a killing at the box office - I still want a sixth film! GO SEE IT WITH AN OPEN MIND!

Review title: If you liked the previous RE .. Avoid this!
Review_body: First ever review on IMDb, had to sign up and complain about this film. A lot of people don't really like the previous resident evil installments but there's a few of us that do! I'm one of them! Here's a quick breakdown why.RE1: Start of its own story, underground zombie outbreak with hybrid "boss" like monsters with a team of specialized soldiers fighting it all. Awesome right? RE2: Carries on from the first, the Hive is opened and has now infected the surrounding Racoon city. More soldiers, more survivors with their own mini back stories, more action with bigger guns and more "Boss" like elements and Alice discovering her powers more. Awesome.RE3: Virus has spread from racoon city and now pretty much has overtaken the world. Small band of survivors trying to get by and finding and helping anyone else along the way with characters from previous installments. Even bigger, more badass, more guns, more Alice powers and more enemies along the way. Awesome.RE4: Ending of RE3 was a promise of a virus free zone, whatever characters that were left have gone their. Alice follows and finds, well even more zombies bigger and more badass. Follows the RE5 game in some ways with new enemies and the game characters. Film ends with us wanting to know whats going to happen next. Oh and its in a huge prison they thinks safe... Awesome right? Now we come to Retribution. Carries on from none of the above, is a massive random mix match of thoughts and stupid over the top ideas we've all seen countless times before. There's no story, there's no plot. Halfway through i started to play on my phone. I couldn't care less what happened or who lived or died. Forgot how it ends and i hope the upcoming Final Chapter will continue from RE4 and finish once and for all what we all wanted to know would happen in this one. I honestly don't even know what i just watched. Just forget it and leave it alone.

A good entry but not great one . Milla once again is great as Alice but it's the return of Sienna Guillory that steals the film . The trend continues as it's more of a action film than a horror film since the first one. And no real surprises which is disappointing ,also Afterlife is a better film than this one . You get some familiar faces also returning which is good, but things do seem rushed as the running time is around 90mins. plus the writing is lacking a bit, mashed up with lots of chaos to hide the weak points of the film & a borrowed element from another sci-fi film in the mix . It's entertaining enough & the return of Sienna Guillory is awesome but you'll want more.

Review title: rushed, soundtrack did not fit, but it was fun
Review_body: I own the the previous four movies on video and will be adding this one around New Year's.You know what to expect if you are still hanging around as a fan after four blood-soaked, enjoyable movies. This fifth installment into the Resident Evil series reminded me a lot of the fourth Underworld movie in the way that it is constructed.Some of the acting here is wooden, but the performances during the action scenes make up for it. I was not satisfied at the end, was wanting more and did not want to wait another two years if we are fortunate to experience a sixth.Even though it felt rushed, the soundtrack is slow in order to give the movie a feeling of epicness. If you peeked at the cast list then it is understandable. An action movie that is slow does annoy me some but not enough to lessen the fun of the action scenes.We leave behind the horror genre tag and become a sci-fi/action movie so the scares may be gone, but the excitement does not go away with it.Knowledge of the first and fourth movie seem to be the most important here so you may want to revisit those before watching the fifth.

Where do I begin? I just came back from the movie but, surprisingly, I did not feel disappointed like I did when I came back from seeing Snow White and the Huntsman. This time, I knew what to expect: Alice kicking ass while everyone else dies, basically. Instead of disappointment, I was a little surprised by how it wasn't THAT bad (like Afterlife), but there were a lot of flaws. **Text ahead contains spoilers** I'm no critic, but none of the acting made me cringe like SWATH *cough*. I thought every character, even the actress who played Ada (will get to her later) and the little girl were good. The 3D was awesome, of course, and I think they sped up the slowdowns. There was still slowmo, though. Not as much as Afterlife, thank god. Now, characters. Alice showed a lot of vulnerability in this movie, and that's a good thing. We all know she's badass, but this time we were shown that she's not invincible. There were a lot of questions, like why didn't she question that Wesker was alive? Where's Chris and Claire? Besides Good Rain/Bad Rain, I actually liked Ada. I looooved the scene from RE4 when she goes up again Alice but is cut short by a knife to the neck. Of course, we all know Leon should've been doing that. I think the actress sounded a lot like Ada Wong herself, too. My only problem is that she did not get enough screen time. Jill was awesome in the movie, but again lacked screen time. It's true, she does sound kind of strange in the beginning. I think the scene where Alice gets off the scarab and she regains her senses should've been more dramatic. Leon was...okay. He didn't feel like Leon, besides his black shirt and the hair. My favorite part was when he placed a hand on Ada's thigh, though, and Ada was disgusted, haha. I liked Barry. He was badass, but, like everyone but Alice, lacked screen time. I loved the part with his magnum. Oh, and no, there was no "Jill Sandwich." :( G Rain/B Rain were probably my favorite. Great acting from her, and I think she had the most personality than everyone else.]I liked Luther in this better than Afterlife. There was just...a little more to him, in my opinion. My main problem with these movies is the lack of development. When the characters die, you feel nothing. You just shrug it off. My second problem in this movie was the action. As a huge action fan, I felt like it was just too much. Things just popped up randomly, leaving absolutely no room for character development or story. Also, there wasn't that intense, adrenaline feeling when characters are killing. I felt that in Afterlife, but none in this because I felt like there was no suspense/thrill during the acton scenes in this. Although the pacing wasn't cringe-worthy, there were still a lot of shots where they should've just continued instead of resuming back to Alice. The script was horrible, in my opinion, and cliché. "I'm gonna kill you," or "Good luck," etc. Needs more creative comebacks/threats. Also, what the hell was up with the "Las Plagas Undead?" They looked like Nazis. And no Licker would be that big. ._. The Becky/Alice scenes were okay and a little touching. Probably the only attempt to provide development and emotion in the movie. Becky's remark to Rain on Bad Rain was pretty hilarious; it got the whole theatre chuckling. So, this concludes my review. Sorry if I put too much. Overall, I think it was average. Not horrible, but not great. Better than the previous two, but not better than the first two. If you're just looking for an action-packed movie with no story or character development, and lots of random deaths, this is for you. There were a few jump scenes, as well. The best part where I didn't feel as lethargic during the rest of the movie was the last, epic scene with the Alice vs. Jill fight. Also, Bad Rain just pummeled everyone, lol!

I though this was a zombie film but disappointment was written all over me. The kid was the only one that gave me some emotional response during the movie, hurray. Else this was a let down. Im a Resident Evil fan and I liked the new game that came out but this is just awful. The zombies were... well, lets just leave it at that. No point going into the depths of this film since you wont find it. I only started feeling a bit excited at the end scene.. shame. Overall, the acting was robotic, the story wasn't really there and everything was way too rush.3/10

Review title: RE: Retribution is the best for me.
Review_body: I rated this 10 because I loved it. I don't care about what the others are saying. I loved the visuals, the acting, the actresses, everything! I personally like Ada Wong. She is gorgeous. The other actors and actresses are fine too. I really loved the story. I guess critics are really hard to please. But myself, I really enjoyed this film i don't know why. The acting is pretty good to. I regret not watching this in the cinema. I will definitely watch the succeeding movies in the cinema. I don't get it why people hate this movie so much. I'm pretty sure I will watch the next film after this. I'll keep supporting the Resident Evil series for sure. Bingbing Li, Marry me!

Resident evil retribution is the best one of all of the other movies the special effects where amazing Milla and the whole cast did a great job. It does not look the way you think when you first start to watch the move but then it starts up and then it never slows down. This movie keeps you in your seat the whole time. When the movie ended I was very sad that it was over I did not want it to end. You should never listen to the gamers or critics they don't know anything the gamers always complain that the movie is not like the games or things like that don't listen to them this is a must see movie! Milla never disappoints she is great go see this movie!!

Review title: This is a pure action 1hr SCI-fi movie, not a drama!
Review_body: I am surprised, and kind-a disturbed by the ignorance of many of the viewers here. You should familiarize with what you are paying for before you spend money on movie tickets, return at home and criticize without understanding the concept.Let me get some things clear: * This is an action SCI-FI(=NOT REAL) movie - don't expect realism! This movie could only be compared to the 90's action movies with lots of cool effects. The first movie already set the tone that this is unrealistic story (do you believe that zombies actually exist?). If you want realism, become a volunteer in Iraq or Afghanistan.* This is a part of s sequence - threat this as another part of the series. Why would you otherwise expect 1hr of references to the old movies, if it is supposed that you already watched them? This is not Star Wars! This part was a pure 1hr action instead of 1hr talks and clichés and like <1 min action. Find out what <<< holism >>> is and apply it to this movie franchise. Maybe then you will understand it.* Why would you still compare it to the games? If you played the games and expect a movie on the games, basically you will be watching a game play-through. (Then I will be laughing on comments like "well spent money")The only criticism that I have about the series is that Paul drifted away from the zombies being the main issue to being no obstacle at all and focusing on bigger issues like Wesker and stronger mutants. But I understand his decision. If he dramatizes the zombies every new episode the script would be trivial like those TV zombie series. After all , the main character matures and learns how to kill zombies better. This is a pure action SCI-fi movie, not a drama! Are you still confused? Then, probably the RE movie franchise isn't for you.

Review title: Critics, stop jumping on the bandwagon and give untrue negative critiques.
Review_body: Hello everyone, I'm a 17 year-old teen who just went out to watch Resident Evil: Retribution with his friends tonight.I have been a fan since 2002, with my Mom and we just love Milla Jovovich (Alice) so freaking much - she has so much chemistry with the whole RE (Resident Evil) series itself.First of all, I would have to apologize for my English since it's my 2nd language, not my native language. This is my first time reviewing a movie on IMDb and the reason I am doing this is because I am so infuriated by so many negative reviews, especially the one which is being featured at the IMDb page, saying oh how this movie sucks and how Anderson ran into writing blocks, yadda, yadda, yadda.You know, since the first movie, people have been giving negative critiques, saying it is generic, saying there is no originality, saying there is no storyline, saying there are plot holes. What has become out of this is a whole let's-give-RE-bad-reviews-all-the-time bandwagon. I mean, it is just so easy finding out flaws out of a movie if you put your mind in it. This movie is awesome for the following reasons: 1) Milla Jovovich - She is so full of energy. Her fighting scenes are so surreal and the way she talks, the way she moves, the whole set just redefines Alice as the whole zombie-killing badass. Her acting is so commendable on this installment. There was one scene - which I won't spoil - where she had to decide quickly and certain circumstances indicated that she might be in grave danger and just that moment she shred a tear of fear; this scene was so powerful I still remember it now.2) Opening credits - Seriously, negative reviewers? It is one of the most creative ones I have seen for a horror movie. It was so cool seeing bullets of guns flying back to their origins and everything was just spectacular. The cinematography was spot-on for the opening credits. For the first in my life, I didn't mind the long opening credits. 3) Action-packed - Who wants a zombie movie without action? This whole movie was so freaking action packed, I found myself not breathing during so many scenes. This movie, I assure you, would hold you on to your seats and make you not wanting to blink, because each scene is just so brightly put together.4) Creativity - Seriously? Generic? I have never seen such beautifully crafted zombies in any zombie movies I've seen. This movie just gave a variety of the undead I was so awed whenever the undead attacked Alice or her friends.I would not drone on and on because I realize I am not the kind of person who gets his points across easily. I do know we are all entitled to our opinions but I just can't stand it when the negative reviews are all so unnecessarily negative. Give some credit to this RE's installment's team! They did a great job! Li Bing Bing (Ada) also did great - she had significant chemistry with Alice and I loved it.Yes, there were plot holes but there were quite minor, and the mind-blowing scenes just overwhelmed these "plot holes".If you didn't like the movie, you're most probably just another critic who is on the bandwagon or a person who hates zombie movies.I love zombie movies. I love Milla Jovovich. I love Resident Evil. Keep 'em coming.8/10

As a huge fan of Resident Evil games, this movie (and all the others) are a big disappointment. First of all, there's Alice. I Mean, who the hell is she? Some kind of a freak with zombie super-powers who should never be in any of the movies. IT'S A RESIDENT EVIL MOVIE, THE FANS WANTS TO SEE OUR BELOVED CLAIRE, JILL, CHRIS, LEON, ETC AS THE PROTAGONISTS, NOT HER!OK, all of those were present in the last movies, but they were nothing but supporting characters for Alice. Ada for example couldn't be worse: in the video game series she is a mysterious woman, full of herself, with legendary abilities, in the movie, she's no more than a Chinese little girl who barely got out of her 18's. Leon is just a selfish coward who wanted to let everybody die to save himself, Barry is a weirdo, and there's Jill.. the worst character of them all, who became a umbrella hybrid or anything like that. And I'm still trying to forget that shameful presentation of Claire in the third movie. Of course they're all there to watch Alice save the day and could be easily replaced with any nobody in the plot. Maybe that's what's went too wrong with those movies: they insists with Alice, when all of the fans wants her far away as possible and our beloved video game heroes taking the action as they did in the games. 3 stars because the fighting scenes were definitely nice, and I wouldn't mind paying attention to the story, because it's simply one of the worst that I've seen in a long time. It's actually great that this movie revenues didn't payed the costs, maybe they'll have to listen to fans and finally make a decent, loyal to the game sequence, or to finish this horrible series, let the zombies (are they still zombies anyway?) take over the world.

I'm not sure about the number of people who have stuck with these movies over the years, but i'm betting that many of them are fans of the video games from whence they are based. That being said, any comparison between the movies, and the video games should be taken lightly.The movie starts with the familiar Resident Evil Movie formula. This is starting from the cliff hanger from the last movie, and retconning it until it becomes something completely unlike what is shown at the end of the previous movie. What I mean is, you will lose the current story's plot and even some key characters between titles, or within the first 10 minutes of the subsequent film.This can be noted primarily in the third movie with the absence of Jill Valentine. She makes an appearance at the end of the second installment, Resident Evil Apocalypse, when Jill and friends break Alice out of her Umbrella holding cell. Her fate is undetermined until the end of the fourth movie where she appears to serve as a cliff hanger.In case you get utterly confused between titles, Alice, the franchises' main protagonist, is willing to recap the entire series thus far, and throws in some extra information. (Such as Jill Valentine being captured by Umbrella.)This is also a familiar element of the Resident Evil Movies.Our opening scene is a backwards, slow motion battle of what is about to ensue after we speak with Alice. This is also known as the conclusion to our cliff hanger from the previous movie. This is all it is. It serves little purpose to the rest of the film, except Alice is once again captured by Umbrella and is put in a holding cell. And there you have your dynamic of the fifth movie. Alice must escape from Umbrella's grasp once again.Unfortunately, this is the plot of Retribution. Alice escaping, but with the help of some familiar heroes from the video game series. Moreover, we have lost the Redfield Siblings, who play important roles with each of the new characters that appear in Retribution. I'd like to also add that their fates are unknown. Shocker.Jill Valentine and Leon S. Kennedy are the most notable characters that appear in the film from the video game series. Jill is in her Resident Evil 5 get up, while Leon is in his Resident Evil 4's. Barry Burton is also in this film, but i'd rather not get into that. He is along side Leon, which makes no sense in the context of the games, and is killed in the movie. Bummer. Leon and Barry DID appear in a non cannon game together, but again it did not happen in accordance to the Resident Evil video game time line.What i'd like to say about the absence of the Redfield siblings is that their characters were crucial to those of Jill and Leon's and even to Barry. Leon and Claire Redfield have a history in Resident Evil 2, While Jill and Chris are long time partners throughout the series. Chris is ultimately the one who saves Jill in Resident Evil 5, thus it is a shame that they were unable to appear in the same film together. If anything, Barry should have reprised Chris's role in the film, as he also has a history with Jill Valentine. But similarly, he makes no interaction with Jill and is killed.The plot throws in a little deaf girl who believes she is Alice's daughter. This whole simulation and cloning thing has confused me throughout the series and still does in this movie. The little girl does offer some emotional and heart wrenching parts, but is ultimately pointless to the progression of the film. What happened to the last little girl they had as a minor character? She disappeared and was never heard of again after Apocalypse.The movie ends with an awesome fight scene and a pointless one. Rain, from the first movie, reappears (as two different characters) and occupies the men, while Alice fights Jill. Another familiar formula: a major character from the previous film, absent in the video games, is killed in the sequel. This is Luther, although his death had a minor, if non existent, effect on me.Alice, with little effort, manages to pull the brainwashing device from Jill's chest, and saves the day. They are all rescued by a helicopter, where Alice is met face to face with Wesker, the main antagonist from the video game series and from the fourth movie. It is unclear as to why he's alive, and i'm still not sure how he's turned 'good' in this movie, but it ends with Him, Leon, Jill, Wesker, and Ada all side by side, ready to face the sequel.But one question remains, no a few, but how will the ending of Retribution be retconned and summed up in the first ten minutes of the sixth film? Which characters will disappear with no explanation? Which of the video game characters will make a a debut? My theory is that each video game character has a two movie limit. Jill, unfortunately, will be out, and Leaon and Ada will stay.Overall, the movie was decent and entertaining. It didn't do much plot wise, but was still good. I like some details from the games that the writers paid attention to, like Jill's VZ61s from RE5, and Barry's famous magnum (but without his silly catchphrases.) I know i said comparisons to the games should be take lightly, but i guess that's all i've done in this review. So go see this movie, and if you've missed one, you can buy all four in a blu ray bundle.8/10

Review title: Great... Was better than I thought by along way
Review_body: The first RE will always be the best. This one IMHO is the second best as in the first it is one action sequence after another held together by a really thin plot. If you are am RE fan you know what you are getting. I love that they bought back some of the best characters from the previous ones (michelle Rodriguez) and of course introduced Ada Wong who looks absolutely stunning in all her scenes. Leon from the RE games also introduced ( looked like an Avenger.....) Good will hunting this is not but if you want 1.5 hrs of zombie action this is your fix and should rated as such. Onward to the final installation hopefully next year...

Let's face it, RE: Retribution is awesome... in my opinion probably the best one yet! There are some scenes where the CGI fails to amuse the audience because it is fake-looking. Also, some things just don't make sense. FOR EXAMPLE:At the near end of the film where Alice and Jill are fighting, Jill grabs Alice by the throat and attempts to push her head into the conveyor wheel (a tank-like wheel) of a vehicle. The wheel is not yet moving. It suddenly turns on by itself, and Jill continues the attempt to kill Alice.In conclusion, RE: Retribution (in my opinion) is the best RE yet. However, times of fake looking CGI hold me back from giving it a higher score.=====8/10=====

Review title: The extreme worst of all Resident Evil series
Review_body: I love Resident Evil series. Despite the mediocre reviews it gets in the past, I still go to the cinema on its release and always looking forward for the next sequel. But RE5 fails beyond believe. The storyline is utterly crap. The action are cheesy, the actors are cheesy, the whole movie is a joke to the RE series. I am completely disappointed at how the whole movie turns out to be.*spoiler alert* The whole movie is set on one giant Umbrella underwater laboratory and Alice and friends is trying to break out of it. Along the way they encounter some zombies and finally got out. And that's literally about the summary of the whole story!They try to use music to intensify everything.. but it becomes very cheesy. Especially towards the end before the final fight when Jill walks out of the submarine.The Red Queen is total crap. Cheesy, stupid.. The fighting scene itself is very cheesy and unrealistic. They hardly get hit by a bullet even when they were standing in open view. But it seems like their bullet always managed to hit the enemy. Even the one bullet that hit Alice, didn't even do her much harm. What a load of crap.At the final fight, it was obvious some of them had had their bones cracked. But they were still standing and fighting as if their bone is not really a necessary part of their body. They look pretty healthy for someone with broken bone!When Alice beats Jill.. it was so obvious from the beginning that that's what needs to be done. But the scriptwriter must've made Alice so dumb that she did not realize that from the beginning. Sadly, the viewers are not as dumb as the scriptwriter.And on the final scene when Leon touches Ada's thigh.. THATS AS CHEESIEST AS IT COULD GET! I could almost cry looking at that scene. What the f... *sigh*I apologize for using a lot of "cheesy" word in my review. But it is exactly how I feel when I see it. It's like a bunch of amateurs movie makers trying to make action movie.All in all, I wouldn't even rate it 5 for effort. Its a total lazy movie writing. I still want to see RE6, but I seriously hope they do not FAIL as big as this one. What a load of crap this movie is.

Review title: WTF Happened? Watch and judge for yourself - But don't waste too much on it
Review_body: I was doing a small Resident Evil movie marathon in preparation for seeing this movie, and I was really looking forward to see how they could save the ending of the fourth one - But I was quite hopeful that I would at least get a good action story with an acceptable plot. That have been true for all the others in the series so why not this one.Well was I in for a rude awakening. Honestly if you enjoyed all the former movies and you consider them "part of their own story" meaning that your pretty much ignoring the video games when watching the movies then you'll find yourself even more amazed by how terrible this movie is.I will avoid going into details about plot as others have done that and perfectly expressed the errors in it (I am of course referring to those more negative reviews you'll find as most of the very positive ones doesn't really put a lot of effort into mentioning it.. maybe because even they would have trouble claiming it to be a good movie then ;) ).But I can easily sum-up the main problems with this movie: The plot and the acting. That is not a good thing for a movie and trust me it shows. The plot has some vague references to the former movie, but that's quickly forgotten and all your in for is a mess of action scenes and bad (and I mean bad) CGI effects. Somehow the actors manage to look not in the least interested in the gun battles they take part in, and at the same time do a damn good job to remove any sense of immersion you might have scrapped together, for instance by appearing utterly unfamiliar with handling their weapons.. There is some odd alien references.. or more likely "inspired" events that make no sense in the overall story and world.Finally the whole absurd-storm will end with you sitting back confused as to what you just watched, shaking your head in shocked astonishment, trying to comprehend just how bad it was. Then the anger will arise due to the disappointment of what this could have been and here I am writing a review to warn others.I personally will not count this as part of the series, I'll count it as the series failed little-brother rip-off that should never ever have been made.I cannot in any situation recommend this movie.. by far the most disappointing, meaningless and confounded mess I ever saw.

Review title: Has certain elements from the Games, to help adapt fans to the Movie....
Review_body: There's a lot of hate for this movie, in my opinion i think Paul W.S. Anderson has improved his work for the Resident Evil Movies. I Know a lot of fans complain "We've Seen All This In The Games, There's No Originality!" Well to be honest, Yes. Frankly it is true. But the Movies are including Characters and Elements from the Games to help bring more fans to both the gaming franchise and the movie franchise. 'Alice' (Milla Jovovich) Is a whole different side to Resident Evil. I know fans complain about her being able to have certain 'Powers' that were never included in the games. But Guys! ITS JUST A MOVIE! If Capcom hated the Movies they would have forbidden them to be continually made! Resident Evil Extinction should never had been made in my opinion, its the only one i found completely screwy to both the games and the two previous movies. Overall, the twists and turns through out this movie made me want to see the next one, and want to know what Umbrella is planning to throw at Alice.SPOILER! Don't Read If You Have Not Seen The Movie!!The only issue that i have and the majority of every other fan is that the main evil Characters such as 'Wesker' have turned sides, True Resident Evil fans know that Wesker is not a Good Guy at all, the stuff he pulls in the games should have rubbed off onto the directer and should not have been turned out the way it did in the movie. Characters from the other Movies, Such as 'Rain', 'Jill', 'One' and 'Carlos' were all pitting against Alice, there were so many moments where I was thinking "ALICE! JUST TELL THEM WHO THEY REALLY ARE!" At least that way they would have held back at certain points in the movie and at least would have realized in the end they were being used by Umbrella. Instead resulting in Killing 'Barry', 'Luther West' and some of them losing there own lives. (For some reason, I think Rain is still alive...ish) I mean, Wesker survives a helicopter Explosion in the previous movie, so who's to say Rain survives? The ending gave me chills and to expect a lot more in the next movie, which supposedly comes out next year.Thanks for Reading my Review, overall i give this movie 8/10

So disappointed...have been a fan of the Resident Evil movies since the first one but found 'retribution' just a mishmash of all the previous movies and I had a problem getting my head around the plot.There was no final and positive outcome to the series... I had to of course, watch it and only scoring as I have, because I am a huge fan of Milla.I think producers and directors ran out of ideas of how to finish the 'resident evil' series but gave no clear ending to them.Such a shame but if you are a 'resident evil' fan then you had to make the effort to see it, but the 'die hard fans' will be terribly disappointed.

Before I entered the cinema, really could NOT image how STUPID 2012 resident evil can be.......there is NO story, NO lines, NO acting, NO conscience of artists any more! I really don't know What Lee is doing their. BTW, she is a Chinese actress -- but dressed and acted like a Japenese doll. I would say it was not her fault -- no one can render any valuable work based on such poor script!I would say it is a OK video game CG. But, movie? Are you kidding me? If you need money, buy some Facebook shares, OK? Don't screw the a once-successful work!

Review title: Resident Evil: No One Has to Reload EVER
Review_body: All I can say is, "Stop." Just please stop. No more. Alice, shut up. We know your name is Alice. Enough. We're 5 movies in now and it hasn't gone anywhere and it's not going anywhere. It's not even enough eye candy for fans of the games. I blame myself for being a glutton for punishment I guess; I've seen all the Resident Evil movies so far so I guess I'm in for the long haul. An overlong-haul. The fact that I'm a huge fan of the games unfortunately doesn't help when passing judgment on the movies. Retribution is, in my opinion, the worst one to date. The story is just, for lack of a more sophisticated word, DUMB. *Spoilers to follow*An underground facility that uses clones to recreate outbreaks? Sounds like a huge waste of time and resources to me. And the reasoning behind having said facility? To show China what the outbreak would look like in the United States. To show Japan what the outbreak would look like in Russia. Really? You mean you couldn't just put a zombie in a room with 4 people and show them what happens? Or at least a computer simulation? Much more cost effective. Having a big dumb facility just makes for having a lot of big dumb plot holes and questions. With all of those clones running around down there, you mean to tell me you can't just repopulate the human race? How do you keep having enough clothes to clothe them all? Who cleans up the bloody messes after each simulation? Why does Wesker have a change of heart all of a sudden for the human race and wants Alice to help save it? Wasn't he hell-bent on trying to kill everyone in the last movie Resident Evil: I'm Lost? Why does Umbrella have a supply of leather costumes for Alice? Why doesn't anyone have to reload ever? Leon's not using the Chicago Typewriter and I don't see anyone shooting any BSAA emblems, so according to all reasoning ever, guns need to be reloaded occasionally. Why didn't Alice just F'n recognize the ridiculously OBVIOUS glowing "bad-guy" looking scarab on Jill's chest? HEY! That must be her source of evil! WHERE IS CHRIS AND CLAIRE REDFIELD? Whose bright idea was it to have a deaf clone?! THE LIST GOES ON AND ON!!!!!! Call this movie Resident Evil: Plot Holes. Although we love seeing our favorite characters and subtle nods towards the games, we don't appreciate them being utterly stupid. Please do it right otherwise you're doing us a disservice. Throwing in new characters doesn't do them justice. I'm really glad you included Leon so he could have such a stimulating conversation with Alice. "I'm not letting you pass," "Let me pass," "Ok." And THAT WAS BARRY?! Seriously? Oh good, you gave him a Colt Python, so he's automatically Barry. Ada was at least legit; everything about her was right, if nothing else in the movie. Here they mentioned Las Plagas. According to this movie, Las Plagas are steroids you can inject into your Michelle Rodriguez to make her do X-Ray punches to people's hearts a-la the new Mortal Kombat. I'd much rather see her turn into a "head sprouter" than seeing her juiced up on 'roids. We've seen Girl Fight already. You know what, I'd rather just not see her at all, because she is in no way important. Oh, and hi Luther, I'm glad you survived the last movie and mysteriously teamed up with Leon. It's so important that you survived because you're such an integral part in this one...oh no now you're dead. Great job. Everything about this movie is just stupid. I didn't see it in 3D thank God, but I'm sure that sucked too. It's time to just scrap the franchise. Matter of fact, it was time to scrap it 3 movies ago. Just make a REAL Resident Evil movie for the love of everything holy. Going in, you know the movie is bad, so I got what I deserved, but my God, I didn't think the franchise could actually get any worse. The bright side? This movie hit rock bottom so the next one couldn't possibly any worseor could it?

Review title: 3D has rarely ever been that impressive!
Review_body: Where does this new hype of vanity on the story's and character's profoundity of action movies come from? That's so ridiculous! I am actually not a fan of zombie movies (I've seen around 4 apart from the Resident Evil series), but this movie can not be counted as a regular zombie movie. The intention of this movie isn't telling a story or creating interesting characters that one can empathize with. But to me this is a totally wrong trend of Hollywood, since movies shall show us what we DON'T experience in our everyday life anyway. A movie is a piece of art, and not the biography and analysis of a character (although this can also be very entertaining if it's innovative).This movie is a superb composition of compelling sounds and 3-dimensional pictures of an amazing quality. Resident Evil 5 constantly generates an atmosphere that I have hardly ever felt before.Those low ratings here are nothing but what happens, if the regular action-slasher movie audience, who doesn't understand anything from arts, prides itself on being oh so intellectual and vain. So far too vain to enjoy something, that provides the best of its kind. There were many engraving scenes or even just pictures that have the potential of becoming standards.People who now talk about how abstract or illogical this movie is are bonkers, action and horror movies mostly have a similar background logic to cartoons or operas, which means - non! But if Maggie Simpson shoots the mafia or if Don Giovanni suddenly begins to sing while in a dialog nobody complains! Because this is what it is all about, because nobody expects science there, nobody expects reality, still everybody is wonderfully entertained! Why do you suddenly expect it here? I hate this reality show trend, shall even our movies now lose all their creativity and fantasy? Movies are for gaining a distance from our boring lives by diving into a world where nothing is impossible. Movies shall not just become mirrors of our society...This movie gripped me and only released me, when it ended. There were only very few seconds where the thrill wasn't perfect. As the title says, the 3D is ideal for this movie, I would even say this movie benefits from it more than Avatar. The parts of the Resident Evil series that I have seen before were boring and gray in comparison to this one. The creatures which appear are not really disgusting or shocking, you don't have to be afraid of bad dreams after watching Resident Evil 5. A few scenes could be a little too thrilling for some people though.

Review title: One hour and an half without emotions
Review_body: I watched the first two movies of the Resident Evil series, then I jump to this, and I'm very disappointed. While the first movie was an innovation, and all scenery was well-made, this chapter looks like a movie that was shot in a empty room and all details are added using computer graphics. This is a loss of realism, I thought I was playing a video game instead of watching a movie. This feeling was amplified by the absence of mimic of the actors, and by the foregrounds, too often used by director.Secondly, the story is poor: without adding any spoiler to this post, I can confirm that no scary scenes are included, no suspense or twists in the story, but only a great amount of spectacular (and unrealistic) shooting scene. Furthermore think that every spectator can easily predict the following scene.Finally, the 3D version seen on theater is "flat": there are few scenes with a deep 3D (the opposite of "Avangers" for example), so if you want to see the movie in 2D you don't miss anything.In conclusion, this movie losses the horror-thriller characteristics of the first chapter and the massive use of computer graphics divides the spectator from dynamic of the movie.The only thing I can save is the beauty of the actresses.

I think those were not Nazi Zombies....they were Red Russian Army Zombies.....on Motocross Bikes hunting the main characters in a car chase while firing at them....enough said ?? This movie was really the worst and dumbest (ok I didn't expect too much) in the whole series. what a waste of time. The first minutes were really well done - the idea of the reverse intro was good and the little scene in die suburban area was stolen from the Dawn of dead remake - but quite cool as well. This is what earns 3 of 10 - All the other parts (espacielly part 1)of the series were at least really good "brains off" fun. But I can't turn off my brains that much ;-)

Review title: The worst movie of the year and Resident Evil
Review_body: Never seen a sequence file as bad, but as bad as that movie I just saw. Honestly, woman throwing waist and killing everyone, endless bullets, flying monsters okay got in the game- and dozens of ridiculous things that happen in the film, is honestly the worst sequence that has already been made. Aside from that ridiculous and boring scenes in slow motion just to show that 3D works in cinema. personal, never, ever waste your time watching this movie that is worse than a poorly made parody in BollyWood. I may be being a bit critical about the movie, in the beginning until it's cool with scenes and details explosion in slow motion -like I said just to show 3D-, but honestly, I do not believe that Hollywood producers approved spending money on it . As I'm from Brazil, was reading a magazine very famous in our country called see and they say that ideas just Hollywood! And this movie confirms everything honestly do not even want to waste my time talking more about a movie as bad as this, but warning to all who love the Resident Evil games: will be disappointed, and the truth is cruel and hurts ...

Review title: Worst Resident Evil movie ever made!
Review_body: I cannot believe they think we would watch it more then once. One time in cinema is more then enough! And still waste of money and time. I am really big fan of Resident Evil. For the fact I'm big fan of many horror movies but this is terrible. To the movie crew: "Stand up drink some coffee and make better movie I know you can do it". To all fans who still waiting to see it or want to buy it on DVD/blue ray do not do it. Its totally not worth the money! I really hope new Resident Evil movie is coming soon. No need new zombies to make movie great. Need good story writing and living by the authors and making us believe that we are there and we are running or shooting at walking zombies and make us believe in it for an hour or two.

This is the absolute worst of all the resident evil movies. There's no red line, the storyline is crap and it reminds more or less of a bad video game. Mindless quotes, seen-that-done-that action scenes, bad acting and a completely messed up plot is what you get. Take for instance the start where the previous film left you, on the boat about to being attacked by the umbrella corp. That's pretty much where you are left story wise throughout the film. I watched it because I've seen the others and had a hope of something more about the story behind umbrellaThis is one of those films, where you are better off taking a walk or counting matches.

Review title: Enjoy it for what it is... ENTERTAINMENT.
Review_body: I have read lots of reviews saying this movie lacks plot and is like watching a video game! WELL......The whole "Resident Evil" movie franchise is based off a video game! There is not much plot, a tiny bit of character development, but that is not what you watch this movie for. Like many people say, turn off your brain and enjoy the eye candy. The 3D version is also excellent, with the 3D shot very well and not over used. Settings and CGI are all well created. Zombies look quite generic, but the "Boss" monster is pretty awesome! Not much else to say but highly recommended for any gamers or people wanting some brainless action eye candy!

Review title: Worse One of the RE Movie Series
Review_body: Me and my wife tried to watch Retribution yesterday and didn't even make it 30 min in before turning it off. My wife use to play the original game, and thought the first couple of movies did the game justice, as did the Silent Hill movie, but as the RE movies have went on, the story line got little worse and worse and further away from the games which it was based.
