Retribution was incredibly horrible. Even the first 10 minutes of the movie playing the last 5 minutes of last movie in reverse was so stupid, to only have it replay again normal. Made us wonder if they were really that hard up for story line that they used it as filler. I would say if the plan was to continue down the current path with the RE movies, don't, as its just a waste of studios money on production. #Milla Jovovich﻿ you have some very good movies on your resume. Please don't let them insult you with another one like Retribution. Don't mean to offend anyone, just giving honest feedback.

In this film, I think the franchise traded length for depth.I don't know whose fault it is but the entire movie felt like somebody decided to aim the film at pre-teens despite the 'R' rating. Special effects were fine (some were realistic, others were very unrealistic but still pretty); the movie was lengthy enough to include some plot development, but most of the script felt rushed. It wasn't horrible... but it was as if many of the scenes were shot in just 1 take too few (or 5 minutes of post-editing too few). "That's where you're wrong"... "This is a mistake"... "Get out of my way" could be an very plausible exchange if the two characters just took 3 seconds of pause in between; without any pause it seems forced, amateurish, and actually disgusting to anyone who grew up in the years before the internet caused such a drop in the dramatic quality of movies. The immediacy which seemed to plague the first 3/4 of the movie combined with the fact that combatants fired weapons, without cover and standing with their whole bodies in view of on-coming fire, yet barely got hit... made me think that somebody is not taking this franchise very seriously.I think this could have been done a lot better... but it does as the prior two movies have; it continues the plot in a new direction without wholly disappointing viewers... though it could have been far more pleasant.

This is by far my favorite resident evil! So much action! So much emotion too! Really ties in how Alice came to be Alice! Loved the end of the movie where the actual world is in complete ruin, I am ecstatic and really quite anxious to see the next resident evil coming out in 2015! I seriously wish I could play the part of a hot bad ass chick in a movie!!! Lol :0) there's just something incredibly amazing about a woman who can be fierce, all the actors and actresses in this movie played their parts very well. Whatever happened to the little girl though? Maybe will show in the next movie? Is she going to be given powers and be able to fight alongside the resistance and get revenge for her mother? I'm guessing it will be an epic movie considering it's called "the final chapter"! So I'm sure everything will all tie together and make for a climatic end! Super stoked! But jeez if I can't be in the movie at least name one of the bad asses TARA (after me of course ; ) ) Keep up the great work! Anxiously waiting!

Review title: Could've been better. Quick review and breakdown.
Review_body: This Resident Evil movie has incredible action and fight scenes like most of the other Resident Evil movies people like. The visuals are also rather good considering how much they had crammed into this movie. This particular movie lacks a good storyline. These movies have so much potential but since they have a loyal fan base they really don't seem to care what they're feeding us. It's good they introduce some characters that are new to the movies such as Ada Wong and Leon Kennedy. SOME of these characters were cast poorly. Dialogue throughout the movie can be cheesy and painful. It is nice to see the different kinds of zombies and creatures even though it's brief. Also no one really has to reload so someone turned infinite ammo on which can be fun for the game but not the movie. Bottomline is they really messed up on this Resident Evil. I really would like a revamp of the whole Resident Evil live action movie franchise leading with the game's version of the mansion incident with Tyrant.Quick Breakdown 10 being great 1 being poor - Plot - 2 Dialouge - 3 Casting of new characters - 5 Overall Acting - 4 Visuals - 8 Action - 8 Overall - 5

Review title: Most likely the worst movie ever!
Review_body: First I must say that this review contains spoilers in the sense that I quickly describe what this movie is about: This movie is about a couple of people who are completely invincible, fighting other people who are easier to kill than a wingless fly. With some exceptions... who they are you'll have to find out for yourself is you decide to waste the time.It's amazing that Milla and her friends seems to be completely pass through in this movie, with thousands of bullets going straight through them without doing any harm. If the bad guys aren't shooting blanks? And also every weapon in this movie seems to have unlimited ammunition. I thought the directors had learned to stop making the 70s and 80s shootouts?In this movie you will also be delighted to see a car-chase a'la 80s B-movies and zombies with machine guns and by the way, these zombies can walk, apparently think and drive cars but no one taught them how to aim. I mean... AT ALL!I am a great fan of the old Res evil games and I loved the first movie. It was completely brilliant. The second one was somewhat good to, even if I was surprised they chose to make it an action movie. The third one was mediocre and the forth one was flat out bad. But this movie... this one I wish I never saw.Ps. I almost laughed my ass of in the scene with the zombie army. It reminded me of Hotshots 2 with Charlie Sheen when he invincibly stands in a mountain of empty cartridges shooting bad guys...

well i am a fan of the video games saga, not from the movies, i 'played all the games etc. then in 2002 the first resident evil movie comes out and was OK, at least enjoyable, then the second one was fine.. till the middle of it, but when nemesis appear and turn to be good and even not mutate, the movie transform in a totally crap , from that moment the movies are so bad that are a joke, this movie isn't the esception, the characters are far far away from the videogames counterparts, this movie is bad made, contain the worst acting of all the saga, the cheapest effects ever made, and the plot holes are so big than the entire universe, and nothing is well explain, besides the situations on the afterlife movie, has not effect on this one, I don't want ad spoilers, but the fail is so big that dragon ball movie is the best movie ever compare to this, in this sequel characters like crhis and claire are never mentioned, and anybody says nothing about it, others take they spot, but not for to long, alice continue stealing the aspects from the others heroes, and doing it all by herself. At the end there is cliffhanger for more, so if you respect the resident evil games don't watch it save your money, and wait a reboot... is the only hope we can get.. anyway there isn't hope for paul anderson....

Review title: Resident Evil: Retribution is by far the best sequel in the series
Review_body: I've followed the Resident Evil film series since it started in 2002. I am also a big fan of the video game series and have played and finished every main game in the series since it started way back in 1996. Trust me when I say I am a fan and take my word for it. This is the best Resident Evil film to come out since the 2002 original.Now let me start by saying that I prefer the video games over the films. But I'm fine with the main character Alice being an exclusive character to the movies and the films being set in separate universe. In fact I've always argued against the idea that movies should be set out EXACTLY like the games. Where is the fun in that? These movies are meant to be a different version to the games universe. Comic books do it all the time.Resident Evil: Retribution is not to be taken too seriously. The movie is meant to be fun and thrilling and it succeeds! It has the thrilling jump scares and tense moments known from the original and 'Extinction' and the campy fun factor of 'Apocalypse'. While the 4th entry Resident Evil: Afterlife's special effects, stunts and camera work were impressive, its story served as bridge between 'Extinction' and 'Retribution'. It followed up on 'Extinctions' main plot points while setting up the 5th film with a cliffhanger. Unfortunately I thought 'Afterlife' was the worst entry in the series though, even though i found it quite enjoyable.Paul W.S Anderson takes 'Afterlife's direction and does everything right this time round with 'Retribution'. The slow-motion isn't over the top this time and the action sequences are so much better. The plot isn't AMAZING, but THERE IS A PLOT! MINOR SPOILERS: Alice is held prisoner in an Umbrella Facility until a a spy and a elite squad move in to rescue her. It sounds like a recreation of the first film, and trust me there is plenty of homage to it. But 'Retribution' is much more imaginative this time around as it uses more monsters from the video games and makes use of the quirks exclusive to the series such as 'the clones' and 'Alices Gift'. Characters dead from the previous films make a return. The whole film works so well as a sequel because it mixes elements of nostalgia along with fantastic stunt work and special effects.This film rocks. Its the best sequel in the series! If you want to know how I rank them 1:Resident Evil 2.Retribution 3.Extinction 4:Apocalypse and 5:Afterlife. I'm a fan of great plots in films, and the trick is not to take these Resident Evil films too seriously. Give 'Retribution' a go its a lot of fun!
There were a lot of good ideas in this, but the lack of a story really drags this down.

Review title: A die hard fan of the Resident Evil franchise.
Review_body: I am life fan of the RE franchise since RE1 to now i have loved this series but what the hell did i just watch.I've never had a complaint or dislike of any of the films in the series until now. Honestly did not expect to be so disappointed in one of my favourite franchises. The film on a whole seemed so pointless, the whole film could of been shortened into a 15 minute opening to a proper sequel instead of a long boring no script, pointless action and horrible story.*Spoilers*The addition of fan favourite characters had us all eagerly awaiting this film only to be slapped in the face by the writers. Almost everyone dies or is a clone whoopy do! There is no decent bad guys, one steroid abusing licker appears briefly for another pointless sequence, again thanks to the writers for making one of my favourite video game enemies a pointless on screen joke.I could go on for ages but writing on a tablet isn't that easy5/10 is a bias rating due to me being a fanboy of the series, i would of rated it 3/10 if i was new to the franchise.All in watch but don't expect a lot.Nikolas Zelentchuk

I love the Resident Evil films. Sure, they are campy, but they are always fun and are usually a great action flick.Retribution is absolutely not the case. Does it have lots of action? Yes, but when you have such a weak plot line as is showcased here not even GOOD action can save it. Even the action scenes themselves are horrendous, with mediocre at best special effects in most parts and ludicrous scenarios that never play well off of one another, not to mention the 20 page script for the entire film. The only lines delivered all seem like they were a Jr. High film project, and add nothing to the story except one liners and catchphrases.All in all, this film is easily on my top 10 worst films of all time list, and I doubt many things will surpass it in the future.

Review title: It's like a Silly Hindi Action Movie
Review_body: There's no story at all in this movie. guns that don't run out of ammo!! more like your playing the Resident Evil game series with a cheat code. Worst movie in the series and still the series won't end in here! what have you done Paul Anderson?very very confusing story line and now that Wesker working lone-side with humans !!!!! and come on!! why there's no Chris Redfield on this movie??Action was good only for a Action Hindi movie.I love the Resident Evil films & the game series. Surely they usually a great action flick. but in this case this move was waste of time. Apocalypse was the best move in the series....

Review title: Much better than the previous ones!
Review_body: My review may not be the greatest but I am seriously tired of hearing people complain over and over about the RE franchise. I have played the games and I am fully aware that the movies are not really faithful to the games but does not mean the movie will be an automatic failure.These franchise is not the greatest but it's entertaining and every time I watch the movies I have a good time. They are mostly unrealistic and inaccurate but it's fun to watch and at the end of the day that's what your looking for.Now, about this last movie I have to say, from my point of view, this is by far the best one out of the series. Tons of action, zombies, shooting, fighting and nonsense that would leave you satisfied. Glad to have Michelle back, she definitely made the movie better. Definitely looking forward for the next movie and hopefully Paul can somehow bring Michelle back...hey, this movie is pure fiction/fantasy so anything is possible.

Review title: Absolute horror, No really, trust me, you wont be afraid of zombies anymore, you will be afraid of watching any Resident Movie in future..
Review_body: I read a review by a 17 year old teenager saying this movie is awesome. Yeah right! I don't understand why this movie is categorized under horror movies. I was laughing half the time. And everything was predictable(also no one talks much in this movie anyway).Other than opening credits scene, there nothing interesting to watch. There is no story so I can not even spoil it for anyone. Just nice CGI does not make a movie great. This movie, as I said in title of the review, is horror of movie making. Video games have better story lines than this. Ah.. had to get it off my head. I am not going to watch any Resident Evil movies in future. The group of friends who went to watch this movie is nodding in agreement as I am writing this. If you must watch it, then wait for HBO to show it. At least you will have good time laughing at the predictable action scenes.TL;DR Horrible movie, anyone who says otherwise is a teenager or watching horror movies for first time.

Where to begin, I really don't know, it was awful from start to finish. By far the worst of all Resident Evil's movies, despite the fact the last one (Afterlife) was already very bad, with its abrupt ending in the middle of a scene engraved in my memory. Well this one starts as bad as the other one finished, yes I know, it's a pretty hard thing to do but they managed to do it. It starts with a playback of the intro scene followed by, guess what, the intro scene played normally. Pure geniusThis wasn't the only problem with the movie, no, it had a lots of problems. First of all the directing isn't very good, but what strikes out is the screenplay's lack of quality, I mean really bad. Dialogues are simple, boring and often pointless and then the storyline is also very flawed, it's like someone wrote this movie's script in just about a day. So that you can understand some of my issues with this movie, and despite me being a fan of Resident Evil (mainly the first movies), I'll mention a couple of them. For instance, those cool looking Umbrella secret labs that are built underground and are shown as a 3D schematic, well in this movie there is one of those but its layout, unlike previous labs, makes no sense what so ever. I mean, why would someone build a lab in which you have to cross 3 or 4 cities full of zombies just to get in and get out, makes no sense. Then there is the appearance of all the previous characters, I was surprised how Nemesis doesn't show up All these past characters where cloned, just because, and now they come back, not as themselves but as someone else and, has that wasn't bad enough, they have really poor roles in the movie.If all that didn't suffice to rate this movie very poorly, there's the cherry on top of the cake: bad acting. No great actors were in this movie but some stood out, like Sienna Guillory, who plays Jill and I'm sorry to say this but can't act at all, her idiotic commands (brilliant script) during the whole movie were ridiculous, or Milla Jovovich using the same hand gesture to say 2 completely different things to her deaf daughter (not sure if she was deaf or not, but why else would she speak in sign language).In the end, after hour and a half, after all the shooting, shouting and running around, the only thing that was added to this franchise was a secret lab located underwater and blown up and the end of the movie, so nothing was added. A pointless movie and a bad one as well. Oh I almost forgot, you also find out that the next movie will take place in Washington where the White House is the last standing building and zombies are beating the crap out of everyone (my 2 cents: it doesn't seem it's going to be a better movie than this).All in all, even if you aren't picky with things like the sign language "dialogs" this is still an extremely bad movie and a continued fall into the abyss this movie franchise seems to have entered in 2007 with Extinction kind of looking down from the edge of the precipice.

Review title: Worst movie of all Resident Evil films...
Review_body: I think it's safe to say that it is getting boring and annoying to hear the same lines over and over in the beginning of the movie. We already know that Umbrella Corp is evil and the virus made the dead come back alive, etc. We don't need Alice to tell us that for each Resident Evil movie released, seriously - we get it.Now for the plot, it's a simple plot - to get out of that submarine place alive. I don't see how some reviewers say there isn't a plot or a storyline. For character development, this movie has done a terrible, terrible job. I was offended when they showed Leon out of nowhere...it would've been nice had the director or writers for this movie developed him much better, along with Ada Wong. Throughout the movie, we're introduced to pretty much everyone, but then we focus mainly on Alice and we completely forget about the bad guys. Everything feels so rushed, shifting from one place to another. I feel like this film was directed towards a video game cut scene as a few reviewers mentioned. That little girl, Becky who was "supposedly" Alice's daughter, but isn't because memories were implemented to the clones....her character was not necessary at all. Just sayin'.For the special effects, it's just as good as every other RE film. The infinite ammunition, the massive spraying, bad guys firing bullets everywhere but directly at the good guys. The order that was given to the bad guys was "shoot to kill" not "shoot to miss". Good guys, of course, never miss. NEVER.Personally, I liked the first and second Resident Evil film. There was a nice flow to it, but ever since Extinction, everything just felt like sh*t hit the fan hard.4/10 solely because of cool effects, Leon, Ada, Luther West. I'm sure there will be one more Resident Evil movie.

OK we don't go to see RE movies for their insight into the human condition, we go to check our brains in at the door and be entertained for just shy of 90 mins. On this level Retribution is a good fun night out with great 3D and plenty of action. It's fun to see almost all the characters from the franchise back, thanks to the Umbrella cloning programme and Ada, Leon and Barry from the games should please hardcore fans.Retribution really doesn't offer anything new, Milla is Alice and if she remembers anything at all she probably will have a feeling of deja-vu from the previous instalments but the movie barrels along from one gory, action set-piece to another without giving the audience too long to worry about how ridiculous it all is. Dressed almost identically to Selene from Underworld Milla looks great back-flip kicking zombies, rescuing the surrogate daughter and wearing two small towels again.The action comes thick and fast with our various heroes running from the little girl Red Queen through various virtual reality zones including Moscow, Tokyo, American Suburbia and finally up top to the frozen Russian Sub dock.All in all the movie delivers a undeniably fun but generic experience to the other films so if you're a fan, you probably will enjoy it and on the big screen in 3D is the only way to go.

I saw it. Frankly it's the worst movie. I am a fan of the first three movies but since Afterlife it became so ridiculous. There is no spoil in my review because there is nothing hard-hitting about Retribution, it is a simple unpacking of play-lets of action. Alice is always in the center of everything, the characters are only set. I really hope that the next comments will know how to criticize the movie as it is necessary, we can be a fan of the movies but defend this opus it is simply impossible. We can emit only one positive point: we are not bored. Ridiculous is the word which would summarize Retribution. In the others we took some pleasure to follow Alice's adventures. This time it is just a big joke, Leon, Ada, Barry and even Jill are useless. I even cannot spoil so much there is nothing interesting! Even the action is average, it is more a movie of fight than a Resident Evil. Find the movie on the internet and avoid paying.

Was really anxious to see this movie. I've played the videos games and loved the RE1-3 movie establishments. RE4 was OK, but I'm sorry to say this one seemed like a colossal joke. **Spoilers** It really seemed like a child had written and directed the movie. The idea of the movie I thought was perfect. I could see umbrella developing the simulation site to sell to governments. The beginning of the movie was really great, but then the acting started to seem to fall apart and the creative seemed more like, OK what can we throw at this movie? Several issues I had were the nazi zombies/ soviet soldier zombies (why couldn't it just be regular zombies? and have the recovery team be over run as raccoon city was in 2, it would've still killed off recovery team members), the constant slow motion (it would've been great to see a lot of that fast just like in the neighborhood scene), the cheesy one liners, Barry getting shot, getting back up to shoot again, Leon touching Ada's leg when they showed no love interest in the entire movie, Barry seemed to care more. I give it a 4 for the good idea of bringing back older characters, merging it with characters from the gaming world, and a decent plot. I could see how a younger crowd would enjoy this, but they could've still made it more serious and pleased everyone to where the arguments would just be over the story.

Review title: AMAZING!!! IT WAS AWESOME!!!!! Are you freaking kidding me?
Review_body: I don't understand how people love this utter piece of crap that Paul Anderson created.Stooooop making movie's!!! The only good movie of the entire series was resident evil 1.But i guess in this Era people like retarded movies. Oh well. Reboot the series, get a different director, be faithful to the storyline and please remove Mila...What is up with that...seriously??I told myself "okay one more resident evil movie, maybe I will like this one" Nope, retarded matrix action , crappy storyline i mean really?? how is that fun?! I will no longer watch these movies if Paul keeps making them. I'm done thanks for killing the Resident Evil franchise.

Extremely awful no kind of script or dialogs only an immune characters that kills everyone with one unlimited ammo Gun. Extremely poor action work. The Main character was immune to 2000 bullets that was shooting her way and once she got shot and walk more powerful before she was shot :)) Extreme crap movie that you get bored , no surprises and no new characters or zombies and the best part was :)) the zombies were able to shoot and hunt you down and the crazy part was they were more accurate than a police cop. OK now i get the fact that you must create new movie once in a while but this was just loosing your fans. YOU DESTROYED OUR BELOVED MOVIE Just don't watch it you'll get disappointed

Review title: waste of money!!!!!..please do a favor to yourself and never watch this!
Review_body: me, my girlfriend and my two friends were waiting for this movie to come. the trailer was disappointing. but still i had some hopes. this movie shattered all my hopes and expectations. saw the first day of release and regretted it. a real waste of money and time. was not exiting or suspenseful or anything. but yeah it was funny!!..the action scenes were pretty funny!!!..damn please take my advice and don't watch this movie. a lot of useless CG I and fake makeups made this movie a real joke! the first three editions of resident evil are 100 times better than this. one thing the movie makers did good. made this short one. i thank them for that. the only thing which is good is the B G score. last thing i was thinking when i exited the movie hall was that don't the director and producers watch the movie first and then send it out for release??..i really don't think so cos if they did they would have burned this crap!

Review title: Is this a Resident Evil movie?
Review_body: What i just watched is far worse then anything I've ever seen. I'm not a big fan of slow-motion but this movie looks like it was filmed in slow motion, and I don't mean the pace of the movie, it's actually 20% slow motion, bad choreographed fights. There is no plot, sub-plot or any kind of storyline what so ever. The fact that a movie doesn't make sense isn't what bothers me, the very least it must have a beginning and an end (or something). This movie starts with a slow motion scene and I wanted to walk out of the theater after 10min of slow motion, I'm not kidding, the scene lasts 15min, my wife stopped me and now I wish I walked out. Characters...what characters? I don't even know what I just watched and I was hoping to wake up from a bad dream. This review isn't very coherent is it? Well expect the movie to be, far far worse. I'm sure this will go down as the worst Resident Evil ever made.

Review title: It's good on actions and visual effects
Review_body: This is a fifth installment of RE Movie franchise, most of people knew that this franchise receive a lot of critics. As this franchise grow without strong plot and only rely on action and visual effect. But some of the moviegoers like me will go for this franchise to see some of it.Well is the movie did great job to entertain people like me? My answer is yes. Why? Because this movie still has some of fresh action and great visual effect. The movie is all about action and visual effect, forget the plot and you can find this movie quite entertaining. Is it worthy if you go with the 3D? I can say yes, i'm sure you won't be disappointed with it's 3D effects.On the beginning you will be given a quite remarkable thrilling scenes. And after that you will get some actions with good pop-up 3D effects. But don't expecting too much in the middle of the movie. And in the end the action was brought to the next level, although you won't find the thrilling scenes that you find in the beginning of the movie.So overall the movie was quite good on the action and visual effects, just sit and enjoy the show.

I don't think so... I think there's some manipulation here.A movie so bad, completely done in computer ... deserves no more than a 5 at most fanatic of the series Resident Evil. We continue to believe in the IMDb score?? I started watching and thought I would start something good. A film in the present time, with the zombies invade the homes and people hiding in closets. After already are in Russia, Japan, Ny, know where it ... more I think that for a person to be more fanatic for the series, never vote for 10, and that there is some kind of manipulation by some company, and should be investigated by IMDb. Make a tracing of IP ratings. And I'm sure you see that someone is cheating. I love the video game, and the first two episodes of the series, after that it was just crap. I hope more movies are coming, change of producer and director, with new ideas and a new approach. A team of graphic effects also left something to be desired. Many bad scene.

Review title: Very disappointed in this movie and it's director...
Review_body: I was very excited to see this movie as I have been a fan since the first. To say the least I was let down by this movie. It had no suspense or drama and was all shoot outs and fights. I understand that this is considered a sort of action movie and guns and fights are what those make up...however this movie had no "meat" to it. It was completely visual. I never felt the danger...I was never even close to the edge of my seat wondering what would happen next...it was very predictable. During the second half of the movie people in the theater were laughing at the action scenes and how ridiculously stupid they were. I left the theater very disappointed with a critical opinion of the movies director. If you still want to see it I recommend waiting for it on DVD so you don't waste the price of a theater ticket...

Review title: Games have better stories than this.
Review_body: Many people compare it to video games (in general), which is wrong because video games these days have much better stories than Resident Evil: Retribution. Personally, I never watched previous Resident Evil movies for story, as shallow as it was.. it was enjoyable, and felt right. In this case, it is awful. In Blu-Ray commentary Paul W.S. Anderson said that "he wanted to keep the franchise fresh", little he knows that this kind of experimentation could actually kill the franchise. And he was not even that innovative, because movie felt (suspiciously) similar to "Sucker Punch". I just hope that producers, and franchise owners read reviews, and next movie will be much better (if they get the financing). They should not even change the director, because Paul W.S. Anderson can direct good movies ("Resident Evil", and "Resurection" were my favorite movies in the franchise).

Review title: Stupid, Stupid... Did I mention STUPID?
Review_body: Dreadful, from start to finish. The opening scene played backwards, which I thought was pretty cool, exposing the audience to the plot. I said to myself "I really don't want to see this again played forward"... Low and behold, the entire sequence I JUST WATCHED played again in normal speed. Bullets didn't hit anyone, the Umbrella goons died almost exactly the same way every time, characters (or rather actors) were wooden, just a god awful film!The plot... let's face it, there was no plot. "Escape from this massive Umbrella facility, by the way your friend is being brainwashed and will try to kill you." It felt very forced, like the script writers had run out of ideas, but Milla Jovovich hadn't run out of bullets yet.The ending was bizarre, lazy and just plain silly. Rain, from the first film, reappears as a clone and is injected with some sort of worm. This worm allows her to bare sub-zero temperature without injury, literally PUNCH PEOPLE'S HEARTS, STOPPING THEM, dodge bullets... whatever.Then we cut to the Whitehouse, where Wesker has become the President. Not surprised. It appears this is humanity's last ditch attempt to save itself from the undead hordes.... Wait a f*ucking minute - Umbrella has the resources to maintain hundreds of high tech facilities around the globe, command airship squadrons, clone FREAKING SOLDIERS, and is still locked in a battle with the undead?! And to top it off, what can only be described as ZOMBIE DRAGONS appear at the end. Yeah the soldiers were the ones with the flamethrowers, but boy were those flying things dragon-like.In the words of the famous critic - THUMBS DOWN

Review title: Even if you hate the games, this movie will still suck. Paul Anderson is the new Uwe Boll.
Review_body: When I first heard of the first Resident Evil movie, I was very excited. However, upon seeing the film, I gave up on ever having a decent movie for the games. My girlfriend wanted to see this one and she had to drag me kicking and screaming. I haven't seen any of the others and I didn't need to which is a red flag right there given It's the 5th installment. First up, the acting was deplorable and not once did I believe anybody. I have been a theater major for 8 years so seeing any movie where the filmmakers don't bother hiring believable actors is disappointing. Second, the special effects were laughable, which is strange considering that their budget was well within working range (keep a special eye out for the scene where the man gets cut up by the chainsaw and tell me you can keep a straight face). Third, if you are a fan of the games, this movie continues to pretend that the games never happened, except for some characters. They add a couple characters into the movie from the games but never explain any of them, they are just thrown in to say "hey, look fan boys we played the games too and to prove it, here's a few characters!" So, even if you pretend that this isn't based on the games (which is easy if you just forget the title), then this movie is just different shots of action sequences spliced together in whatever lazy order the director wanted. If follows no kind of logical pattern or storyline, which again as a theater major I find incredibly irritating. I'm a fan of the games but I'm more upset that I actually paid money to see the movie over the fact that It's not actually based on the games.

Review title: A good sequel to the RE film installment
Review_body: After seeing Afterlife, I was really excited about Retribution. I have to admit, I did expect more. The true Resident Evil lover will probably not agree instantly, perhaps I'm being too critical. I do, however, not agree with the way-too-melodramatic critics about not understanding even a bit, or saying the acting was bad. I have to say though the acting wasn't perfect. It was OK.Everyone who doubts about seeing Retribution: Do NOT listen to the critics, just go see it and judge for yourself.Overall, I am excited for people to see the fifth installment and I recommend it to everyone. Especially the true RE lovers.9/10

All i can say for the positives of this film are the CG parts. Anything else that is part of this movie is a disgrace to the resident evil franchise. Looks like the films and games of the resident evil franchise have just fallen to a new low. This film has bad editing, one fight scene, i felt my eyes hurting due to the choppy editing, most of the acting is awful, i could not stand it. The script is stupid and wants us to care for undeveloped characters with parts that just seem too rushed and skipped. Also the main antagonist of this film (Red Queen) just keeps popping up and it seems really cheesy when she does, as they follow the antagonists through the scenes.Overall, instead of spending money on a piece of s**t action movie (Which will definitely get bad reviews and make a profit) , they should invest in a reboot of the whole franchise, creating a much darker and scarier film. Preferably based off Resident Evil 4 (The Game) and lose all of the stupid writing and pointless action. They also need to get a good actor for Lyon, as the actor in this movie was horrible and had too much muscle on him.It is a B movie at best, due to all the pointless action and CGI, but other than that it has taken a new route of stupid in the Resident Evil franchise.

Review title: Completely trash and waste of time
Review_body: I would give -10 if I could in IMDb. Just can't believe my eyes that this film was actually produced. If it was just another one of the crappy action movies I'd blame myself for a bad choice, but what makes this one worse is the fact that it's a Resident Evil film, from the previous ones I expected this one at least nothing less. At least that's what I'm feeling right now and I'm only half way through the film, time to sleep! :p

I am a huge fan of resident evil and loved the first 3 films of the franchise, the 4th movie however was pushing it and I could see that the franchise was digging a grave for itself. The movie has no plot, no character building and is just plain awful. There isn't really anything that we haven't seen before, the monsters are the same, the objective for Alice is the same and all I was hoping to happen while watching this movie is that there must be more once she gets out of this place, there must be at least some kind of story in this movie.. but no.The thing that really killed this movie for me were the actors chosen to play Leon and Barry, Leon looking like an action-man with a wig and Barry looking nothing like he does in the games. All in all I'm looking forward to seeing how Paul W.S. Anderson can make this film franchise any worse.

Review title: Short, fast-paced and visually impressive, RE:Retribution is a fifth installment that really works.
Review_body: The Resident Evil movies have always received criticism from not only snob critics but also fans for not following the video game's storyline. Nobody expected the original movie to actually be more of a prequel to the games with made up characters and starring Milla Jovovich and Michelle Rodriguez. Critics' hated it. Gamers hated it. Yet the general public's response was actually quite good. Looking back, that movie had its flaws but was very enjoyable and intense. Anderson managed to create a claustrophobic atmosphere whilst providing enough doses of action. The story was not really important at this point and Anderson played with the audience throughout the movie, making Jovovich's Alice a character very easy to sympathize with.The sequels, however, did not provide enough character moments or story and opted to turn the franchise into a mindless action disaster. Even though the third entry (Extinction) managed to improve on the character development and story department(thanks to Mullcahy's direction)the craziness was still the spotlight. All these positive aspects were then thrown completely away in the fourth installment. The story was all over the place, the audience cared more for the undead than for the characters, the action goes from crazy to "WTH?" and so on.Now these movies are enjoyable no matter what. Even Afterlife was fun to watch for its stupidity and craziness. It is a shame because something really good could have been made after the original since there was so much potential. Resident Evil: Retribution is not different than the three sequels but does mostly everything MUCH better. First, Anderson makes sure he brings back the best characters the franchise has had in the past movies connecting Retribution with the first entries. He then provides the movie with a simple but interesting story (in a similar way to the original), immersive 3D, over the top action sequences and outstanding visuals.Retribution is the "Fast Five" of the Resident Evil franchise. It may not be the best but it is a very decent sequel that fans will absolutely love, the general public will enjoy and critics will hate with a passion.The movie is as short as the others but is incredibly fast-paced with non-stop action. There are many continuity issues and plot holes but after four movies, you know exactly what you're going to get and be prepared for Retribution to exceed your expectations. This is no masterpiece. There are no strong performances or a deep story with original ideas. This is a fifth installment in an mindless action zombie franchise and in that aspect, you CAN'T get better than this. It is certainly better than all the sequels as it manages to restore the sensible elements from the original (some jump scares and tense moments included!) whilst keeping the insanity and absurdity of the sequels.Short, fast-paced and visually impressive, RE:Retribution is a fifth installment that really works.8/10

Review title: Great action movie, don't expect slow dialog.
Review_body: Milla Jovovich returns in Resident Evil Retribution, along with Michelle Rodriguez(Rain), Sienna Guillory( Jill Valentine) From the fourth movie, and Boris Kodjoe as Luther West from the second and third movies to name a few. I enjoyed the returning cast, Michelle Rodriguez has been one of my favorites that has been absent from every movie except the first one and whom I felt played a very compelling role in the TV series Lost.The plot takes some reading between the lines, and I think an understanding that certain details are ultimately left out of the movie to build suspense for a later sequel, or at least I got that feel from a few details that were left open ended by the end of the movie. The movie does explain the previous movies in an acceptably short time frame to give just enough details so that a first time viewer can pick up on the Resident Evil story "so far" however I strongly recommend viewing the previous movies first for any new comers to the series.There aren't a lot of character conflicts, There aren't a lot of overly long drawn out emotional scenes. I think these are all fine oversights because the movie focuses on what it is supposed to do and does well: Lots of action. It seemed like every moment of the movie something was happening to the point where there was no reason to slow down and clutter it up with a long dialog scene here or there. It was paced well, wasn't drawn out to long, and changed enough to avoid becoming tedious.I thought the movie was okay on plot, it did enough to be a movie and support the action. It scattered in some new details about Umbrella and it's opposition. I felt like a few details were intentionally left out for sequel(s), and like the other Resident Evil movies this one also ends on a cliff hanger.I think some of the other action movies this year have been a bit of a snooze because they tried to hard to be epic in every way with big dramatic characters and big dramatic dialogs, this movie picked action and did it well. I rated this movie based on the merit of being an action movie as a 7, maybe just below that but not quite a six.

Review title: Truly frightful horror - for the viewer
Review_body: As a fan of the "old" RE-games I was always somewhat disappointed by the movies, but the first 3 may just pass as popcorn movies of their own, the 3rd one even having a distinct own atmosphere and being just and enjoyable overall on its own. But from there, this franchise goes downhill lightning-fast. The last movie was already stupid beyond comprehension, the story didn't make any sense at all anymore, and characters and scenes from the RE games were inserted randomly just to create some connection to the games that didn't really exist at all.But why bash the last RE movie, when this one is so much worse? I truly, honestly believe that it can't get any worse, except maybe if Uwe Boll takes over the franchise. Apart from the Hollywood-Level production values (special effects etc.), the whole "RE: Contribution" movie reeks of lack of competence and interest. The writing and pacing is abysmal, the whole movie is literally just a series of action scenes with no meaningful plot to connect them all; worse, many of those scenes are cringe-worthy and painful to watch, because they're so ridiculous, and many actors are playing like robots on sedatives; I've never seen a worse performance from Michelle Rodriguez; she must have been ashamed to be part of this catastrophe. And don't get me started about Sienna Guillory (Jill Valentine); someone please tell her to get a new job outside the movie business!! The only slightly redeeming factor was Milla Jovovich; while not really a great actress, she performs as good as she can, and is pretty much the only person to convey some actual emotion sometimes.Don'get me wrong, I like corny, simple action movies in general, but this is just not acceptable anymore. I think Anderson must have been forced at gunpoint to make this movie; that's how I felt while sitting through it. I only watched it to the end to see if there would be at least ONE good plot idea at some point, but to no avail.Don't watch it if you don't have to, no matter how much of a "Resident Evil" fan you are; this just isn't worth the time.

I suggest that you go watch the other four Resident Evil movies (Resident Evil, Apocalypse, Extinction, Afterlife) before you go see Retribution. You will not understand the movie if you don't see the movies that lead up to Retribution. The plot may not be the best, but the action and the graphics, the 3D, everything that was filmed turned out to look and be amazing. It's as simple as this: If you watch the earlier movies and don't like them, don't see this movie. If you are a fan and like/love every single movie in the franchise, definitely go see it! I'm not joking. If you have NOT seen the other movies, you most likely will not understand nor like this movie. In my own personal judgement, I thought this movie is the best of all the sequels, and I definitely hope they make a sixth one! So, if you haven't seen any of the Resident Evil movies, go watch them. If you like them, go see this one. If you don't, don't see this movie. Simple as that. As far as my review of this movie goes, I LOVE IT. I love Milla Jovovich and the rest of the characters. I love that every movie brings those fighting scenes that are just INCREDIBLE. This fifth movie definitely has THE BEST and the most fighting scenes with other characters and the infected! I hope all the fans went or are going to see this movie because I know for a fact that the fans will love this movie! I send my thanks to Paul W.S. Anderson and everyone else that worked on this movie series!

Review title: Resident Evil: Retribution... A Really Good One
Review_body: I think that, the Resident Evil franchise, has always entertained us with its amazing visual effects and has mesmerized us with Milla's beauty. But this time, they've gone far beyond. I think that, the fans of the original video game will be very happy for the new character they had included, Leon. And also for the return of Rain and Jill Valentine, this last one, we saw her in a short scene at Resident Evil: Afterlife. But the absence of Claire and Chris Redfield was a pity. We lose the human part, the part that we were also related to. We're not just related to Alice, we were also related to Chris and Claire. And the last thing —I know it's gonna be a stupid review, but still—: the same story; Milla killing undead people, I know the whole franchise is about that, but, don't you get a little bored? 'Cause I do, the things that are always changing are the action scenes, that's why we don't realize of the monotony that the movie has, but the inclusion of that big monster, was a really good shot!! In conclusion, this movie is better than the others, really enjoyable and full of action. With lines that are easy to understand for the "normal" audience, not just for the video game fans. Though, they get used to not see too much things from the original video game, so... no big deal. Greetings!

This movie was just the greatest ripoff there is. The Series tries to jump from one superlative to the next without giving anything a second thought.Rebuilding whole cities underground, seriously? To Earn money from governments to pay/control people they can just create/clone by themselves? WW2 clothed soldiers? And a red Queen that pops into everything, with the complete control about the whole complex, but yet unable to kill this small bunch of people; coming to the conclusion that maybe cutting the power is an good idea only to the conclusive fight? A child that is obviously deaf still can be whispered to or shouted commands in the middle of the fight? And bombing an air-vent can bring down a whole facility?Resident Evil 1 was great, a movie which i can watch a thousand times, but it went constantly down from there on. Never ever again

Review title: Great movie. milla jovovich kicks booty
Review_body: We all was expecting another cheesy Resident evil movie like the last one so i will admit we did not hold much in expectations when we put this movie on but We was mistaken from the word go this movie bounced into action and we never once took our eyes off the screen we Really enjoyed this movie.Non stop action from start to finish. Can't understand those who don't like this movie. you want action? This movie has allot of it. Superb how they used previous character's from all the different Resident Evil movies. Was so happy to see michelle rodriguez return for this action packed movie.Alice really kicks some serious booty in this movie.This is now my 2nd Favorite of the Resident Evil movies. Milla Jovovich was sensational. We Can't wait for the next movie. Bring it on!

The franchise divides opinions: fans of the games do not accept the fact that the protagonist is a character created just for the movies. But is Milla Jovovich who steals the show and has established itself as one of the greatest actresses of action cinema. His Alice is the soul of Resident Evil, and is even more comfortable in character. With mastery, the actress gives a show of girl power and performance.In the first film, the characters followed by claustrophobia Beehive. With a more elaborate script and betting on terror to scare the audience with a few doses of action and characters more depth, it is still the best of them. Since then, the franchise began to exchange terror for action - betting on the cliché "more is better".'Resident Evil 2: Apocalypse' Alice showed a genetically altered with super-powers, walking the night streets of Raccoon City, fighting not only against zombies, but also against other aberrations more "evolved" and deadly. The film presented the beloved Jill Valentine, but not wowed.In Resident Evil 3: Extinction 'director Russell Mulcahy was able to resume the reins of the franchise, creating an interesting post-apocalyptic world and a Las Vegas desolate. The production was a bit better than the last, and presented Claire Redfield, Jill left in place (without much explanation).'Resident Evil 4: afterlife' was again directed and scripted by Anderson, who wrote a vulgar and superficial plot, hoping to unite all the outlandish action scenes with little dialog. The result was a range of characters shallow, betting on 3D effects. Neither the presence of the brethren Redfield managed to save the production.'Resident Evil 5: Retribution' (Resident Evil: Retribution), again written and directed by Paul W. S. Anderson, can regain the quality of the first film, and features a plot slightly more evolved than the last.The film begins with Alice exactly where we last saw the end of Resident Evil 4: Restart - on the deck of the mysterious ship Arcadia, where she hoped to find more survivors of the epidemic.But in reality, what awaits is a battle of his life, when his former ally, Jill Valentine (Sienna Guillory), and a squadron of helicopters terrible V-22 of the Umbrella Corporation approaching with orders to shoot to kill .Alice awakens in the heart of Umbrella's clandestine operations, and discovers more secrets of his mysterious past as delves into the complex. Without a safe haven, Alice continues to hunt those responsible for the virus, a chase that takes her from Tokyo to New York, Washington, DC and Moscow, culminating in a mind-blowing revelation that will force her to rethink everything she believed to be true .With a frantic pace, all scenes are loaded with zombies, explosions, monsters, shootings and fights. It's difficult to breathe between one sequence and another, since the great 3D takes you into the screen.This is what most resembles the games: the Red Queen commands the action, announcing where the protagonists will then separating the battles in stages where characters must dodge enemies - like La Plagas and the Axemen. Just one joystick to get you into the action.Anderson came up with an ingenious way of bringing back characters who had suffered brutal deaths in the previous films, including Rain (Michelle Rodriguez, and always great playing several characters) and Jill Valentine (Sienna Guillory in acting weak and full of catchphrases). Carlos (Oded Fehr, great), Luther West (Boris Kodjoe, good) and Albert Wesker (Shawn Roberts) also return in style.Who gives a show is China's Li Bingbing ('The Forbidden Kingdom'), who lives Ada Wong, Wesker agent that fights alongside Alice. Very comfortable in the role, she will win over fans of the games and movies. Johann Urb also shows great talent as Leon Scott Kennedy.The sequence in which Alice appears as a simple housewife in the suburbs is the best, showing that what is missing is the action excessive leave aside and return to the horror genre - Anderson seems to know that driving with more wisdom.'Resident Evil 5: Retribution' will appeal to fans of the franchise and action movies, with breathtaking sequences and doses of suspense and laughs volunteers - but starts to show some wear. Is your brain off and watch a dazzling game without being in charge of the Joystick.

Review_body: Apparently the people who watch this movie are expecting some boring drama with nothing interesting to happen. I would never have thought of complaining about this movie. Seriously this movie is amazing i highly recommend it, and it makes me wish they released a sequel already! This movie is awesome and any person to say otherwise is just a pompus fat bloak that doesn't even have friends so they go on the internet to attempt and ruin the image of a perfectly awesome movie. The series started off as a video game, so i really cant understand someone who calls themselves a fan why would they complain about the plot line being like a video game? That just means they actually aren't REAL fans of the series at all! Resident evil promises to keep you wanted for more and thats a garantee, take it from me. This movie has HUGE replay value. And pls don't take someone elses unjust opinion of the film if you have not seen it yourself. And to all the haters, if you don't like this movie than clearly you were NEVER a real fan of the series anyway, perhaps just a fanboy following some fad. Review title: Inspires heavily from the first Resi movie - great on its own, too!
Review_body: The series of Resident Evil movies has gone down hill since the second movie, no question. However this movie has really upped it's game! You can tell it goes back to it's roots with stunning visuals and scenes. Especially when it takes place in the suburbs and city locations!We also see the story taking a twist where Alice is now working with the man she was out to destroy. The only logical answer as the movie progresses.We see some new faces, very wanted faces! The acting throughout is superb! The entire script and scenes flow effortlessly!I believe people are rating the movie low due to the last 2 movies and now it's "cool" to be petty when rating. This movie is definitely worth a watch!

Review title: Good for Milla Jovovich fans, Bad for Movie Critics, Worse for Die-hard Resident Evil fans.
Review_body: Having watched many different scores of movie genres growing up, I know the structure of "good movies", regardless of what the cast is. Like the title says, this movie only points one way and misses the others depending on what you want out of it.!Begin Spoiler! Remember the trailers that came out? Remember how it seemed like Alice would be hunting down Albert Wesker(the guy with the shades at the end of the last one) all across the globe? Not to mention, the theatrical movie poster has a specific tag line: "Think global. Kill local." It made you think that Alice would be going from one country to another with a huge vendetta as her motivation. Incorrect. When Alice's role begins, she is trapped in an underwater fortress where each dome simulates a tourist-trap city(AKA Moscow, Tokyo, New York City).Now, remember that feeling you got when you found out cast members from the first movie were coming back? Well, they are, but as villains. Permanently. Basically, they fooled you with the trailers into thinking the movie would have completely different setting directions. The plot direction is also different compared to the trailers: Albert Wesker is not a villain, but a protagonist throughout the entire film. The Red Queen is the villain once more.Even though they mislead you this way, if you love action and violence(and Milla Jovovich), you'll get a good kick. If you love a well-structured movie, it'll only be so-so. If you're a Resident Evil franchise fan, you will hate it for "being original". Good thing I love Milla more than the video game. :PSpecial Effects: A (counting the 3-D moments) Music Score: A Plot: C Cast: B Buyable Movie: Maybe

To be honest this film is a complete yawn-fest from the beginning to the end. TOTALLY unrealistic action scenes do little to improve a boring and tedious plot line.A film too far, by far. Have always found previous films in the series to be entertaining (in a rather mindless way), and have been worth the watch, but I am sorry to say that this film does not follow this pattern in anyway.Although having polished CGI, these do little to improve the film with its wafer-thin plot line. You just sit there in the action scenes bored to tears as you have seen it all before.A film for hard-core Resident Evil fans only I fear and there are far better films out there than this to spend your valuable time watching.

Review title: My 6 yo son could write a better script than that crap!!!!
Review_body: Really??? Did anyone go trough this script?? What are you spending money on?!? I can't understand how anyone could let this movie go out to public like this! I really loved RE 1-3 but they started messing up on RE4 and now they really hit rock bottom!! The writer seems to be dumb in order to write that! I don't even know if he wrote anything or everyone just went along with it.. Seems so stupid! I hope the next movie will go to someone who is not a complete retard and will write something good. I mean come on, I can write better than that, and even my 6 yo son has better imagination! Watch this movie so you can understand the frustration!

Review title: Kindly remove this movie from the horror genre....
Review_body: The movie is opposite to its title name.... Not even a single horror scene only action and action .... i don't understand if you are making a horror movie then why you made such action scenes besides horror scenes.....action was really very awesome but they should added some horror and suspense scenes...Another big issue about the Zombies ... viewer want to see lots of zombies but in this movie there is just 2 big zombies and some zombie armies which is not so clear .....otherwise there is a war between human and clone ...In case of characters i really appreciate that they brought some original RE game play characters like Leon and Ada but both was looking sidekick although they are the main character in game play....Hope in RE6 they put more zombies more horror thriller and suspense scenes with all these characters ..

Review title: Wow... what a piece of trash!
Review_body: I don't even know what to say about this film, because it made no sense, I can't even write any spoilers because it was so jumbled and hard to follow. My concern is why they have decided to release another one of these into a flailing series, which clearly needs to go. Special effects were good, the fight scenes were good but nothing new, so all in all, if you have seen any of the resident evil films already don't bother with this one. This film is what I like to call easily forgotten. Evidently the makers of this clap trap just want to continue the series so they can make a buck or million, because this film was made with no effort, I can't believe that these actors and actresses are no fed up of this by now.

Review title: I do not understand all the negative reviews.
Review_body: Resident Evil Retribution is not a bad movie. I have seen action movies that are much worse. Instead, this movie moves too quickly for people to understand the brilliant subtleties underneath. On the surface, the 3d is fantastic, the action sequences are brilliantly choreographed, and the storyline is sold. Many would argue otherwise, saying that the acting is terrible, and the writing is pathetic. However, the main characters are being shot at. Sure, there is a lack of development, but that is the point. This is the end of the world. People are not safe, and Anderson wanted that to be clear. The acting is poor on the part of Li Bingbing and Sean Roberts, but Milla Jovovich brings real emotion to her part. One scene with her "daughter" in which she sacrifices herself after shedding a single tear left me speechless. And the opening shot in the water with an almost holy light representing Alice as the savior of mankind shows that there is a little more to this movie than people realize. Paul Anderson will not hold your hand through it or give you a reason why zombies can wield guns. And who can aruge against it. It's science FICTION. This is not a realistic movie, and people need to understand that. I enjoyed this movie, and despite its flaws, the soundtrack, fight scenes, and storyline were enough to sell me.

The only quarrel I have with this movie is the cliffhanger and I mean SERIOUS cliffhanger. I almost died it hurt me so much lol. the reason that even the bad reviewers say they want to see the next movie is because of the ending here.Everyone is so stuck on the video game that they don't realize that no one wants to see a complete duplicate of what they've already played through. The extra clones surviving was rather random but such a great addition. Unrealistic zombies? You all forget that Resident Evil is nothing but a virus gone wild - even the games follow that much. Since that is an unpredictable turn, anything that happens in the movie is still a strong possibility for the true storyline.I LOVE Becky, shes such a cutie pie and a strong addition to Alice's character, especially since she's deaf. She may "officially" be the ultimate weapon BUT she is as human as she can be with the knowledge of being a clone, and biologically modified, and virtually indestructible.Now people complain about Milla being married to the director and that's why Alice stays alive? Which main character from the game has died yet? None of them. They're all in RE:6 - including Wesker's "son". Wtf? A nice twist but geez.I've been a fan of the games AND the movies since they first came out and I am very happy with what I have seen and what I will hopefully be seeing in the future.

This movie is the worse thing that has come out in Cinema since Watchmen. First of all if you are trying to direct a movie based on a game please follow the plot if you cant do so, at least be close enough.This movie was outrageously embarrassing from a Resident Evil gaming fan, horrible casting milla has no part to do in the movie and the only reason she is here is cause of her husband directing the movie.How can you not have CHRIS REDFIELD play the lead role in any of the 5 ugly action filled silly movie ? Nothing about Claire barely anything given to poor Leon and its so sad Ada Wong plays more important role than the important characters. How the hell do you integrate Las Plagas without any knowledge about it ? I bet the next movie will have all the amazing scripts and monsters from Resident Evil 6 but the usual the director will mess it up :)I have way too many things to murder this horrible movie franchise but I will just skip it and tell you please who ever things the above reviews are decent, I would like to have what you are smoking

The animation is great, the movie worth a 3d ticket. The story is little bit easy, director want to expend the story of resident evil to a serial. Better to enjoy it in the cinema with at lease 3D. In the end of the movie, there seems something between libingbing and the Russian guy. I think they may be the double face between red queen and boss. Most of the shoot remind me of the Call of duty, it is almost the same with the game, when they fright with the zombie in the restrant. The biggest surprise is the RR, can you believe that even 007 did not have that fancy car. the fright during the riding is so amazing . I like that extrodenery fighting.

Firstly, i'm a huge fan of RE series. This part has gone far far away from the first one.Now there's almost no suspense except the scene of zombie attack in suburbia, but amounts of action. The point is not just in kicking ass, it's in the way how they do it! Sense of humour and Rolls Royce rule! 3D is really great, especially in IMAX.Definitely better than the previous part.Weak plot line is the only disappointment.Extinction, Afterlife and Retribution reminds me of road movies. Heroes are moving from place to place and fight zombies in different locations.I hope they'll finally reach the destination point in next RE movie.Interesting and breathtaking,can't wait for the next one.

Review title: Nice Ending Even It Is Not A Good Ending
Review_body: I Can Said That The Opening And Ending Of This Movie Was Nice.The Opening Of This Movie Also Very Nice , Making People Feeling Nervous Or Excited What That The Main Character Doing About And What The Movie Mainly About . While The Movie's Ending Even Was Questioning People's Mind But I Think It Is The Best Movie With Questionable Ending If Compared With The Last Hour And Insidious. Maybe On The Disappointment Side Was I Am Watching 3D Version And They Were Much Less Special Scene For 3D Making Me Feel That Wasting Money For Watching 3D Even I Am Not Wasting My Time Watching The Movie. The Special Scene For 3D Was Less If Compared With The Spiderman That I Watched The Same With 3D. I Hope More From This Video As The Characters Inside Never Had Their Bullet Finished And I Only Have Seen A Scene Of Reloading Weapon And The Other Are Just Keep Shooting And Not End Of This. Sometimes , We Need Some Things That Still Rely On The Reality , The Zombies Also Can Survive Although There Are Flood When The Bom Exploded.Wesker Injects Alice With The T-Virus In Order To Return Her Former Superhuman Powers, In Order To Enact His Plan And That She Is Responsible For Saving The Remaining Humans From Extinction Once And For All But How Can She Escape From Umbrella's Tracking Safety When She Did Not Have The Superhuman Powers Previously?

Easily my 2nd favorite of the franchise, with Apocalypse being the first. The movie starts with a bit of a twist of sorts. Wesker is taking on an unfamiliar role as protagonist alongside Alice. Alice is captured by Umbrella and taken to an underwater facility in northern Russia. Alice escapes with Wesker's and Ada's help.This movie brings back a lot of familiar faces, and a few new ones. Has a lot of face-paced action sequences. Familiar foes from the game serious, and one of the best fight scenes of the entire franchise.Jill was particularly well played in this movie. I only wish Wesker had a much larger role.The way this one starts out with a recap of the first 4, makes even newcomers to the series easy to decipher what is going on.A must see.

I just saw it today in Imax 3-d and loved it! Forget the reviews from the haters and go have fun! One of the best elements for me was all the different environments (New York City, the suburbs, Moscow, Japan, etc.,). Excellent 3D effects, and the storyline pulled everything from the other movies together, at the same time, if you never saw any of the other movies you could enjoy this one without being lost. I want to go back and see it again on the big screen!Everyone looked great, plenty of eye candy (for guys and girls). To all the negative reviewers: We know this isn't "Gone with the Wind" with incredible acting and deep characters, it's about a wild ride and fast paced action and it delivers! Thanks to all involved in the making of Retribution!

I have always loved the RE series, so as much as I hate to say it, this movie was kind of a let down compared to the rest. Most of the acting was terrible and very stiff and the characters had no real depth, I didn't even care when anyone died because they barley spoke or showed any emotion. Even with Alice I got a different vibe from the previous movies, she was a lot more stiff and her personality didn't really show. There were no real plot twists or "wow" moments for me. I felt like I was waiting the entire time for something awesome to happen and then it was just over.The action parts were good, but I think they focused way too much on making everything slow motion and a lot of it ended up looking cheesy. Although this one wasn't the best I'm still optimistic for the next one!

Review title: A waste of my theater going dollars
Review_body: I have enjoyed previous installments of this franchise and went to see this most recent entry in 3D. Not having seen anything in the new 3D format I felt this action movie would be the one to showcase this technology. I was wrong. I found the 3D effects were most prominent on the periphery of the screen and distracted from the foreground action.As far as the film itself, little plot development to the franchise theme, pretty vapid dialog (when there is any dialog)and no character development. I enjoy action movies but can do without 90 minutes of frenetic action that does not really forward a story.Hollywood - Please return to story telling without all the unnecessary gimmicks.

This isn't what I'd call a complex or sophisticated action movie, but what I will call it is *fun*. The story is relatively simple but straightforward(in strong contrast to the last film), the action sequences are exciting and fun to watch, and Milla is well, Milla. It doesn't aspire to be more than a fun action movie, and Resident Evil Retribution delivers exactly that. Well worth your time, definitely the best of the RE films since the original classic. Rodriguez and the other guys do a nice job in their appearances in this film, and the decision to bring back Jill Valentine was definitely a plus. The movie isn't exactly original, certain elements of the storyline are basically plot devices from the first film that were rehashed & repackaged for Retribution. At the end of the day though, I didn't mind that at all. Anderson manages to deliver exactly what I was expecting, an exciting action- packed movie about a heroine who beats up on zombies. For what it sets out to do, Resident Evil: Retribution really does deliver.

Loved the movie it was awesome cant wait for the next one this movie was worth my money loved it Alice was great n she was hot zombies looked sickkkkkkkk overall I give this movie 10 stars because it was that good best resident evil movie lots of action!!! If I could give this movie 100 stars I would it all the all the actors looked like the actual characters from the game Michelle Rodriguez is a really good actor I was really happy when they brought her back I like how the zombies weren't slow looking the evolved lol they look all crazy now but it's cool because I'm tired of watching slow looking zombies great great great movieeeeeeeeere u should definitely go watch it u won't regret it unless ur like 50 or something ;))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))))) I hope they make the 6th one!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Review title: It's better than Afterlife, I'll give it THAT much.
Review_body: The movie picks up where Afterlife left off, kind of. I say kind of because they start it off with a pointless slow motion rewind of the opening scene, before actually getting to it. Moving on, Alice, played by Milla Jovovich, has been recaptured by Umbrella. And she easily escapes. Seriously, with all the trouble Alice has put them through in the past, they don't seem all too interested in keeping her AFTER THEY FINALLY CAPTURE HER. Then we run into Ada, played by Bingbing Li, who is not working for Wesker, played by Shawn Roberts. Then we run into Leon Kennedy, by by Johann Urb, Barry Burton, played by Kevin Durand, and Luther West, played by Boris Kodjoe, who are also not working for Wesker. They also have two more people with them, but you shouldn't care about them, and clearly the movie doesn't either, since their names aren't even given to us before they're killed off. Seriously, I had to look it up to know their names, because the credits didn't have them either.The main problem with the film is that it makes no sense whatsoever. Everything that happens in the film could've easily been avoided by Umbrella by just killing or brainwashing Alice from the start. But no, they wait until she escapes to attempt to do anything about her. And by the way, why are they still making Alice clones when they had the original right there? Why not just stick one of those spider things on her chest and call it a day? Oh, right, because the plot says so. We also see the return of the Executioner, from Resident Evil 5. And you know what? It still doesn't make sense for him to be here. They were made with Uroboros, which was made from Las Plagas. Las Plagas was NOT made from the T-Virus! I wouldn't mind it so much, if the movie would AT LEAST explain what it IS, and WHERE it came from in the movie's universe. Only people who have played the games (Resident Evil 4 and 5, to be specific) will know what any of this stuff is, while non-fans will just be confused. We also have a Giant Licker (Just go with it), and zombie supersoldiers, I guess? Those weren't even IN the games!(Unless you count Resident Evil 5, but come on, you know as well I do that those guys were not zombies) The only people who have EVER heard about them are people who have read the Resident Evil books! Not the movie books, either. The (really hard to find) books that were based on the games.The special effects are nice, but the 3D is non-existent. If you're going to see this movie, save yourself the money, and stick with the 2D version. There's also far too much action. It's just scene after scene of non-stop action. That's alright, I guess. Nothing too wrong with that (though it's basically saying that if there's nothing going on, we're not interested), but there's very few scenes in which we start to care about the characters. That's already hard enough as it is. The best character in this regard is probably Becky, played by Aryana Engineer, who basically just exists for these scenes and to further the ongoing clone subplot. Everything in this movie is just wrong. If anything, Paul Anderson just played/saw someone playing the games and just took what he thought would make the best action scenes, regardless of whether or not it made sense for them to be there. If I have to say ONE good thing about this movie, it's that the action scenes are decent. If you go to see this movie for the action and nothing else, you'll be entertained the whole way through. Just don't expect much else.Acting 4.5/10 Story 4/10 Special Effects 4.5/10 Usage of 3D 3.5/10Overall 4/10

Review title: One of the worst ever Resident Evil sequels
Review_body: I am big-big Resident Evil movie fan. I really expected a lot from this movie; but I am sorry to say this disappointed me thoroughly!! The story was really crappy. Although the action sequences were fine but they were nothing extraordinary. There is nothing new in the movie. Not even at a single point did I feel glued to the movie. After 15-20 minutes into the movie I was really thinking why did I go for it? I think the resident evil series could have done without this sequel. To all those people who have been really waiting to go and watch this movie; well you people can wait for it to come on DVD and have a look then. I don't think this is worth going to a theater for.

I first like to say that I am a fan of the Resident Evil Franchise. I've watched all the movies and played all the games. That being said, this movie is horrible. The whole movie seems like a opening scene, just bullets and explosions for 95 minutes.The new characters are forced, the dialogue is horrible. The only reason anyone seemed to like this movie was because they got to stare at Mila for an hour and a half. If all you want is to stare at Mila use a Google images search.They could have cut this whole movie down to 20 minutes and given us a real story for the next hour. But that would require writing a decent script. If the dialogue in this movie was more that 20 pages I would be surprised.How any one can defend this movie baffles me. Please spend your money elsewhere, if I could go back in time I would watch something else. You can wait until it's on Netflix, trust me. If they make money on this film they will continue to puke out this drivel banking on fan loyalty.This movie was a serious disappointment.

I'm a big fan of Resident Evil. I waited two years for resident evil retribution and I was really disappointed. The movie was not the worst movie ever but it's the worst resident evil and the movie looked really short. I tought that retribution will be better than Afterlife but retribution is the worst resident evil ever. I didn't understand the movie. Why Rain, Carlos and One are still alive? They died in the other movies. Where are Chris and Claire? Why does Wesker's still alive And Why the f**k he's whit the good guys??!! why does Alice know Ada, she never been in other resident evil movies. I really hope that the next resident evil will be better.

Well.... Where can i start? From start to finish we literally learn nothing.. and i mean nothing. OK apart from the fact that the Red queens alive and has been doing this the whole time!? Serioulsy who wrote that into the script. Would have made more sense for my nan to be behind it all. OK so it starts slow, after about 20 mins of film and all thats happened is clone Alice living a life with her husband and deaf daughter (Whats that about? What impact on the film was this meant to provide?)I was starting to wonder if this film was ever going to get going. In answer to that no. I waited for the good parts to start, and it did..... at the very end of the film.... way to drag this series out some more. 90 mins of Alice just fighting her way out of one place. One place! Only to be injected with the T virus again!? Why take it a way from her then give it her back later, should have just written the 4th film off! I cant even begin to explain how stupid the whole idea is. its like a massive filler episode on a TV show.... Yes the good stuffs coming, we'll give it to you in another year and a half. Well i for one wont be watching it.

I can't believe I wasted the money to see this in the theater. Thank God I didn't pay for 3D. I don't even know where to start, except that the only redeemable aspect is you finally get Leon, Barry, and Ada in the film series.The CGI was like a steak from a all-you-can-eat-buffet way overdone! Perhaps it was because it was intended to be shot for 3D and standard format was forced to suffer. For all of the computer work they had, they just should have done another animated film.All of the characters seemed like they were trying to out act each other. Seriously, their dialog didn't flow well, and felt like amateur hour. I have seen better high school renditions of "guys and dolls" or even "death of a salesman".The film was reminiscent of the last 2 Pirates of the Caribbean with the multiple story lines running parallel throughout the movie.
