The fight scenes were also completely ridiculous. Seriously, is Rain the new Vorhese? She seriously dies in the first movie, comes back here, dies once as a "civilian clone" and the final fight scene is almost impossible to kill again. She injects herself with the "las plagas" to gain super-strength, gets filled with lead by Leon and Luther, the bullets are ejected from her finger tips, and then they both proceed to go hand-to-hand with her. If you don't killer her by lead poisoning, a little slap fighting probably wont cut it.I won't even get into the gun fighting. Yes its fiction, but even here a dual .50 cal fired at a pimped out Cadillac with do more than chip the paint job. Everyone in the car would be meat jelly in 10 seconds. All Alice says to the boys in the back is basically "you wanna shoot back?" Are you kidding??!?!?! Are they really trying to kill the franchise? I mean I would "almost" rather pay the same money watch "Batman and Robin" again! At least we could hear Arnold say the corny freeze puns again instead of this catastrophe. It was like they took the last 3 games, put them in a blender, took a dump in it, and hit puree.Don't waste the money in the theater, and if you see it in 3D serves you right you got robbed. If you had seen the last one, you would not have wasted your time.

Review title: I know it has it's flaws.. But i had an AMAZING and AWESOME time nonetheless!!
Review_body: I have seen and heard many negative reviews about the latest installment of the Resident Evil series, and that Paul W.S. Anderson has ruined the Resident Evil franchise but I really have to disagree with all these critics.Sure, the movie does have it's flaws, especially plot wise, dialogue wise etc. But I still found it to be an awesome action movie with dazzling 3-D effects, cool and exciting fight sequences and enough action to keep your heart pumping non-stop!The opening sequence for this movie was just EPIC, especially with the music composed by Tomandandy. Being able to see the action unfold in reverse and in slow motion was just the coolest thing ever. It also introduces us to the Jill Valentine from the Resident Evil 5 game with her mind-controlling scarab in action for the first time, with her machine guns blazing. Another thing i really loved was how Alice used her coins as ammunition for the last time against one of the umbrella helicopters. The story of how they were all racing against time to escape from the Umbrella facility reminded me of the first movie and also in some way the games, where you have a certain time limit to escape before the building you are in explodes.Another thing i loved about the movie was the introduction of characters Ada Wong, Leon S. Kennedy and Barry Burton. I believe that Li BingBing played the role of Ada Wong rather well. Like the games, there are moments where she will exude a certain confidence, and appear tough, while at times, she would appear vulnerable, like when she gets caught.Johann Urb also portrayed Leon well, though i would definitely hope to see him in more action, and with more dialogue (smarter ones).Kevin Durand was an interesting take on the character Barry in my opinion. In the games, I would think of Barry as a more grumpy, rugged and older man. Whereas here you get a younger and more humorous Barry, which i thought was alright. The final battle on the ice boasts some of the most creative and amazing fight sequences, (in amazing 3-D). This fight is also the first time where i find myself actually fearing for Alice's life (watch it and you know why) and I really enjoyed seeing her in this vulnerable state. She is human after all.One major flaw in this movie was the dialogue. Although i do appreciate the occasional cheesy one liners, I do think there was way too many cheesy lines here. Also, i find that some of the dialogue makes it seem like the characters weren't really conversing, but rather making statements. Especially the one where Alice was talking to Leon before she heads off to rescue *someone*. Another flaw of this movie was the discreet introduction of the Las Plagas parasite. Fans of the Resident Evil franchise would know of the parasite from the 4th game, but they should have at least dedicated some time in the movie to introduce the parasite, and explain it's origins. Other than these little flaws, I still found the film enjoyable. I have watched it three times already and each time i left the cinema i find myself being mind blown by it.I will definitely look forward to the next Resident Evil movie, which i am sure will happen. Be sure to catch this movie in IMAX 3-D! Worth every penny.

Wow . The other movies were OK. Especially 1-3. This was complete garbage. Literally. The plot was all over the place. wait there was no plot. Yes, the visuals were awesome. Thankfully I saw it in 3d. Other than that it was crap. Please tell me WHY WHY WHY did they not stick to the story of the game. Why did they introduce retarded characters. I really hope that someday someone remakes this series and sticks to the story of the game. It would be sooooo much better.This movie is literally Alice running around for no reason shooting people. Then it's over. Skip it and see something else. I pray the next movie will serve a purpose.Good stuff>>> www.youtube.com/EclipseProductions89

Review title: Best of the Series! Great for fans of the movie series and games!
Review_body: In my summary I mentioned RE 5 is great for fans of the movie series and games. If your true genuine lover of zombies this movie is for you! Non- fans may enjoy it because of the GREAT ACTION!I have followed the movies since the first back in 2002 and fell in love right away. Movie picks up right after the "Afterlife." Alice sums up all the movies in the beginning; however,a lot is left out from what she shares in the beginning. This movie brings a lot in from the games and with that it gives you a game kind of feel during the movie. Alice and her team have to complete stages and kill bosses. None stop fun and action from start to finish. You have almost time to think during the movie; I sat through the credits processing "What just happened" in the last 1hr & 1/2? I encourage you to give RE 5 a chance and help yourself by not listening to all the RE Film criticizers and the critics. It makes me wonder if they even watched the movies? I was hoping it was a bit longer of a movie and the whole thing with A. Wesker? Overall 8/10. These movies are promising and I would say their is a bright future ahead for the RE Film Series!!!

So what is this film about? At the end of the last film we see Alice on top of an oil tanker with a bunch of freed Umbrella experimental victims. Film opens, they all die, Alice gets captured, taken to an underground facility, which the rest of the film is about her escaping from. Sound familiar? She gets help along the way, strangely from the guy she blew up at the end of the previous film. So why go and see this film? Well for me, I needed to know how the series is going to progress. With any luck the next film will be the last, Oh and Alice gets her powers back in the last 30 seconds of the film to turn her back into the ultimate weapon to save the human race. I was hoping for resolution, or a culmination to the series with this film, not a stringing and milking of the fan base. So now I look forward to the end of this series with the next film, but they managed to string the end of Harry potter into two films, they'll probably do the same with this one! Good old Cash Cows!

It get's only 4 stars because of some good cgi effects in 3D.To make it quick: The first 10min were excellent. I liked the Reverse- Prequel-Intro and the time in the "matrix" with shocking moments and emotions and a little humor but then this movie turned into a scene to scene shooting range with god-mode weapons and totally shitty Nazi-zombies and old beasts from part 2 and 4. thats all. nothing more to say to this piece of crap. this series developed just like saw. the first one interesting with good ideas. the second one the same but in a bigger area. then the third... (nah) and then the money-making with sequels starts.and please....don't write comments when you aren't at least 25 years old.

To be honest I'm not a fan of these films, I love the games just not the live action movie's.The actors are great, don't get me wrong, they all portrayed the original RE live action film characters well as the other movie's, as well as the RE game characters. To be honest I only wanted to see this film due to the fact Leon was finally in it! I needed to make sure they portrayed him well and I've got to say... I was disappointed and it's not because of Johann Urb he played Leon fantastically they picked the right guy to play him, plus he's hot!! But Leon wasn't witty! That's the best thing about Leon he's quick witted, but he was just boring and didn't really have that many lines... was basically a bit part like Barry who didn't say much either and was way too tough than I remember him being in RE.The story line's for these films are just awful! The red queen i just don't understand, why is she being portrayed as a child, i know its mentioned in the first film but can't remember, they should at least stick to the games scenario. There was way too much action in this film also, it was just action, after action, after action, after action there was hardly a break in between the action sequences, i was hoping for something more dark and for a big arse creature that wasn't so easy to take out! oh and as for the Las Plagas that Rain injected into herself and Leon and the other guy couldn't kick her arse... Leon would have know how to have killed her, the las plagas virus isn't unbeatable... just so disappointed and they've left it open for another one... The only way i'll see this one is if Leon is in it again :D LOL

Well this is my first Commentary on a Movie. I think i won't tell something important to reveal parts of the Story. Just read and see.The first Thought i got after i've seen this Movie was why no one tests this Film and maybe criticizes the weak Parts of it. I love Resident Evil from little Boy on till now where Movies of my favorite Game took over. A really intelligent Introduction with Reversing the Storyline for a perfect reconciliation to the upcoming Story was a real Word to start with. There are nice shocking Effects in the following so that my Mouth couldn't stop smiling. The never ending Action-Scenes are the Stuff what makes this Movie alive. You and of course the actors cant get rid of it.:-)The Story in general is not bad but could be better. Innovating Ideas in between- but not superior new. In between there are many unnecessary Dialogs which pull the Rating of this Movie down like an anchor. Also gratuitous is the Voice but more the Video Animation of the Red Queen through the whole Film. Finally i'd say this is not the worst Resident Evil but unfortunately I think the 5th Part had to reveal on the Cinemas to be shown. Who likes the Second Part will also like this One. Some nice 3D Effects top off the cinema experience so if you like Resident Evil just watch this One.

Review title: I didn't know there were filler movies!
Review_body: I was very excited when I went to see this movie, the trailer got me hyped up and I was curious how the story would continue!I will avoid spoilers as much as possible but I can tell you this, you remember that awesome "fight for survival, fortress" - scene from the trailer? Well that one has nothing to do with the movie, its the ending scene!When I started to watch the Resident Evil movies, i quickly realized, they have not much in common with the games! So you must not try to compare them!This movie invested a lot in very bad 3d effects that desperately try to cover up the fact that plot and logic went overboard at the very first scene and cruelly drowned!The story makes absolutely no sense, it completely ignores what happened in the previous movies and the only highlights were some semi nude pictures of Milla Jovovich and well thats it!The whole plot of this movie is normally covered in the first 30 minutes of any other movie and raises the suspicion that they just want to milk the cow dry!

Review title: total crap, should end at Resident Evil: Afterlife
Review_body: real crap, that what i can say about this film. i think this film is better ended at Resident Evil: Afterlife when the boss was dead but now they make the sequel with another "never ending story" with a total crap at its end. at the end of Resident Evil: Retribution, when i see the castle that was "the last stronghold of humanity", its make me wonder: whoa, is this film want to make sequel of Lord Of The Ring or the sequel of Resident Evil? with all that dragon zombie that flying around the castle versus helicopter and that giant+zombie versus flame thrower, so now the story was a castle defense against zombie? that looks like a mix of modern firepower + lord of the ring for me

Although I've seen worse movies, (not many, but they're out there), and this MAY not have been as bad as the last, it was still yet another complete let down by the Resident Evil writers. These movies veered TOTALLY off course, and shouldn't even be considered part of the Resident Evil movie selection. Not to mention, VERY short. Just when you think it's about to begin, it ends. I'm legitimately mad at myself for paying to see this. I keep "hoping" that maybe the writers will come out will a truly well-put-together movie, or even just better than the last, but have severely failed my expectations for the last handful of movies. If they do plan on coming out with yet another Resident Evil, which is definitely suggested by the total LACK of movie, I, for one, will not be donating my money again.

Resident Evil, the video game to movie franchise that's outlasted the rest. First there was Resident Evil and then we have had Apocalypse, Extinction, Afterlife and now Retribution.Now this time around the film revolves around Alice, just like all the others. Alice is caught by Umbrella, the big nasty corporation, just like all the other films. This time she has to fight her away out against a load of zombie monsters and clones or drones from a compound in Russia. Here she meets some familiar faces along the way and guns and explosions splatter brains around the place.Now quite frankly I like zombie films but also quite frankly this franchise has offered very little since the first movie. This film brings back some old characters in a clear way to encourage somebody to give it the green light and sanction a budget of $65 million. This does at least give the story a bit of a twist but it's pretty much the same old drivel and same old ideas. The only character I wanted to see back was Sienna Guillory's and only because she is frankly blooming gorgeous.If you watched the last rotter in this franchise line you will remember it ended all set up for a sequel. This was kind of annoying but it sort of tied a rubbish plot line up in the hope for something better next time along. Well that hasn't happened and to make matters worse this film does exactly the same, its left all set for another sequel and judging by the early box office it will surely get made.There's really nothing new and there's far too much of the stupid throw something scenes so it misses the baddie and hurtles towards the camera, all done to justify this movies 3D status. It's boring, we've seen that before and we are not impressed. Ill give it some credit though, the monster zombies look better than they have done so far. The opening sequence is also noteworthy, but then half repeats itself to fill time, but at least it was mildly imaginative.This franchise could easily be rebooted for the money they spend on it and they would be better for it. Anderson just loves directing his wife in these movies; I just don't like watching them any more. Frankly this movie sums up all that's bad about some Hollywood films. Its mindless drivel because it's easy to sell that ultimately ends in the audience being short changed. Worse of all to short change us some more by setting up yet another sequel while we are watching this one, not for the first time either.If you like RE you may like this, but you will have seen it all before. It's just brain numbing shooting scenes where the baddie can't shoot straight but all the goodies can. Its predictable nonsense of the most boring kind. It's really quite insulting.

Let me start by saying that these films should not be screened for critics. Of course they will complain! Theses films are made for the fans, not the critics. Yes the plot is a bit thin but escaping from an Umbrella Lab has Resident Evil written all over it. Yes the characters have maybe two lines each but this is a crazy-action-zombie movie, the emphasis is on the crazy action not the dialogue! Notice how no one mentions the 3D effect. The 3D is consistently phenomenal, the best available. The recap at the start of the film was above the heads of the viewers in front of me. If you disagree, go and watch it again in a better cinema with better equipment. Further, there was hardly a second of blur. Everything was sharp, crisp and vibrant even during the crazy action. The choreography was incredible. Milla Jovovich spinning about perfectly with her chain and gun was more of a dance than a fight. A bad ass dance though! How can anyone not like this? I'm trying to think of something better in life than Sienna Guillory in her "battle suit", flipping about shooting things. There's nothing better! Maybe some reviewers would rather see Christian Bale in skin tight black leather and sure, Dark Knight Rises is the superior film but Retribution is everything a fan could ask for and some people just need to sort out their expectations. We are not trying to win an Oscar here, we just want zombie brains splattered into our faces in glorious 3D. 10/10? Why not.

I got to hand it to Paul w.s. Anderson. Just when I was sure that the plots to these horrible movies couldn't get any more senseless and convoluted; just when I thought that they couldn't crap on the Resident Evil lore and the characters there in more than they already have; they pump out this steaming pile of garbage. The plot (if you can call it that) makes zero sense. The writers of these films have dropped their compass in the woods and are hopelessly lost.What was wrong with the original video game plot?. RE (the games) 1, 2, and 3's stories were all 10 times better than any of the movies Paul Anderson has made. For the love of all things sacred we need to boycot these films. Future generations will thank us.

I enjoyed this movie very much. I think every review has pretty much stated what this movie is about. I just have two things to say about this movie: #1 being that I believe that the franchise is heading in a new direction and that RE5 was a starting point for this new direction the franchise has chosen e.g. Albert Wesker is now the President of what's left of the U.S. and he's teamed up with Alice for one final showdown for RR 6. Pretty cool twist if you ask me. #2 I believe that this movie, just like it's predecessor RE4 helps keep the 3D experience going strong. I mean let's face it, not many 3D movies utilize the technology to it's fullest potential and I believe that this movie helps develop the 3D experience. that being said, this movie delivers what you would expect. Looking forward to the next one!!!

I fail understand why there are so many people who love to give negative review about the Resident Evil franchise , The fact that the resident evil Franchise is one among the highest grosser of all time proves the fact that this movie is enjoyed by the audience. It has a mix of horror, great action sequence and graphics, the just apt acting by the actors as per the script , a bit of romance and above all good visual effects. What else is required in a movie which a person watch to spend the weekend with friends?Agreed the movie doesn't makes much sense but nowadays very few movies make sense, Resident Evil Retribution is a kind of movie which is entertaining right from the time when the movie starts till the credits roll on the screen.Just Awesome movie to pass time and indeed it is worth the money spent on ticket, I am just waiting for the finale of this series. I will surely miss the series and so the fans of this series.

Review title: The game is far better than the movie
Review_body: The actor is crap, the acting is horrible, all the elements in the movie is a total disappointment. Barry die and live again, pervert Leon, ridiculous kid named Becky with cheap conversation "mom, is that you?". And what the hell with Michelle R. It is just a stupid idea to take her back, the character didn't have important value, she was not even in the game! Have Paul W.S Anderson and the team (crew, actors) played the game? I thought the game was far better than this stupid movie.Evil goes global. What global? Underground facility? It is stupid advertisement..And please, make a better trailer, not a cheap twisted drama without purpose trailer.This movie is totally awful, Paul W.S Anderson make his name looks like 'Uwe Boll'

Review title: Paul W.S Anderson why? just why?
Review_body: Words cannot describe how much of a failure the whole resident evil film franchise is! Still 10 years later i'm complaining about how they royally messed up an attempt to reinvent the series and now realising that, they try to add main characters from the game into totally different and random scenarios while all being led by this same pointless failure of a character (Alice) who they clearly have gone way to far with to actually get rid of! Rant over :)*Taken a breath* All dialogue from all characters must have easily been fit onto one sheet of A4 paper and felt like i was watching one huge action scene.Such a shame that he would disrespect the characters that Capcom have built and we as an audience have grown to love and adore, the best thing for this whole franchise is to start over and use the characters as they should be used (Definitely not the way they have in this film and whole series) and give us the amazing live action movie of the hugely popular game franchise that we expected long ago.

Review title: A Resident Evil solely made for the games fan-girls/boys
Review_body: The film starts out with a remotely followable plot which continues from the previous film , Afterlife. But about quarter way through the film, the plot just seems to be unfollowable, broken up by tons of pointless fight scenes (which utilise the 3D function, which in my opinion is annoying in any film, anyway) and the introduction fan-girls/boys' wet dreams in the shape of memorable characters from the game's franchise.Although it was nice to see these characters from the game, it shows you how much of a profit orientated film this really was. This is reflected in the poorly written script and the lack of actual enjoyable 'science fiction horror' style moments which really let the film, and the series down, in my opinion.

Review title: Resident Evil movies make in Hollywood are really bad
Review_body: Just to give you a brief description of why do I like Resident Evil. I am a fun of the games I have played Resident Evil 1,2,3,4 and a bit of the 5, My favorite game is Resident Evil 1, a truly lovely horror game, Resident Evil 2,3 are OK, then I has just become a shooter game with less horror. Same with this sequels, Well comparing this to other Resident Evil movies, the first resident Evil was OK, not bad, in the second one it was OK, in the 3rd one it was getting bad, the 4rd one not a really good movie, and this one, is also not a really good movie.The action parts are really bad. Eda Wong is such a weak girl in this movie, and Resident Evil Damnation or even within the game, (cutscenes) she is really strong and she never lets her guard down so easily. If you look at the game and the live action films, there are a lot of gaps.A lot of the scenes are simple pathetic, they are making a complete ridicule of the game.If you are a fan of Resident Evil, watch Resident Evil Degeneration, Resident Evil Dammation or, Resident Evil 4d executer. All of the are CGI films. To summarize if you are a fun of the game don't watch the movie.

Now I realize that the Resident Evil movies aren't Oscar worthy, but they are entertaining, and I was highly anticipating the new movie, being an RE fan. I ignored previous reviews that had slammed the movie because RE movies usually get a fair amount of hate. This was my first mistake. My second was when I walked into the theater the day after it premiered and there were 5 other people. I should have walked out and demanded a refund, but I did not, this was mistake number two. I thus had to sit through what is possibly one of the worst movies I've ever seen. Mostly because of plot holes.Anyone who has seen the movies knows that Paul W.S. Anderson isn't always the most consistent, but this movie took it to an extreme. It's like it didn't care that it was stepping all over the previous movies. I could go on and on listing them, but I'll just name a few of the bigger ones: SPOILER ALERTS:Michelle Rodriguez' character Rain injects herself with a Las Plagas virus and becomes invincible...unlike the Las Plagas soldiers that Leon and Luther KILLED in the Russia dome - Giving Alice back her powers (since Paul W.S. can't make up his mind) -No explanation of what happened to the characters from the last film -Wesker is now a good guy and is leading a band of survivors in Washington D.C. who SOMEHOW had the time/resources to build a wall around the White House, oh and this band of survivors was there all along when Alice scoured the world for survivors apparently -The Red Queen system from the first movie (that got fried) is determined to exterminate humans (even though it's job was to contain the virus)There's countless others, but overall, so many, that I got the impression that no one cared about this movie, and this is Paul W.S.' lazy money machine that will never stop. So I give it 2 stars (Because at least the actors seemed to half give a crap...sometimes)

Not like the other resident evil's movies, this sequence made me regret the money I spent at the movie theater. There is a weak plot and too many special effects and bullets in this movie. Sincerely, I fell asleep during the movie because it just didn't get my attention. But I really liked the resident evil 1 and the sequences 2,3 and 4. This movie also doesn't have the essence of Resident evil, the suspense, the thrilling things that happened in the other movies. I hope next sequence they put another director with better vision of the storyline since Resident evil 1. In order to succeed for the 6th sequence, I would say that the director should watch the 4 first Resident Evil movies before doing a lousy movie like Resident Evil 5.

The movie starts off with a promising beautiful shot of Milla floating surrealistically in the water. You start wondering what happened and you're eager for the story unfold and find out more. But then a badly done cgi opening sequence in reverse starts unfolding and all the mystery and suspense is just ruined. This movie is for people who have no appreciation for suspense being built up. The action just vomits on the screen endlessly without thought or build up. And the whole thing is made worse by the realization that all of what you are seeing is a hologram illusion created by the Red Queen AI trying to kill all humans. It's ridiculous because there is no explanation why the red queen couldn't just endlessly create Executioners. The fight with the licker is over in a pathetic 2 seconds. The old chemistry with rodriguez is completely missing. The RE franchise has been going downhill but this movie took it off a cliff and nosedived it.

Well, I think non-RE fans will not enjoy the movie. If you know what i mean. Characters and EPIC cut-scenes from the video game were added. The fight scenes lacks of what i expected, specially the highly anticipated Alice-Jill brawl. I was all like "OMFG that was it? done already??". Im happy because Anderson changed or added nothing cause it is based on the video-game. The costumes, the Plagas, the bosses. All smoothly done. Of course there were flaws, all movies have :)Overall, its worth the money and the time. Im a huge fan of RE so i really really enjoyed the whole movie :) my Favorite part was the end, Where Jill,Leon,Ada,Wesker and Alice was all like, The Dream Team :DThanks :3

Review title: It has "cheap" written all over it.
Review_body: Cheapest movie from the resident evil series I ever saw. The first 2 movies from the series were really good and I liked them, but this one is just weak... Every cheap scenario from old action movies were in here, 3/2 human soldiers against an army of undead zombies and they still survive. Cheap stunts which everybody already knows, a lot of unrealistic things (even for a movie of this type); eg. the time between a bad guy shooting a gun and the bullets hitting the place where the hero staid was enough for the hero to grab a gun and shoot a big hole in the floor so she can take cover (and the distance was only a few meters). If they planed to make a parody out of the original series, they definitely succeeded.All and all, I feel sorry for Milla Jovovich, since I really like her as an actress.

Review title: Bottom line: If you're in for action, this movie definitely has it.
Review_body: film flam film critic (dot) b log spot (dot) caResident Evil Retribution The fifth installment in the Resident Evil series is everything it should be: brash, loud, and in your face. If you loved the previous four tomes of this apparently unending tale, you're definitely in for a treat. My only complaint is that it doesn't really add anything meaningful to the series plot-wise, except to say that, yes, Alice was captured again, and, yes, she escaped again against all odds. It's also full of the same old wooden dialog as the last couple of films, and even stiffer delivery (it's honestly as if the director used the first cut where the lines were intelligible), but I doubt you're even reading this review if you're looking for serious drama.The events take place directly after the last movie, where Alice, a zombie-human DNA hybrid, has her mutations reversed by the leader of the Umbrella forces, the evil villain (and super-Zombie) Victor Wesgar. That would lead one to suspect that the Umbrella base where she wakes up is run by him... wrong! He has apparently dissociated himself from Umbrella, which is now being run by 'Red Queen', the same Artificial Intelligence that had attempted to kill Alice in the first movie.A temporary security breach allows Alice to escape her captor, Jill, an old friend of hers under the control of the ubiquitous Red Queen, and make it outside the facility to... downtown Tokyo (but that facility has been blown up already, as we know from a previous RE movie. I honestly can't even remember which one since they sort of all meld together).We then find out that she must navigate through an underwater complex designed by Umbrella to demonstrate the effects of the T-virus in Tokyo, New York, and Moscow, to show potential buyers of the T-virus how effective it could be in their enemies' capital cities (that's right, you would never buy a virus unless you actually saw it kill an entire city of clones that looked like your enemies). This at least makes for interesting changes in scenery. She has help from some old friends (Luther and his gang) fighting their way to her from the surface, as well as outside support from Victor Wesgar, her mortal enemy. I unfortunately made the error of leaving my brain on for the duration of this film. Big mistake. This left me wondering... Where does Umbrella get the resources to keep running real-life simulations replete with thousands of clones and zombies? Did the rescuers absolutely need to risk blowing themselves up by planting a giant time-bomb on the base's doorstep? If two huge zombies were between you and a tanker full of gasoline, wouldn't igniting the gasoline blow them onto you, and not in the opposite direction? Why do the clones need to be dry-cleaned? I wonder when that character that was vaporized at the center of a mushroom cloud is going to re-appear? Why didn't Alice and company commandeer a submarine? How do you finish off a 3-tonne super-mutant? Answer: Drive a Bentley down a bank of escalators!Now, I'm probably being mean. So, I'll give the writers a little credit. The movie also probes one deep question. If a clone was made of you, would it be able to communicate with you telepathically through your dreams?Bottom line: If you're in for action, this movie definitely has it.

I felt sorry all along the movie for the people who worked on this lame 65 million dollars pile of crap. actors, casting, directing, sound effects, graphics, storyline, all bad. I wonder what real artists can do with 65 million dollar budget. Time to retire and invest your time in something else. Skip this one its plain awful.... I would almost consider it "b" movie, but it would be an insult to some talented artists with no funds. Resident evil movies have come to the point where its pointless to go on with the same team. Kill it. Sell the franchise. I am a little worn out with the ideas of reboots and remakes, but this is plain dull and soulless. The movie is filled with deja-vu and slow-mo sorta action scenes. Plastic zombies, dumb kung-fu chicks and infinite bullets, all that in a realm of 3D green mesh built by high-school geeks.... Pathetic waste of time and money....

The most ridiculous game to movie transfer ever made! I mean, the previous movies were bad, but this.. Holy Cow!! This was just a quick mix of the video game characters with lots of effects, but still crappy ones. Bad written story, most of the scenes didn't make any sense. I am so disappointed with P.Anderson. I had higher expectations of him as a director but he totally ruined it.I gave it a 2/10 cause i just like the title: Resident Evil. I get it though, Mr Anderson choose actors with more familiarity to him. But still, the result is terrible. Zombies sprinting and shooting while riding bikes.. OK.. I mean, there are so many downsides with this movie that i forgot most of them. And that is a good thing! Trust me!

I love how they started the trailer. The standard comedy way and then suddenly action begins. I give full credit to this movie. I have not seen this movie yet so my assumptions is just by the trailer, rumors and ''facebook'' posts. Still I think this is a ''must to see'' movie. Need to get less lazy and watch it already. Anyway the first time I saw 3D was Resident Evil Afterlife on a cinema in Norway. Pretty good one actually and that was still when 3D were pretty fresh. What could be done better? Why 9 of 10 not 10 of 10 possible. I tell you my opinion. I like how these movie series takes an own turn apart from the original concept by Capcom, but the action is being too much focus and story gets lost. Not just that. Characters like Leon, Ada, Jill and many other main characters in the game series is getting, as I see it figuratively ''blown'' away by Alice actions and skills. Don't get me wrong the character Alice a is perfection but I think other game characters should have a bit more attention and status in the movies. Dragging Leon S. Kennedy in the movie is awesome but Alice isn't suppose to tell him away. At least the dialog should be a bit different so Alice don't take all attention from him and other ones. Well I am so looking forward to this movie when I get the time to see it. Milla in action!

Resident Evil: Wrestle-bution With ZombiesThe best words that could describe this movie: Wrestling + Karate + Boxing = Milla JovovichThe title of the next movie (According to the end of the movie):Resident Evil: the Zoo of DinosaursDo they even know what RE is all about ? Have they ever seen the video game ?This movie, just like the other series (except for the first one) is condemned to an epic FAIL.the best thing about this movie is the eye-catching costume design and visual effects. nothing else.we need some pro gamers to direct this movie.

The CGI was pretty good and Mila looks great, but the movie was silly and boring to watch. I've seen all of the Resident Evils and this one was the worst. Some of the fight scenes were good, with good Matrix like action. I never understood in some movies, how you can kick someone across the room and they get up like they were slapped and unfortunately this movie has that kind of fighting. Jill Valentine looked pretty hot in this movie, but her acting really sucked. I would put this one on the director and the writers. I am hoping the next Resident Evil is an improvement, but I am not holding my breath if they do not change directors.

Awful ??? Yes that is !!! This film is really a waste of time and resources. Nothing and absolutely nothing will make sense to you when you'll watch this movie. There is no story and no script at all. Better go watch Tom n Jerry and you won't regret. Now, make no mistake about it, "Resident Evil: Retribution" is dumb in the purest sense of the word. It's an aggressively silly movie in an aggressively silly franchise. We do not expect quality from Resident Evil any longer. We expect our brains to be expunged of common sense and pumped full of endorphins wearing fetish costumes. For that, Paul W.S. Anderson, I thank you.

OK, firstly. I'm a huge fan of resident evil/flesh eating zombie films. I've seen every resident evil film and was a fan ever since. This one wasn't all that, but I can see where the creator(s) of this film are coming from. Watching the ending of this film it's clearly seen that they've encountered A lot of mutated zombies behind a wall, this MAYBE proves that there's gonna be a new resident evil film in the future? (HOPE SO) And yes, many say "what ever happened to good old zombie horror films". But listen, resident evil is coming towards a new era of zombie's, and I'd like to see that. I had to seriously, watch the film twice to understand it, but I can clearly see that their aiming towards more SCI-FI stuff mix with zombies? which i'm totally fine with. I just hope they make another resident evil to back this one up otherwise it's pretty disappointing. If they end up making another one, would be awesome if they called it ' Resident Evil: The New Era ' or Resident Evil: The Beginning Of The End', something like that to get the fans interested again.

Review title: Don't waste your time or be ready for disappointment
Review_body: I have enjoyed all of the previous movies, some more than others but this movie was absolutely flabbergastingly horrible! They spent way way too much time on action scenes and there was very little story. I agree with another reviewer that the whole movie felt like an opening scene. I literally checked the time into the movie at one point and it was 1hr 10 min and i thought to myself, well there is still 50 minutes to round this out and give us a story. And then the movie ended....Like another reviewer said, the whole movie could have been condensed to 20 minutes and they could have given us more to the story. It is disgusting that they would drag this out just so they can add another sequel in this franchise. There is little plot, little dialog and really not much mentionable about the movie. I wish i could demand my money back!

Review title: Worst movie i forced myself to watch in a while.
Review_body: As most other reviews have mentioned, this movie is total crap.The only good thing about this movie is the eye-candy provided by Li Bingbing playing Ada Wong. I honestly can't believe a professional movie studio approves and funds a piece of crap like this. Resident Evil needs a reboot, with a director (yes, because nobody will convince me this movie actually had a director), a decent plot line that's actually based on the games and WITHOUT MILA. I'm actually too frustrated to keep on going, so that's all i got to say.

Review title: Not as bad as many think...perhaps
Review_body: Everyone is perfectly capable of reading the summary of the film at the top of the page so I shan't bother with that. *Possible Spoiler*I've heard many people saying that the whole movie takes place in an underground facility and all they're doing is trying to escape. Firstly, I'd like to point out that the first (and best) Resident Evil movie takes place in a smaller underground facility in which they are trying to escape. All of the RE movies can be bashed for one reason or another. The acting is never aces, they're rather cheesy and can sometimes have less zombies than you'd expect from what is essentially the only zombie-film series going on today. That's why I look at them as action movies WITH zombies. They seem better that way. Granted, Retribution was not my favorite, and as many say the Red Queen was ridiculously cheesy and...weird, I think that that was trying to appeal more to the gamers, as it resembled whole-heartedly an old video game moment. Nitpicking at these movies is a useless endeavour because they aren't made to be the greatest films. They are simple works of entertainment. You don't need super deep story lines when the dead walk the earth. The deepest you go is by saying that the movies are a metaphor for large corporations brainwashing us and stripping us of our individuality, and the fighting that ensues.RE 5 is entertaining. If you pay attention to what IS happening in the movie and not what isn't, you'll follow the story perfectly fine, and won't be bothered by, for example the *spolier* explained 'whimsical' changing of character's faction (good to bad) which seemed to throw many people off.I dare anyway to show me any action movie who's purpose is action-packed entertainment to exhibit fantastic acting, non-cheesiness, and a deep storyline.RE Retribution kept me entertained. I'm not picky. I give it a six because unless I leave a theatre wishing I hadn't seen the movie, then the movie was probably fairly good.

Let me count the ways this movie SUCKED. I really enjoy zombie movies. Love Walking Dead. Big fan of the earlier Resident Evil movies. This movie was a huge disappointment. The acting was poor. The scenes looked like they were trying to mimic The Matrix. The action scenes were cartoon-like. This movie has ended my desire to ever see another Resident Evil movie come out. Zombies wielding weapons is one thing. Zombies operating vehicles and dressing in coordinating attire is another. The plot was something that appeared to be written on someone's lunch break. I would give this movie just 1 star but I gave it 2 since there was at least some pretty cool large monsters to see occasionally.

As a devoted RE fan, I watched and enjoyed every other movies they made until this one. I am utterly disappointed by (1) the script (2) the characters (3) the FX effects (4) the crap they did by diluting the sequels so they can squeeze an extra buck.I wish I could understand what happened, I really do. I used to say that what they did with RE was terrific, I watched from 1 to 4 countless amount of times and I still find them great. Good amount of horror, the acting's good, the characters are interesting, the storyline is great ...everything was great! For a couple years, they were on my to-watch list.I think they took their fans for granted : *oh, let's cook a real piece of crap, I bet they'll still be happy and buy the movie* Let's go into details a bit : First : the first 15-20 minutes = What the hell? Everything we took for granted is turned upside-down. As if they wanted to make us believe that what we saw in the previous movies was either in Alice's mind or some cheap TV trick to fool us? I hate when they pull that stunt.Second : They bring back interesting characters like Rain and Luther so they can do what exactly? Luther dies by some punch in the heart? Hell, the guy survived a freaking zombie army so he can die in such a cheap way? Why did they bring him back? I think they brought back good characters and made them CHEAP really CHEAP.And, my favorite but not the least ...Becky ...oh Becky. Why should the public care about her? I mean, let's be honest here, they focused on her WAY TOO MUCH, why?????? It's not like your usual fan were soccer moms. She brings nothing to the story. We watch RE to see zombies, fights and MORE ZOMBIES AND MORE FIGHTS. Please stop trying to make us relate to people we don't care about.Third : The FX effects .. don't get me wrong, I don't mind them at all. But I miss the old bite-them-in-the-neck-or-arm zombie action + they really overused them. The final fight is really an anthem to fx effects ...they really lost me there.

Review title: A thrill ride that will leave you wanting more!
Review_body: When I saw the trailer for this movie, I honestly wasn't expecting much. However, 5 minutes in and I was completely blown away. The choreography is superb, the plot is masterfully crafted, and the character development almost made me cry when anybody died. There are unmatched jump scenes and scares, as well as very heartfelt and tender moments. The performance of all the cast is really quite astonishing. Just when I think Milla Jovovich is at the end of her career, she reboots this saga with a mind blowing performance. Props to director Paul W.S. Anderson for such a gripping plot, and ending it masterfully. I would honestly say the action is comparable to the first Matrix movie. Definitely one of this year's must see, and the best Resident Evil movie yet!

Review title: Another good addition to the series, gets better as we go...
Review_body: Now, let me tell you something. Most of the acting is pretty bad. The voice-overs most of the time are second rate.But that doesn't matter. What this movie delivers it provides in spades. Plenty of action, an actual interesting plot (a surprise) and a few twists.Nice to see some old faces, even a few twists there. This is the second movie in the series that actually kept me engaged to the end, same with first movie.If your a fan of the series or the games you will probably like this movie. If your looking for cinematic excellence, you wont find it here.I gave it a solid 9 out of 10 despite it's flaws.

I thought this movie was pretty bad compared to the other 4 films. i am a big fan of the games and the movies. i enjoy them both and you can't compare them to each other. anyway, this movie had the potential to be one of the best in the series with all the returning actors, but seriously the acting wasn't terrible but it wasn't very good either. but, the movie just lost what it originally had in the first 4 films. the final fight at the end was just cringing to watch and the movie just failed to live up to my expectations. of course if i find the movie for like $5 i will buy it to complete my resident evil movie collection, but it is definitely my least favorite in the series next to Extinction. who else agrees? i was looking forward to this movie for like a year and a half, i am so let down.

This film, in my words, is an abomination and should never see the light of day. It is corny, it has bad actors and the movie is plot holes galore. The one that really knacked me off is the part were Leon and Co. are in the Moscow simulation and the Red Queen says "release Las Plagas undead". WTF, Las Plagas do not ride bikes and fire guns, I think they mean to say Juavo from RE6. That annoyed me to a huge extent. The characters never reload or take a bullet, bar Luther and Alice, but that was obvious. Jill looks like she is high the whole time. When Rain injects herself with Las Plagas, she does not go all messed up and stuff, she turns into Usain Bolt and hammers everyone as if she was on steroids and the one thing that really annoyed me was the acting. Each and every actor in this film sounded "bored" if you know what I mean and it was just a shambles.Cannot believe they are going to make a sixth one, it honestly cant get any worse. No thought was put into this movie, do not watch if you are a hardcore RE fan as you will be bitterly disappointed.Oh BTW, there are spoilers in this review LOL

I'm not quite sure what all the negative reviews are about, except that some were expecting something other than classic Alice and great cgi, this is not a drama or a love story which we have enough of! To me this was a great movie, the script was good,cgi and of course the acting. Mila always comes through and i always love the directors not totally relying on her to carry a movie the other actors were great as well.If you want a crappy love story or some drama which we have enough of yea move on, But if you want an action-packed movie with big explosions blood and some gore with those crazy looking zombie like creatures we all love then by all means sit back and enjoy because this movie delivers.

The movie is plain boring, over kill with slow motion footage, they have wrecked the franchise. Honestly just watch the first 3 and forget the rest, especially this one. It is worse then Resident Evil Afterlife. The movie itself started off looking good with action galore, then that is it. The movie has a mediocre story line, at least the original cast were in the movie (most of them). It completely disbands the original story (along side games) and comes up with some "testing" facility that they are using to test out new creatures. But in saying that, there were not really that many new zombies. No horror / thriller elements either. Please do Resident Evil fans a favor and do not support this garbage of a film.

Review title: This film is bad(Please read this like caps lock on)!!!!
Review_body: This film was so bad i tried to build a time machine just to tell myself not to watch it but i failed just like others so i'm here to warn you.THIS FILM ONLY HAS ACTION AND EVEN ACTION IS BAD I felt like throwing up at the fighting scenes and the guns look like they weight 1000 lbs at woman character's hand.They don't even know how to hold a gun.And they can shoot everyone in the head well that seems legit.And this film has nearly 0 plot or purpose it only has pure but bad action.And most of the scenes are ridiculously bad.And if by any chance you try to watch it.Just close the TV eject the CD flash drive or whatever you have the film on.Then put some gasoline on it then st it to fire.After the burning it throw it out of the window then shout it with a shotgun or if you have one a rocket launcher rpgs are cool too.This is the least you can do for the CD that has this film on it.Summary of the film:Led lights,Legs,Bad slow motion fight scenes.

Review title: Retribution. Few mistakes but great simple Action!
Review_body: I m sure to understand those, who aren't a fan of simple Action. And OK, its not that easy to follow the storyline, if u don't know the games or have been watching the other parts of Resident Evil. But all others i cant understand, what they r xpecting from the new part.From start on, the action, showed in the movie, was fabulous. Its no difference between this movie or the ones before. If u expect a new changed action to the other parts, then u shouldn't watch this, cause nothing has changed. Zombies running over the world after a virus broke out and umbrella is creation new creatures, after the world is almost being destroyed. So u ll see zombie in different version every part and this one showed up a real well made realisation of the game.I really love the scenery "copied" from the game and i think this is the best of the five movies. The hole film took me in his ban from the very first second. Surely the little review wasn't enough to make u understand the hole storyline but, who cares....(only if u don't know the other ones). 90% of this movie are in a well made 3D quality. Surely its possible to make it better(like avatar), but i looked many 3D films before and this is one of the upper league. I just took away one Star cause of some logic mistakes, but if u r a man(or woman) who likes this part of action-,sf-movies or videogames , which don't need a big "wow" storyline u will love this movie. Its just simple but very well done realisation of the video game.For addition: The expendables don't have a big story 2 but there are so many people out there, who love this film too.

Another amazing movie in the Resident Evil franchise. All of the best characters from the previous movies have been reintroduced into the movie, including Rain (Michelle Rodriguez). This movie one of the best, second only to Extinction. Several characters from the Resident Evil games have put into this movie, just like Resident Evil: Apocalypse. Aryana Engineer (Maxine from Orphan) has been introduced as a new character (Becky). This movie follows on from the ending of the last Resident Evil movie, where Alice is aboard the ship Arcadia, and is captured by Umbrella and taken to one of their underground bases, where she is aided by several people to escape. Once again, the Red Queen (Megan Charpentier - Mama) has turned homicidal and attempts to kill them before they can escape.The characterisation within this movie is better than the previous. Becky and Alice build a great relationship together. Overall, I think this was definitely one of the best Resident Evil movies, and I can't wait for number 6!! Hopefully in number 6 we find out what happened to K-Mart and Claire, as they seem to just disappear...I would definitely recommend watching this movie, it's amazing!! :)

Review title: Is it a parody or just the biggest bullsh...?
Review_body: I don't get it. When Resident Evil started off as a PC game, it was all about a virus spread by Umbrella Corporation that turns Humans into Zombies. A new idea for a zombie shooter and it was great. The first Movie was good, real good zombie action with the mutants already known from the game. The plot was well thought and of course not everyone survives. So far so good. But what they made of RE in the sequels is just hilarious. RE:Afterlife had a bad story and bad recessions were well earned. It was a bad story with "twists" that only made the movie even worse. With all this in mind i was hoping for a better fifth part. I was sure the production Team did read all this bad recessions and would try to make up for it in RE:Retribution. But it got even worse! Well if you feel like i did: See for yourself i promise you will be stunned by the incredible stupidity of the plot (can you even call that a plot?!) and the action scenes that make the A-Team look like a documentation. Besides that the shooting is even worse than what the A-Team was doing and they never hit anyone! If you still feel like watching this piece of crap, stop reading here and don't blame me for a ruined evening.Spoiler: Well the "Story" takes off where part 4 ended. Alice gets knocked out and wakes up in her bed with a husband and child, when all of a sudden the zombies attack. Then the Intro and she awakes again in a high security cell in an Umbrella Corp facility. So far so bad. Then someone hacks the security system and brings it down so Alice can escape. She gets help from her enemies from previous RE parts and is told that a Team is heading towards her to help her get away, because she has the weapon that may change the world for good again. Well OK, that seems very normal so all of a sudden Alice and her prevoius enemies behave like best friends. The Escape-run is like a bad PC game: Try to finish the Level, proceed to the next and so on. Oh guess what, the Leader of the Umbrella troopers is Jill Valentine and she is controlled by a kind of mechanical scarab clinging to her breast cage. The thing is nothing fits together: The first encounter with Zombies, well they behave like you would expect them to. But on the next Level you have this giant Mutants that even a 100 bullets in the Head can't slow them down. The next Level is a horde of Zombies with guns, jeeps, bazookas and of course on Motorcycles and they keep firing and guess what? they all miss. Then the new unified rescue team and Alice do a little James Bond Style Car chase with, yes the zombies in the jeeps and Motos chasing them. Obviously the Zombies are somehow controlled and act like a regular army! It gets even worse but i will spare you with more. I just can't tell you all the bloopers and inconsistencies because there are far too many. The dialogs - once again: can you even call that a dialog? - are just stupid. The best joke is the end and if you can't stand watching the whole movie jump forward to the final 3 minutes and have a good laugh. Not even the Matrix-Style fighting scenes and beautiful Milla Jovovich can save this movie. RE:Retribution is marked as horror, action, sci-fi movie. I am missing parody because you can't take this movie serious. Is the Author the same that wrote Swamp Thing? Well Swamp Thing is better...

Please, no more. It's already too bad, this episode of the franchise. Zombies in the fur-hats with machine guns and RPGs at once makes you think about drugs consumed by writers. And there's more: catch-up with the submarine, clones (go home, Palpatine), accurate product placement at the streets of simulated New York, cutting moments from Metal Gear Solid 3 (battle with Mother) and fighting games, Mortal Kombat (infraview) and Soul Calibur (any fight between two ladies using knives, although Alice acted more like Voldo, if you know what I mean), mini-boss with two lives and a huge weak spot, so obvious, that creators should have paint a target on it, Wesker, Plagas from games and anime, castrated Leon, showing the ability of a pick-up master level 99 in Ada, who, hum, moved like android, death forgettable characters, and Michelle Rodriguez in two images, which do not differ too much in terms of wagering - here she's ours, and here's not. And then she's a clone, but the clones will drown, so nobody cares. And a zerg-rush, classic. I find it hard to imagine what will be at the final episode, but there's sure to be a cameo by Schwartz and Willis, it could't do worse. Or just add Chuck Norris, he will kill zombies without looking at them. And at the end let it all be the Purgatory.

This script needed them badly. Absolutely nothing about this film's "story" is intelligent. There are no story arcs, no plot twists, no interesting insights into the Umbrella corporation, no discernible motives of any of the characters; there isn't even anything "scary" or "horror-like" in there. It's just minute after minute of vapid stupidity, interspersed with moments of slow motion or reverse motion. Paul Anderson may be getting paid piles of dollars to "write" and "direct" these monstrosities, but that in no way makes him a professional writer or director.Maybe, Paul--just maybe--everything in the film doesn't have to go 100 miles per hour. Maybe you don't need a million bullets flying, fast glowing cars, hoards of monster targets, and plenty of hard-bodied actors/actresses. Maybe, Paul--just maybe--fans of the Resident Evil series had their fill of this formula after the 2nd, 3rd, and 4th stupid installment. Why not, Paul--why not take your foot off the gas a bit and try some real storytelling? Why not use fewer monsters but make them scary or interesting? Why not use characters who aren't invincible and give them fewer weapons? Why not use some of the suspense and horror that made the video game such a hit? Are you aware that players like me were actually AFRAID to play the original game in the dark? It was actually scary--and not because there were millions of monsters and pretty people spraying bullets everywhere--but because there were few bullets and monsters could really kill you.Resident Evil: Retribution, like every previous Resident Evil film, is just a cut-and-paste job throwing outlines of elements of the games into a world nothing like the video game world. Ada's costume is spot-on and the actress looks very much like the Ada in Resident Evil 4 on Gamecube, but her character--that is, her script and acting--is terrible. She's not mysterious; she's not duplicitous; her only purpose seems to be to eventually give Alice her grappling hook gun. Leon's costume includes the coat with the fluffy collar in Resident Evil 4 as well, but again his character doesn't feel anything like the game's. Barry's costume includes the red vest and the magnum, but his personality is one of a gun-toting adolescent. Barry is supposed to be a reserved, tactical, sage-like soldier, not this "ya-hoo" bad-ass. In fact, one could say that every character is really the SAME CHARACTER in different outfits. Every single character is automatically devoted to the same cause, with the same invincible attitude, just dressed in different clothes. No one is ever scared of anything; no one ever cares if anyone else dies; no one even questions the fact that they're taking orders from Wesker--the primary villain in the film's universe who supposedly now cares about the human race for reasons Paul never even attempts to explain.Other elements of the game are just "thrown in" for no good reason. There's the Las Plagas parasite from Resident Evil 4 which, according to Paul, makes zombies wield guns and drive vehicles while making human clones basically invincible. For the record, the Las Plagas virus in the games was a mind control device that turned a whole town into a kind of cult. Its insertion into the movie furthers the plot in no way whatsoever. It's just "there" inexplicably. Furthermore, amidst a huge hoard of Las Plagas infected monsters in the simulated Moscow setting, one of them carries a chainsaw reminiscent again of a Resident Evil 4 monster. Whereas the chainsaw monster in the game was appropriate due to the fact it existed in a village full of pitchfork and knife wielding villagers, the chainsaw makes no sense in the Moscow setting because all the other monsters have machine guns. Paul just "throws it in" because, well, he thinks it's "cool." Maybe we'll get lucky and some new writer/director will reinvent the series the way the Nolen bros. reinvented the Batman universe after it was destroyed in the late 90s. I encourage anyone reading this to refrain from paying any money to see the next film. The only way to kill crap like this is to starve it of any profitability.

The film opens with a 10 minute slow motion time waster, to be followed by a 7 minute re-introduction, and 80 minutes of painful action scenes. I kept waiting for a plot, but one never came. Not even 3D could save this movie. I gave it 2 stars because it was 3D. If it was in 2D I would have ranked it at 0. I like action movies, but I really didn't care about the characters. I even wanted the little girl to die, because I knew later on it would just slow them down and try to add emotion to it. They have thousands of clones and they just send 6 people. There's a giant explosion at the feet of the 2 female leads which amazingly only blasts in one direction. The cheesy red queen video cuts made me laugh every time. They "have" to go through all these simulated cities (so technically not global) and then later they amazingly find all these shortcuts. I kept screaming "Why don't they just take the submarines up?!" in my head, OF COURSE the red queen is going to cut power "remotely" LOL. Magically plucking off a robotic parasite didn't occur to Alice earlier? It just comes off with a flick of the hand? Jill gets her memory back immediately? You didn't think about all the infected you released into that water and who knows what other Umbrella experiments?? But in the first movie you didn't want the virus to get out...?! Movie SUCKED!!! No plot, but I will say at least they recast Michelle Rodriguez as the bad ass evil chick.Wait for it on DVD in Red Box because it reminds me of the movies that end up in the Red Box without a theatrical release.
I tried, I really tried, but found nothing in this movie worth more than two stars.

Review title: Have never reviewed a movie... but I felt compelled.
Review_body: After seeing this movie and reading other reviews about the film, I feel compelled to write a review myself. I am a big fan of the resident evil genre, video games, and most of the movies. I saw this film the other night, and it's as if I was suckerpunched in the chest by the filmmakers. Now I know, and have accepted the fact that these films have moved far and away from the original resident evil story, and the overall feel for the genre anyways. I have completely dissociated the two franchises in my mind, aside from the theme and the characters they introduce.When I heard this film was being made I was excited to find out they were going to introduce a few new characters, one being Leon S. Kennedy. He has been my favorite character, by far since the installment of Resident Evil 2 and RE 4. In those games, he was the epitome of a zombie/las plagas-killing badass. In this movie, however, I felt that the Directors really did a number on him and did not do his character justice. He first appears on a convoy with some other notable characters, Barry from RE 1, Luther, and some other mercs. The most laughable thing about Leon at this point was his ATTIRE matched EXACTLY to the outfit in RE4, mind you, they are now in Russia where it is freezing cold, Jeans and a pleather jacket w/ some fur on it. I somehow got over it, and pretty much accepted at this point that the filmmakers were going to try and be true to the video games (all of the sudden).Well over the course of the movie, I noticed a mish-mash of RE 4 and RE 5 references. The introduction of Ada Wong, who is wearing the EXACT same outfit as the one in RE4. The Las plagas virus, which does one of two things, makes you invincible, or allows you to be a zombie that can wield a weapon (both staying true to the video game, but being absolutely ridiculous and exaggerated). The random chainsaw guy in the Moscow environment. The awkward "relationship" between Leon and Ada (also exaggerated). And randomly finding grenades in a sack of goo left by the Big Licker(?).Overall, I felt that everything was thrown together with the hope of extending the story of Alice, and giving us a thrill ride on the way. I just couldn't push myself to choke down the terrible dialogue, the cut scenes from environment to environment during crucial action sequences, the sudden cure for a shattered sternum using an IV of what looked like saline solution. Leon's super-human ability to resist the pain of a shattered arm. The ability by everyone in the surviving party to happily cope with the loss of fellow comrades(although they might be used to it by now). The indestructible elevator. The infinite bullet cheat (lucky, no RE ever had that).Hopefully, in the next installment, and the 10 more that will come after that, they choose to leave out video games elements because not only does it just put salt in the wound for Resident Evil fans, it makes for a sloppy story and a poor excuse for a movie.

This review is being written for a very specific purpose. Resident Evil: Retribution actually surprised me! After all, everybody knows what to expect from these movies at this point. The tone shifts from film to film, often the first few minutes of each film destroys the setup from the previous film and then forges onward in a new direction, the acting is generic, the action is stylish and perfectly choreographed to fit the music, etc.But Retribution feels different. In a way, it seems to be created to be a "greatest hits" merger of the previous films. The video game atmosphere of the first film returns but at this point Alice, Paul WS Anderson and the audience are much further down the rabbit hole, and in gorgeous 3D, no less. The word of the day is "trippy".The movie begins with the first of many cinematic ballets summing up the end of the last film and then proceeds to what feels like three separate beginnings: a longer recap than we are used to, a scene that feels like a dream sequence, and a self-referential beginning that borrows from the best of the previous films. RE5 feels the most like a video game out of this series and it starts here with a labored outline of the quests and perils to come. The end results is that the first 20 minutes of the movie start to feel like the cut scenes of a video game rather than good storytelling: start disoriented, loot the environment for clothes and equipment, get quest, get map, join party, etc.The "quest-giver" approach backfires on Anderson, because the set design in this film is absolutely fantastic, and there are an appropriate set of environments and challenges that the characters have to move through in a set time limit (adding to the video game feel). I would have liked to add 'surprises' but there are almost none, because the characters are too well briefed, and so are we as the audience. I realize that it is logical to outline mission parameters in detail, but it does not make for great or suspenseful storytelling, and so Anderson clumsily avoids as many 'WOW moments' as possible which in turn mutes any sense of horror the characters should feel.The final surprising part of RE:5 is just how bad the dialog is. Child actors put the adults to shame (except Milla), and you can drive a truck through the Shatneresque pauses in the stilted delivery of most characters. I have fond memories of the original Playstation 1 Capcom game for their primitive live-action cutscenes and abysmal acting, but that is not something we need to see recreated on the big screen in the year 2012! The stilted delivery was forgivable in some characters because at least we could rationalize that they were mind-controlled, but really it is a blessing that there is very little speaking and so many many action sequences.Because after the first 20 minutes or so, RE5 finally kicks into high gear and refuses to downshift. The director milks every opportunity for slow-motion possible, and we are glad of it because each movement looks fantastic. The deadly ballet feel is present throughout the whole film, and is set to what is probably the best score of the 5 Resident Evil movies. The electronica pulses the action along, and an orchestral touch is not overt until the end where it exists to make each punch, bullet, and raised eyebrow feel epic. For all the movie's flaws, the over-the-top unapologetic action is what we're there to see and Retribution continued to improve in that department. Here's hoping that the next movie capitalizes on Anderson's strengths and turns out to be the orgy of violence that is promised and doesn't try so hard to pretend to have a plot or provide exposition.P.S.: I have tried to avoid spoilers and instead reference only those characters and events that you might expect if you've seen the other movies. But if you haven't see Retribution yet, here is a fun drinking game you might try: quaff each time you see something that is overtly inspired by or is just plain a rip-off of "Aliens"!

Review title: These movies make money... that's all that matters.
Review_body: Why is there no zero in the options? If I could give it -10 I would.I don't have to say anything negative about this movie because others have done it.I would like to say something about the upcoming sequel resident evil the final chapter.That movie is going to suck big time, just like the other ones of this franchise.You might ask, "It hasn't come out yet so how can you tell?"The answer is, judging from previous movies namely afterlife and retribution, you can just see W S Anderson doesn't give a s..t about storytelling. This franchise is Anderson's attempt to keep his wife, Jovobitch, employed.In an interview many years ago, Jovobitch said with a smug face, "We make these movies to make money."The question is, are you going to keep letting Anderson and his wife serve moviegoers this crappy franchise and get your money?Enough said.

It's been a long time since I last saw movies with such a beautiful cinematic and choreography.I just don't understand why people says the story isn't connected or confusing. For me, as I watched all the previous RE before going to cinema and got blown a way of the awesomeness 3D effects (yes, this movie should be viewed in 3D) and the choreography. Looks so connected and the camera angles are well placed. The story also provide the information and view on the whole map which makes you know and well understand on what's going on. Loves the 3D effects.

Review title: One of the worst movies I've ever seen!
Review_body: Wow. I have seen a lot of bad movies but this one really takes it to a new level of awful. I'm shocked that someone managed to convince people to spend money making this crap.I have seen all of these movies at the cinema and every time, with the exception of the third film, I wish I'd stayed home. My fondness for the games seems to cloud my judgement. I'm an idiot.I won't waste my time discussing the bad points of the plot because this film barley has a plot at all.I will say: I laughed at how the actors held and fired the guns in this movie, especially Jill Valentine. She looked like a child pretending to be a cowboy.I laughed at how many old characters they brought back only to kill them off within a few minutes of appearing.I cringed at the same piece of 'dramatic'music played at every opportunity in the movie.I cringed at the level of acting. The guy who played Leon was a joke.As I said, I've seen a lot of bad movies, but I've never wanted to actually leave without seeing the endings. For this movie I stayed only because my friend treated me to the tickets and leaving them there alone would have been rude.This film was awful. If you can see it for free, do so, just to see how terrible it is. If someone actually attempts to make you pay to see it, punch them! Very hard! In the face!

Review title: My wife even liked this one! (3D review)
Review_body: First: I'm trying to keep any spoilers out, but I've marked it anyway, just in case!Second: The RE movies and the games are completely different animals! Trying to compare them is like comparing apples to elephants. Why do the game lovers/movie haters always ask where the "Alice" character came from because she's not in the games. Well, let me tell you. The reason there's an "Alice" in the movies is that she is YOUR avatar that YOU would be playing if this were a game. That's why she isn't in the games. How do you recreate the playable character from a game for every person who played the game? You'll invariably have the: "She doesn't act/look/smell/feel the way she did when I played her in the game." Plus, in games your avatar moves the story along by having a lot of exploration and fighting and running away, where movies have to do that for you.Anyway, I liked this movie. I made sure that I never watched more that 30 seconds of previews because now a days I can figure out an entire move in the 2 minute preview and I hate that! Just tease me and let it go, will you?I went in expecting an action movie with no real plot except to move Alice's character along, and I was right. The action is good; the plot is minimal; the acting is so-so; the 3D is very good, and I liked it. I would rate it below RE-1 and RE-2 (mostly because of Jill Valentine); above RE-3; and even with RE-4 (also seen in 3D).A little way into the movie I looked and my wife and said: "This is like a video game." She just smiled as she hates most video games. But really, it has the: "You must go through these areas to reach your goal" missions. I liked seeing the old characters brought back and then twisted to be good/bad. I didn't mind that some characters were left out. Bringing in Leon was nice and seeing Ada Wong in the red dress was, well, odd! :)OK, the Wesker character is just too much! I don't know why they have him acting like that, but he just rubs me the wrong way. And the ending? is a little weak, like Anderson ran out of ideas and just threw an ending in there. Or maybe he filmed something else and had to put in a Hollywood ending instead.After the movie, my wife said: "I really liked it." From her that is like giving something a 10 out of 10! Especially for an action move. A Sci-Fi action movie. A game-based movie! I can't give it a 10, but it is for me a definite 8! Maybe I'm just happy after seeing that horrible John Carter piece of garbage?
